impactDescription: Notably, in the African context, where Optimism interactions are less common, this experience served as a valuable introduction to the ecosystem. For those accustomed to the Binance chain, the onboarding process was particularly enlightening. It bridged the gap between Binance's P2P transactions and obtaining OETH, showcasing the significantly reduced gas fees on Optimism. This firsthand experience was valuable in promoting Optimism's adoption within the community and highlighting its cost-efficiency.

bio: QuantumFair is a raffle protocol dApp for public goods launched on Optimism.
contributionDescription:
QuantumFair has built a raffle smart-contracts protocol for Optimism. 

QuantumFair smart-contract allows to deposit their prize (an NFT and/or ERC-20 tokens) in a QuantumFair vault. The raffle owner sets out their parameters (ticket price, ticket asset, raffle objective, reserve price, and expiry date). API3 QRNG then chooses the winner(s). The prize and funds are trustlessly transferred to the winner(s) and predetermined addresses. 

QuantumFair has been in development since October 2022. 

Core Architecture:
Vaults: The contract enables secured asset storage for safekeeping during the duration of such raffles.

Raffle: raffle service, enabling players to distribute assets from a creator to the participants in the activity.

API3 QRNG: is a source of randomness for our services.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://arbiscan.io/address/0x881d551384130e05cc39a010aba4fdb703e6afb6#code","description":"Version 0.1 deployed on Arbitrum on October 2022."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x7E0755a50E1C3b2BB8AbECE23F139Be25B8D5348","description":"Version 1.0 was successfully deployed on the Goerli network in June 2023. "},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/txs?a=0x2190A7273F77FF362bcDa4D631535c1d5add1336","description":"Version 2.0, MVP, deployed on the Optimism network in July 2023."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://goerli-optimism.etherscan.io/txs?a=0x39B09858808FcD9D2773976Ede07CD10D10aaec5","description":"Version 3.0, which is to merge. This is on the Optimism-Goerli network"}]
impactDescription:
QuantumFair's impact is in terms of smart-contract development and market focus on Optimism.

Smart-contract finished development on Optimism: 

(1) QuantumFair uses Beacon Proxy contract using MCP in the entry point contract.

(2) The user opens the contract and locks the assets in the dynamic vault.

(3) With the contract in an open state, then users can register themselves as participants by paying or not a specified fee in ETH or a predefined ERC20 token.

(4) After the time is over, the raffle is set to close. The contract makes a call to the Airnode through our requester contract to choose the winner.

(5)Lastly, we retrieve the results and wrap the raffle contract in a finished state.

Market Reach:
(1) We have had 25,200 impressions on X (twitter) in 4 days of going publicly live.

bio: State-of-the-art, secure, and optimised 🐍Vyper smart contract building blocks.
contributionDescription: While there are plenty of Solidity libraries out there, nobody has been working on high-quality, secure, and easy-to-integrate library-like Vyper code. 🐍 snekmate fundamentally changed this! In one sentence: 🐍 snekmate are state-of-the-art, highly opinionated, hyper-optimised, and secure Vyper smart contract building blocks. Or in other words: What OpenZeppelin is for Solidity, 🐍 snekmate is for Vyper. 🐍 snekmate has helped numerous Vyper builders to kick start on the OP stack. Not only does client diversity matter but also language diversity!

impactDescription:
The main impact of 🐍 snekmate are twofold:
1) 🐍 snekmate has built the secure foundations for any Vyper builder to kick start on the OP stack. Did you need an ERC-20 Vyper implementation for Optimism? Use 🐍 snekmate. Did you need some fancy math functions in Vyper for your AMM/DEX on Optimism? Use 🐍 snekmate. To put everything in one sentence: 🐍 snekmate has been the go-to-source for any Vyper code and ensured the security of the contracts with over 16k lines of unit, fuzzing & invariant tests. 🐍 snekmate has ensured that Vyper contracts deployed on Optimism follow the highest security standards and best practices.
2) 🐍 snekmate has become the go-to-source for educating and understanding Vyper code. The entire code base is enriched with explanatory comments, making it easy to grasp.

bio: Vyper is a contract-oriented, pythonic programming language for the EVM
contributionDescription:
Vyper is a pythonic programming language for smart contracts. 

Vyper contracts account for over 7% ($50m) of the TVL on Optimism and secure more than $2 billion across multiple chains for major protocols such as Curve, Lido and Yearn.

The Vyper compiler offers high performance, gas efficiency and produces binaries that are consistently 50% smaller than Solidity.

Vyper is a long-time supporter of Optimism. The team added support for the first non EVM-equivalent version of the OVM in 2020, and has since worked on ways to mitigate issues faced by users unaware of the differences between EVM versions on Optimism and Mainnet.

Vyper's design principles prioritize security and audibility. The compiler is regularly audited by ChainSecurity, StateMind and large protocols working with Vyper.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper","description":"Official repository of the Vyper programming language"}]
impactDescription:
- Vyper's commitment to security through its language design choices and stringent audit process increases the security of the OP Stack.
- Vyper contributes to language diversity on OP, reducing the risk of a systemic failure from overreliance on a single language.
- Vyper compiler's advanced optimizations enhance the efficiency of the OP stack
- Major projects such as Curve, Lido, Perpetual Protocol, Velodrome and Yearn all used Vyper as part of their Optimism deployments.
- Vyper has been used for on-chain analytics API on Optimism. Integration with Jupyter and Python tooling helps onboard new devs. 
- By reducing the size of compiled binaries, Vyper lets developers make more complex contracts without running into the size limitations of the EVM.

bio: Breaking The Ice On DeFi
contributionDescription:
We have designed and deployed a novel utility for NFTs called "Proof-Of-Bridging" which brings increased user adoption cross-chain. These IceBreak-R Quest Badges work by incentivizing our free-mint series on four unique layer-2s. This is an evolution of the learn-to-earn model by which users can gain participation rewards simply for bridging, minting and holding NFTs in our ecosystem. 

The primary goal is to encourage exploration of emerging blockchains and networks by new users by simplifying the onboarding process and/or bridging in. By creating free-mints which also reward the users over time we have aligned the incentives for all participants to drive adoption and curiosity.

Since launching our new Proof-Of-Bridging NFT series only 8 days ago we have already onboarded 19 unique wallet addresses (excluding myself) to the four various layer-2s, all built around the OP Superstack. New user have begun to explore and dig past the surface layers once they have bridged those funds, asking for new dapps and sites to connect to.

The main platform we are utilizing currently is Zora.co, whereby the users can continue to connect with other art projects, mint or have fun with NFT collections. Artists, cross-chain DeFi users and NFT collectors are all benefitting from our concepts and smart contracts by learning how to expand into new territory. Communities from Fantom, PulseChain, Hive and more are already coming together within our ecosystem to branch out to OP Stack.

bio: Allows to see internal message calls and more on Hardhat framework.
contributionDescription:
Problem: 

Debugging smart contracts was a huge pain for smart contract engineers back in 201x era. 

Solution: 

A hardhat plugin called "hardhat-tracer" has made debugging smart contracts on hardhat easier by allowing the developer to see the call tree with parsed calldata/returndata along with events, storage ops, and more EVM opcodes while running the tests. It also gives programmatic access to the trace information for writing more advanced tests.

I've started this in 2019 for my personal use (even before Solidity console.log existed) and this tool was open-sourced as an installable hardhat plugin in 2020. It was again rewritten in 2022 to improve performance and add more features.

It has saved hours of debugging. Hence, it has gained adoption among numerous smart contract teams like 1inch, Aura Finance, Graph Protocol, Immunefi, LayerZero, Lyra Finance, Rainbow Wallet, Rareskills, Stargate, SushiSwap, UMA etc, just to name few who are related to the Optimism Collective.

bio: DappRadar is the gateway for web3 dapps, data, and insights.
contributionDescription:
The team at DappRadar has supported Optimism into its platform since March 2022 by integrating the Optimism chain on rankings pages. Any Optimism dapp developer can list their dapps on DappRadar to showcase their activity to DappRadar’s blockchain-educated audience. This allows users to discover new Optimism dapps and identify the next project to use and invest in, educating and bridging DappRadar users into the Optimism ecosystem. 
Additionally, DappRadar has made more integrations and support for Optimism Collective dapps by integrating the biggest Superchain - Base in August 2023, providing even more insights to users. On top of that, the team at DappRadar created numerous pieces of content to highlight positive Optimism activity within the dapp industry.

bio: I create dashboards, tools, and content to make web3 data easier to navigate.
contributionDescription:
Between the last round and this round, my main contribution relevant to Optimism is creating a multi-chain tracker of all ERC standards. This makes it easier for everyone to understand what an ERC is, and find trending examples of it on any chain.

For example, I believe people have used my dashboard to track down newer ERCs like ERC4337 and ERC6551. For some ERCs like ERC4337, I've done deeper data dives and explanations.

On top of that, I've gone to lengths to explain to people advanced data patterns as well as the modular stack.

impactDescription:
My work sits completely on the education side. I believe that my dashboards and guides help hundreds of analysts and devrel/bizdev/marketing/pm folks better understand and navigate the onchain ecosystems. 

It's hard to quantify my impact, but I do know from word of mouth and testimonials that the work has benefited many inside and outside the OP Collective ecosystem.

bio: Solidly powered seigniorage protocol on Base Chain, pegged to Ethereum!
contributionDescription: Based.Farm has innovatively employed the Optimism (OP) Stack, enhancing Base Chain’s scalability and Ethereum liquidity. Our protocol utilizes Solidly (AerodromeFi) for optimized efficiency, and strategic mechanisms for dynamic liquidity management, reducing volatility and maintaining price stability. Leveraging stable AMMs, we minimize slippage, supporting robust asset pools like BASED-ETH. Our design fosters community engagement, individual strategy optimization, and broader ecosystem participation, driving adoption and continuous activity in the Optimism ecosystem.

Utilizing the OP Stack, we fostered a robust environment for stable asset management, minimized slippage, and mitigated volatility. This has amplified user engagement and participation, strengthening the community and fostering a collaborative ecosystem. Our contributions facilitated a more resilient and diverse DeFi landscape within the Optimism ecosystem, driving adoption and promoting sustainable growth.

bio: A wargame for developers to learn how to break dummy smart contracts.
contributionDescription:
The Ethernaut is a community-driven capture-the-flag wargame that challenges developers of all levels to break smart contracts while learning common solidity vulnerabilities maintained by OpenZeppelin. Each level is a gamified experience where a smart contract needs to be 'hacked'. It is 100% open source and all levels are contributions made by other players.

In the last 2-years we have added 5 new levels, done a complete redesign of the UI, added support for multiple networks incl. Goerli-Optimism, translated the game into 10 languages, added a leaderboard feature and refactored the GitHub repository to host discussions and technical support.

We believe that The Ethernaut is essential in the the training of developers across the Ethereum ecosystem including the Optimism network.
impactDescription:
The Ethernaut is a hub for developers to understand smart contract security. It is also a key resource for new blockchain security researchers entering the field.

In the game, players’ skills are measured and recognized through a public leaderboard where they can link their contact details and build a reputation. Each network has its own leaderboard.

The game is always expanding with a current total of 29 distinct levels, where in each one of them, the player is engaged in a gamified experience that involves researching and exploiting a vulnerability in the contract.

bio: A community initiative to amplify RetroPGF
contributionDescription: At this moment, no one is doing more to support public goods than Optimism RetroPGF. Despite its already immense impact, RetroPGF has yet to reach its full audience. Many potential contributors doing great things for the Optimism ecosystem remain unaware of the opportunities it offers. To bridge this gap we created a community initiative to promote RetroPGF to a wider audience.Our efforts included targeted research & case study generation, educational content creation, active participation in Ethereum events and building an online community. Offline, we sponsored booths at conferences and shared insights on stage. Online, we launched a dedicated Twitter/ X account and newsletter for real-time updates and built a portal showcasing funded projects, case studies and educational resources.

bio: Indexes EVM blockchains using a fully decentralized and local-first stack.
contributionDescription:
TrueBlocks built a fully decentralized, open-source data indexing solution available to EVM-based blockchains (Optimism, Ethereum Mainnet, and others).

Users who want censorship-resistant, private, cheap, and fast access to unquestionably accurate chain data–free of any intermediaries and their direct or indirect costs–use TrueBlocks' local-first software.

TrueBlocks uniquely enables Optimism and Ethereum users of all types to:

- Build complete indexes as it looks for “every appearance of every address on the blockchain,”
- Access pre-built indexes via IPFS and TrueBlocks’ Unchained Index smart contracts, which cheaply and equitably share the index for the public good,
- Retrieve their on-chain data directly, cheaply, and quickly with consumer-grade hardware.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/TrueBlocks/trueblocks-core","description":"Our main code repository"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c9Yx3Niv-Gs","description":"A talk I gave that very well explains our project."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://trueblocks.io","description":"Our website"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://unchainedindex.io","description":"An explanation of the Unchained Index"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://trueblocks.io/blog","description":"Our blog"}]
impactDescription:
TrueBlocks gives users a viable and scalable indexing alternative that:

- Does not compromise on Optimism's nor Web 3.0’s core values of decentralization, open access, and data sovereignty.
- Helps reduce the community’s reliance on web 2.0-like data intermediaries that put us at risk of censorship, user capture, privacy invasion, and rent-seeking,
- Expands the utility of the node software, giving users another reason to run a node, thereby promoting decentralization,
- Inspires node enhancement via EIP proposals and demonstrates how true decentralization can work,
- Better insulate the entire community from regulatory overreach.

bio: European Crypto Initiative is a non-profit crypto advocacy organisation
contributionDescription: EUCI safeguards the public interest by harnessing permissionless blockchains, notably Ethereum and Optimism. Our goal: foster secure innovation by advocating sensible regulations. We urge lawmakers to see the broad societal impact of these technologies. We've fought against harmful regulations, like banning crypto wallets, equating NFTs to securities, or labelling protocols as bank accounts. We explained why these are detrimental and bridged regulatory intentions with the Ethereum community. We've collaborated with global organizations to curb impractical crypto laws because regulation can make or break an industry, and we won't let it hinder this ecosystem.

impactDescription: We've defended the decentralized tech stack. Imagine building Optimism Collective without wallets or registering as a "crypto-asset service provider" to onboard users. We ensured these weren't our reality. We educated regulators that DeFi isn't like TradFi and that decentralization is possible. We trained MEPs in Metamask use and enlightened EU Commission reps about DAOs' utilities.

bio: Empowering Mexico's Ethereum Enthusiasts
contributionDescription:
Our Optimism contributions are tailor-made for the Mexican audience, exclusively in Spanish. We've achieved:

- Informative Twitter Spaces boosting Optimism's awareness
- Twitter threads designed to onboard new users and promote the Optimistic Road to Ethereum Mexico 2023
- A virtual workshop about Optimism
- A significant highlight at Ethereum Mexico 2023, our star event in Mexico City featuring a talk by Mark Tyneway

Notably, we exceeded the objectives of our proposed mission during Season 4 (Optimistic Road to Ethereum México The Event), amplifying Optimism's reach and influence.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethmexico.org/","description":"Optimism appeared as one of the main Sponsors of Ethereum Mexico 2023 + Talk"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1U0mEC892y8oeYPZbzhxf6Z1J_CQrXg2F0XiGB4hr6JI/edit?usp=sharing","description":"12 events in 9 cities, Optimism-centered"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1UfQydz-GKAnyiG-lPy7wq2gVZ3QTi0pnsiOsKUpU_vQ/edit?usp=sharing","description":"4 X Spaces in collaboration with Optimism en Español"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/176_1liqapAMXmUxKv1YbcpFiuoVPswFzh8Cgbik37Ao/edit?usp=sharing","description":"6 X Threads to onboard new users & promote Optimistic Road to Ethereum Mexico"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/ethereum_mexico/status/1703808764040696117","description":"Virtual workshop on Optimism tech & governance"}]
impactDescription:
We heightened awareness within the Mexican community by having Optimism as a prominent sponsor of Ethereum Mexico 2023. Mark Tyneway's insightful talk on the future of blockchain technology piqued interest and extended an invitation to engage with the Collective.

In Season 4, we actively participated in a mission, exceeding the expected impact. While we committed to 4 events, we went above and beyond, supporting local communities in organizing a total of 12 events across 9 diverse cities. Additionally, we exceeded expectations with more X threads and X Spaces than initially projected. Our efforts resonated, amplifying Optimism's presence and reach.

bio: Director of Product at Molecule
contributionDescription:
We're a DAO accelerator for patient communities, and we've crafted two tools on Optimism:

Token Vesting Contract: It allows bounties for patient contributors, ensuring long-term commitment while granting immediate voting rights. This promotes genuine community participation over speculation.

NFT Badges via Otterspace: To meet Swiss regulations, we issue NFT badges post KYC/AML checks for contributions over 1,000 Swiss Francs. The NFTs, with embedded metadata, ensure contributors are verified, making the donation process seamless and compliant.

Your support can amplify our community-driven mission.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xdccb39b5c9ea6827c6da14754ee3c0743e126b01","description":"KYC-AML-NFT"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x761a3557184cbc07b7493da0661c41177b2f97fa","description":"Example vesting contract for hair loss patient community."}]
impactDescription:
At our DAO accelerator for patient communities, our contributions on Optimism have been twofold:

Token Vesting Contract: Deployed on Optimism, this not only saved costs but also optimized transaction speeds. It promotes genuine, long-term community involvement by providing immediate voting rights to contributors, aligning with Optimism's ethos of community empowerment.

NFT Badges via Otterspace: To streamline the compliance process, we used Optimism for efficient NFT minting, ensuring that sizable contributions remain transparent and trustworthy. This approach has showcased Optimism’s potential in regulatory use-cases, further diversifying its applicability.

Our efforts aim to enhance Optimism's community-centric vision.

bio: Hi! My name is Ben, and I manage a crypto marketing agency called Amaretto Labs.
contributionDescription:
Hello! 

During my time working with a DAO called ICHI, my team and I created content describing the benefits of Layer 2s, primarily Optimism. We created educational blog articles and videos that tell people why they need layer 2s, how Optimism builds with the public good in mind, and is cheaper than Ethereum, all while maintaining great levels of security! We think that educating the public on the various solutions in crypto will make the world a better place, and we are so happy to have included Optimism in a few of our pieces of content.

displayName: HER LATAM _ Optimistas Brillando en Blockchain
bio: Latin American women onboarding more women to the Optimism Ecosystem.
contributionDescription:
We serve as a platform for builders and participants to contribute to the Optimism Ecosystem. Our dedication lies in onboarding women (non-exclusively) into the Optimism Collective through:
1. Educational resources, including workshops, newsletter posts, X-spaces, and social media content.
2. Ongoing 1:1 sessions for the community through a dedicated Telegram group, aimed at addressing questions related to Missions, RetroPGF applications, attestations, becoming delegates, and similar inquiries.
3. Additionally, we have served as a platform for hosting in-person events related to Optimism, leveraging our economic and organizational resources. 
4. We've also provided financial support for speakers to attend Optimism-related events.

bio: The Pyth Network is the largest first-party financial oracle network.
contributionDescription:
- Deployed the Pyth smart contract on Optimism mainnet on Sep-09-2022

This Pyth smart contract enables anyone to request and permissionlessly update prices on-chain for about 350 assets — this enables anyone building a DeFi app to integrate a critical piece of infrastructure in its protocol.
To date, the Pyth oracle has supported (that we know of) 10 DeFi applications building on Optimism (Synthetix, Kwenta, Polynomial, Thales, Pika, Lyra, Unidex, Avantis Finance, Pike Protocol). 

- Released its OP/USD price feed to Optimism and 35 different blockchains

For instance, two leading perpetual protocols that use Pyth on Arbitrum: Vela Exchange and HMX, have launched OP markets thanks to the Pyth Price Feed.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xff1a0f4744e8582df1ae09d5611b887b6a12925c","description":"Pyth Optimism Smart Contract"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/pyth-network/pyth-sdk-solidity","description":"Pyth Network Github Repo"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://pyth.network/blog/pyth-launches-price-oracles-on-ethereum-and-optimism","description":"Pyth deployment on Optimism"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://pyth.network/consumers?blockchain=optimism","description":"Pyth Users on Optimism"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://youtu.be/UAFR4c4-DPk?si=ASu5Fn513fXNWsje","description":"Synthetix Case Study Video"}]
impactDescription:
Since deploying on Optimism, the Pyth oracle has become the go-to infrastructure for anyone building DeFi that requires low-latency data — apart from PERP Protocol, all derivatives platform live on Optimism have become #PoweredByPyth ; this amount to close to 99% market share on that segment.

Applications that are #PoweredByPyth on Optimism have initiated close to 500,000 txs on OP mainnet (to update the Pyth price feeds) so that their protocol could properly function. We estimate that about 385 ETH have been spent (either by apps or users’ of said apps) to update the Pyth prices on-chain. As the number of #PoweredByPyth applications increase, and market share of existing applications increases, it is expected to see many more txs initiated to update the Pyth Price Feeds on Optimism.

bio: Dunia ini Fana!
contributionDescription:
The core idea behind retroPGF is to level the playing field between profit-maximizing startups and nonprofit/OSS projects. Profit-seeking entities have an advantage in their potential for an exit, drawing early investment funding and providing incentives for employees. The goal of retroPGF is to create a system that provides the same benefits for nonprofit and OSS projects.

One of the most difficult parts of retroPGF is creating a “results oracle” — the process that decides which projects receive an exit. We want to experiment with many iterations to refine this mechanism, and today, we are embarking on the first.

bio: Synapse Labs is a contributor to cross-chain technology.
contributionDescription:
Synapse Labs has built on top of the OP Stack key new pieces of infrastructure as well as migrated key pieces of the Synapse vision to the Superchain. More specifically Synapse has helped : 

- Research and develop novel ways to incorporate multi-chain into the Superchain vision  
- Create Better RPC infrastructure, and indexing as a public good through OmniRPC
- Development of SYN OP Stack, an implementation of the OP Stack with a built in native bridge
- The deployment of the first SYN OP Stack chain, Synapse Chain, an Optimism L2
- Education and Developer support for new developers to build on top of and expand the Superchain ecosystem

impactDescription:
Synapse Labs is driving more developers to the Optimism ecosystem and making it the center of all Layer 2 activity. So far Synapse labs has:

-Created a developer framework that makes it easier than ever to deploy a chain with a native bridge 
-Offers open source solutions for explorers and and indexing services
-Deployed the first SYN OP Stack chain, Synapse Chain
~2m transactions on Synapse chain Testnet with > 2k addresses
Encouraged projects to move to the Optimism ecosystem

bio: Highly motivate  for create in WEB 3
contributionDescription: I organized an event to share how blockchain technology can be used alongside a data indexing solution like The Graph to build useful applications in a more accessible way. I explained what Optimism is, especially OPSTACK, and how it functions as a layer 2 solution that can deploy Ethereum applications more quickly and cost-effectively. I also provided concrete examples of how The Graph and Optimism could be applied together, such as to create decentralized marketplaces or DeFi apps. With the goal of bringing these technologies to more developers in Latin America, I also shared Spanish-language community channels where people can learn about and get involved in blockchain projects.

bio: Web3 Builder Community in Ghana.
contributionDescription:
Since we launched a few months ago we have had several builder focused events from a round table meet with the EF 1 billion team and our community to short training sessions in various universities in Ghana, optimism featured in a recent training session we had at KNUST.

In the past, founding members of our team has engaged in various web3 focused events in Ghana to help build the community. Notable ones include taking active roles in the organization of the recent EthAccra and Aya hackathons.

Our next strategy now is to convert existing web2 developers to web3 developers. This is the quickest way to start building out a strong community of web3 developers. We are already in touch with existing community of developers who are eager to transition to web3.

bio: BBD is the ultimate destination for reliable, speculation-free blockchain news.
contributionDescription:
Our contribution to Optimism is multi-faceted and centered around fostering a more informed, connected, and trustworthy blockchain ecosystem.

Our commitment to education benefits end users by providing them with accurate and unbiased information. This knowledge empowers them to confidently engage with blockchain technologies, aligning with our aim to take the community away from Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt (FUD) and bring them closer to reality.

Upholding ethical journalism standards also contributes to trust and transparency within the industry, making blockchain technologies, including Optimism, more accessible and appealing to end users.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://blockchainbytesdaily.com/","description":"Badgeholders can learn more about our contributions on our official website."}]
impactDescription:
The contributions of the Blockchain Bytes Daily (BBD) significantly impact the Optimism Collective, nurturing a well-informed, engaged, and interconnected community. BBD offers valuable insights and education to the broader blockchain community, guiding users towards adopting blockchain technologies, including the latest OP stack chains and platforms built upon them. 

Upholding ethical journalism amplifies trust and transparency, bolstering the credibility of projects such as Optimism. 

Furthermore, our developer-centric coverage supports the expansion of the Optimism ecosystem. Overall, BBD has cultivated a more educated, engaged, and trustworthy blockchain environment, aligning with the goals of the Optimism Collective.

bio: Lattice is the team behind MUD, the OSS app framework for Ethereum, and OPCraft
contributionDescription:
[MUD] We have been developing and maintaining MUD, an open-source application framework for ambitious Ethereum applications and Autonomous Worlds. MUD is the core foundation enabling dozens of Optimism and OP Stack projects, including Words3, Primodium, Sky Strife, and Kamigotchi.

[OPCraft] Last year, using the OP Stack and MUD, we built OPCraft — a fully onchain voxel game. OPCraft battle-tested Optimism Bedrock before its release, uncovering several bugs, and raised awareness of the OP Stack's potential in gaming and Autonomous Worlds.

impactDescription:
MUD, our application framework, is open-source and is enabling various projects that run on Optimism or the OP Stack, including Words3, an on-chain infinite scrabble (https://words3.xyz), Primodium, an onchain resource management game (https://www.primodium.com/), Sky Strife, Kamigotchi, and more. It was also the framework of choice at the ETHGlobal Autonomous Worlds Hackathon sponsored by Optimism, ETHGlobal, Protocol Labs, and Lattice that took place in May.

OPCraft, our onchain voxel game, was fully open-sourced and launched on the OP Stack in October last year. In 2 weeks, it saw 3.5m tx (~2x the Bedrock testnet) and helped uncover multiple bugs in the OP Stack. It also showed developers the OP Stack's potential for gaming and complex apps (even featuring in a WIRED article!)

bio: Synpress is an end-to-end testing framework for dApps in the Web3 ecosystem.
contributionDescription: Synpress enhances the quality and security of dApps, protocols, and other Web3 tools. It is a trusted choice for countless dApp projects seeking comprehensive end-to-end (E2E) testing solutions. Many of these projects are closely tied to Optimism, either as direct builds or influential contributors. Our team is committed to providing dedicated 1:1 support to these projects. Furthermore, Synpress serves as the foundational core of OP Labs' Superchain gas monitoring solution, directly impacting the Optimism ecosystem. Since many projects utilize Synpress, we list the most notable ones below.

impactDescription:
Synpress directly impacts the OP Stack as the core engine behind OP Labs' gas monitoring service for the Superchain. We offer dedicated 1:1 support to the team and have incorporated essential features into Synpress to bring this project to life.

Synpress strengthens security in Optimism and OP Chain projects through end-to-end tooling, which reduces issues, hacks, and negative publicity that boosts user retention. In the past year, we've seen a more than twofold increase in weekly downloads and growing demand for our expertise in testing system design. Reliable interfaces drive adoption and satisfaction.

Synpress offers support across all EVM chains. Providing 1:1 assistance to teams, directly and indirectly impacting the Collective, which grows in tandem with the Ethereum ecosystem.

bio: Gas optimization auditing & highly efficient public goods
contributionDescription:
We recently launched Gaslite Drop.

Gaslite Drop is a smart contract and dapp designed to facilitate hyper efficient bulk transfers of ERC20, ERC721, and Native Network Tokens.

Gaslite Drop is entirely open source and welcomes community contributions.

This is our first public good of many that has been deployed on Optimism..
impactDescription:
Gaslite Drop improves the the experience of rewarding and incentivizing your community.

We allow user's to effortlessly, safely, and efficiently facilitate transfers to their end users.

Through our easy to use UI and highly optimized Yul based airdrop contract anyone can bulk transfer assets to anyone.

bio: A weekly newsletter dedicated to delivering news about the Optimism Superchain.
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Superchain Roundup is a weekly newsletter focused on bringing readers the latest updates and developments happening within the Optimism ecosystem.

Each issue covers multiple topics from that past week across the technical, economic and community aspects of Optimism. Past topics covered include governance updates, protocol launches/upgrades, grants/funding announcements, adoption metrics, collaboration news and more. For example, we have extensively covered the recent competition for adoption between different Layer 2 stacks.
impactDescription:
"The OP Superchain Roundup" newsletter has impacted the Optimism Collective in the following ways:

News Updates: The newsletter delivers regular updates on significant events, launches, partnerships, and advancements within the Optimism Ecosystem. These updates are presented in a concise and easily understandable format, ensuring that subscribers stay well-informed and engaged with the latest developments.

Ecosystem Insights: In addition to news updates, the newsletter provides valuable insights, analysis, and commentary on key topics within the Optimism Ecosystem. It covers important discussions such as the competition between Layer 2 stacks, Optimism Governance Seasons, and the app-chain debate. These insights spark meaningful discussions among community members.

What we have done atm:

- Top 3 mints driven which helped artists bring thousand tracks to fan.
- UNWA members are top1 - 10 collectors in many music projects / artists which funded artists in their onchain journey.

We did many educational talking & sharing about onchain music in not only our community but also in many communities in VN. We believe music onchain could bring a good impact to crypto space.

bio: PublicHAUS is the  decentralized governance  layer of the DAOhaus protocol.
contributionDescription: PublicHAUS governs DAOhaus, offering tools like DAOhaus SDK for easier Moloch DAO management. The DAOhaus Monorepo facilitates collaborative development through core, utility, data, and UI libraries. Community engagement is highlighted in events like Haus Party: 12 Days of DAOcember, exploring DAO topics. Community Calls on Discord foster open discussion on DAO/Web 3 topics. The infrastructure and community initiatives drive a collaborative ecosystem, making decentralized governance more accessible and streamlined.

bio: Education-oriented collective built by users for users of Optimism.
contributionDescription:
1. Onboard for 100+ new Crypto users directly to Optimism, from Q1 thru Q4 2022.
2. Curated multiple educational quests. Goal: equip novice users with the tools needed to maintain wallet security and grow chain competence, and encouraging usage of reputable platforms (ex. Velodrome).
3. Rewarded users of Optimism through fair OP distributions, reflecting what was achieved in learning and exploring the Optimistic ecosystem.
4. Joined a number of social spaces to promote Optimism where there was none. (mostly twitter).
5. Increased user's on-chain activity.
impactDescription: For about a year, we've provided educational resources, support and teachings to hundreds users on Optimism. Casually enhancing user's competence conducting themselves on-chain, while spreading the word of optimism and maintaining reasonable expectations through our lenses. My passion here on Optimism came from my passion for DeFi as a whole.

bio: From macro to crypto, I write about stuff that I like.
contributionDescription: As a researcher and data analyst at M3TA, I've contributed to Optimism by creating a dashboard aimed at offering users a comprehensive view of its activities and financial health. Collaborating with my co-researchers at 4Pillars, we've initiated a series on Modular Blockchains. My specific focus lies in Rollup Economics, where I analyze the Cost, Revenue, and Profit Models of layer-2 blockchains, including Optimism, zkSync, and zkEVM. These efforts aim to provide valuable insights into Optimism's economic aspects and its role in the blockchain ecosystem.
impactDescription: My contributions have had a positive impact on the Optimism Collective by enhancing the understanding of Optimism's activities and financial health. The creation of a dedicated dashboard provides Optimism users with valuable insights, empowering them to make informed decisions. Additionally, my work on Rollup Economics, alongside co-researchers at 4Pillars, has contributed to a broader comprehension of Optimism's economic dynamics and its place within the modular blockchain landscape. This knowledge fosters a more comprehensive and informed approach within the Optimism Collective, aiding in strategic planning and decision-making.

bio: Local Bloom hubs build food security, relationship repair, and local economies.
contributionDescription: Bloom Network, in collaboration with Inverter Network, developed a regenerative action bounties system that rewards grassroots participants for doing real world climate actions. Bounty claims are reviewed by an approved regional verifier who has relationships with people on the ground, and tokens are then automatically issued. This on-chain system can integrate with other impact certification tools such as Hypercerts, to boost visibility of local economic sovereignty work to potential funders and supporters. Bloom designed a token engineering model so tokens can additionally be used as a community currency to circulate forms of surplus in cash-poor communities. Grants and profits from Bloom’s social network can flow into local small scale impact projects, in a trusted, transparent way.

bio: Making Web3 Safer for Everyone
contributionDescription:
We've recently launched Wallet Watch, Webacy's real time notification, monitoring, and alerts system, on Optimism. The service has been well loved on Ethereum mainnet (over 25k users, 300k transactions a month, over 150M assets under monitoring), and we are so excited to bring Webacy safety tools to the Optimism ecosystem.

Wallet Watch allows users to monitor all of their wallets and accounts, receiving real time SMS and email notifications whenever ANYTHING interacts with their wallet. This means inbound and outbound transactions, airdrops, royalty payments, and even things like spam drops, drains, and other potentially malicious transactions. We believe knowledge is power. We're so excited to bring these self-custody safety tools to Optimism, making the chain safer for users!
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://dapp.webacy.com/","description":"Our main dapp! Check out the Wallet Watch feature for yourself on Optimism!"}]
impactDescription: Webacy began in order to build better safety and UI tools for users to navigate the blockchain. We found great success on Ethereum mainnet, and were excited to bring our services to the amazing communities and projects on Optimism. After a lot of hard work, its' finally live, and we're so pumped to bring these safety tools to the ecosystem! Now any user on Optimism can monitor interactions, transactions, and assets on-chain, for as many wallets as they'd like! This not only brings more transparency to the space, but it also helps with the entire user experience, trust, and interaction across the communities.
fundingSources: [{"type":"GOVERNANCE_FUND","currency":"OP","amount":1,"description":"Actually None! This would be our first OP received for our work (no 0 option)"}]

bio: Optimism Ambassador, Project advisors
contributionDescription:
Through this application to RPGF, i’ll be covering my involvement at contributing to the Optimism Team to assist/support the onboarding of new projects on Optimism. The support consisted in providing support to project team about Governance (incl. grant), Ecosystem connections, technical information about the OP Stack, co-marketing support, filtering projects for the OP team (whether top tiers or not yet ready) in view of co-marketing support by the OP team, guiding them towards Demo-day on Optimism discord. 

My involvement has been discussed & has been conducted through the support of the Optimism Team

I'm also part of the Ambassador Program on this RPGF round. While being a supet ambassador helped a lot the above, work & impact are clearly different.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/11hNPSbJX20LQHxdiXlRaZE-pr8oigFhaL96MvT5VtvA/edit?usp=drivesdk","description":"Google doc : Register list of individual involvement as an Optimism Advisor "}]
impactDescription:
Easing the onboarding process before, during and after the deployment on OP Mainnet has been key towards successfull launch & growth.

By provoding support such as Grant application process and timeline, i have not only helped projects to successfully apoly for a grant that bootstrapped their adoption, but also lowered the pressure on the OP BD team as they are having too many leads to follow up.

By guiding them on how to increase their visbility towards the OP Community, some have presented their dAPP into the demo-day channel on the OP discord.

Finally, having a point of contact close to the OP Team has also been decisive for projects so that they can focus on project development and have a smooth deployment on OP Mainnet.

With all the EVM-Layer 2 chains, that was a clear value prop.

bio: Share crypto projects
contributionDescription:
Writing and deploying smart contracts may seem challenging at first, but with the right tools and knowledge, writing and deploying smart contracts is easy.
Use thirdweb to write a simple smart contract, compile the code, and deploy the smart contract on the Ethernet network.
impactDescription:
Despite significant improvements in scalability and efficiency, Optimism faces certain limitations and challenges. Understanding these areas allows for a full understanding of Optimism's potential impact and areas for further development.

Optimism's security relies on the underlying Ethernet network. Any vulnerability or attack against Ethernet could affect Optimism, and strong security measures and constant monitoring are necessary to maintain the integrity of the Optimism ecosystem.

The success of Optimism depends on engaging developers and promoting the ecosystem. Providing comprehensive resources and documentation is critical to developer engagement.

bio: The decentralized trust infrastructure of web 3 - on-chain reputation & feedback
contributionDescription:
UTU Protocol has deployed on Optimism to allow Optimism users to review and endorse any arbitrary web domain or blockchain address with a portion of their reputation (UTT) and see on-chain endorsements and feedback (video, text, stars, badges) about the same from their personal social networks. When UTT-staked endorsements help others find services they like (and also endorse with their UTT), the original endorsers earns reputation and $UTU rewards.

UTU on Optimism also lets D-apps built on Optimism integrate UTU's on-chain feedback and reputation mechanism natively in their product on Optimism, staking UTT (our reputation token) and collecting $UTU rewards on OP for staked endorsements that help others get good outcomes.

impactDescription:
UTU lets OP D-apps natively integrate UTU's API/SDK as an on-chain feedback & reputation mechanism, staking UTT (our reputation token) & collecting $UTU rewards, both on OP. UTU helps their users connect, send, swap, stake, and borrow with confidence. UTU brings its own ecosystem of partners (65+), devs (30+) and projects (7+) building on/with UTU, to OP.

OP Users can review and endorse any web domain or blockchain address on OP and see on-chain endorsements and feedback about the same from their social networks. OP users have access to feedback & UTT Endorsements left by UTU users on other chains. Users can and earn UTT and UTU Coin on OP for their contributions to good outcomes for others, based on their endorsements. UTU brings users (1k mainnet, 10k testnet) and community ~20k.

bio: The Keccak hash function, winner of the SHA3 competition and used in Ethereum
contributionDescription:
The Keccak project started in 2008 for the development of the Keccak hash function,
winner of SHA3 competition and used in Ethereum. The project is a multi discipline
effort of cryptography, software and hardware development. All the developments are
open source, no patents and several incentives for 3rd party security analysis. The
project is still active for providing improved implementations.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://keccak.team/","description":"The main website of the Keccak Team, hosting all designs, analysis, and doc"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://keccak.team/keccak.html","description":"The page dedicated to Keccak hashing"}]
impactDescription:
The Keccak hash function, and all its derivations, are cryptographic building blocks for
the good of the society. We believe that open cryptography is a key technology for the
digital society. The security of Keccak is key to the security of Ethereum and of many
other digital projects. We worked a lot in analyzing its security and encouraged third-
party cryptanalysis, with very positive results.
The Keccak hash function is one of the most analyzed cryptographic functions, which gives a very high confidence on its security and resistance against all kind of attacks.

bio: A hub of curated and original insights on Optimism's ethos and vision
contributionDescription:
I established "The Optimism Vision Reservoir", a resource-rich website illuminating Optimism's ethos, values and vision. 

As of Oct10, it includes 42 Entries:
11 Thematic Pages: In-depth exploration of key concepts or Founders' Insights.
10 Ressources on "understanding RPGF".
16 Podcast Summaries: 6 from the 'Retro PGF Podcast'  and 10 from 'Delegate Corner'.
2 Newsletters reviews
3 Thematic FAQs: Covering RPGF (12), Optimistic Vision (6) and Optimism Collective questions (6).

Each piece enriches the understanding of the Optimistic Vision. The Reservoir archives key discourses on Optimism's long-term goals and presents additional educational contents.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://optimism-vision-reservoir.com/","description":"The Website"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/final-create-and-maintain-the-optimism-vision-reservoir/6102","description":"The initial mission proposal, along with updates detailing the progress."}]
impactDescription:
Oct 10th :  Over the last 30 days, The Reservoir has averaged 55 unique visitors daily (see 'Quantitative Impact'.)
Though this number may appear not much, it is honest work ;-) especially given the niche and the limited influx of new entrants. 
'Optimism Vision: Founders Week' campaign on Twitter received attention, with 1649 impressions and 50 likes

The Reservoir also received endorsements from three other OP media outlets - The Optimistic Academy, Web3explorer, The Optimism Guide - each of which has linked to The Reservoir, a testament to the quality of our content.

Beyond tangible metrics, the heartwarming feedback from the community also speaks about our impact (see 'Qualitative impact')

bio: Remix CC is the Chinese community for Remix IDE.
contributionDescription:
The Remix Chinese community can localize Remix IDE into Chinese, providing a user-friendly interface and experience for Chinese users. This enables easier usage of Remix IDE for OP network development and debugging.
The community can provide Chinese documentation, tutorial videos, and articles on Remix IDE, helping Chinese users understand OP network development tools, smart contract writing, and deployment methods. This lowers the entry barrier and promotes wider adoption and participation.
Customized IDE services can be offered to Chinese teams, helping them tailor and optimize Remix IDE for specific application scenarios and business needs on the OP network.
impactDescription: The contributions of the Remix Chinese community can help lower the entry barrier for Chinese users to participate in OP network development, enabling OP developers to engage more effectively in the construction of the OP network, and promoting the flourishing development of the OP network.

bio: Bored Town, a nurturing ecosystem where creativity meets innovation.
contributionDescription:
Bored Town is not just an NFT art community; it's a hub of innovation, support, and artistic growth. With a solid commitment to fostering talent and nurturing the world of NFT art, we've embarked on an exciting journey of empowerment. Thanks to a recent governance grant, we've hosted an exceptional art contest and established our launchpad to showcase participating artists' works.

Our unique approach involves incubating artists from the ground up, regardless of their technical know-how. We provide the knowledge, tools, and nurturing environment for them to thrive. This creates a supportive and safe space for both artists and art enthusiasts within our community. In Bored Town, our members can explore the potential of Optimism Stack while enjoying high-quality art from genuine creators.

impactDescription:
Our progress so far includes 46,000 followers on X, 18,700 Discord members, and over 20 collections across various blockchains, primarily on Optimism, engaging with 28,800+ wallets.

We maintain strong partnerships with protocols like Galxe, Guild.xyz, Clique, QuestN, and Opti.domains. We offer support to around 200 artists from our art contest, with several successfully launching their debut NFT collections on Optimism and OP Stack through our launchpad, receiving exceptional community support.

To date, we've nurtured 8 collections, each with a supply of up to 35k, all minted in less than 2 hours during public events. Our community members consistently receive rewards for minting, holding NFTs, and participating in art contest voting.

bio: The NFT artist introducing Optimism blockchain to Layer1 and Web2 business.
contributionDescription:
I am a graphic designer, writer, and entrepreneur passionate about art. In June 2021, I embarked on my journey as an NFT artist, and it eventually became my full-time occupation, with my projects primarily on the Ethereum blockchain.

In June 2022, I launched my first project on Optimism, recognizing it as an ideal platform for NFTs due to its lower gas fees. I leveraged NFTs to promote businesses and events, using my art and marketing initiatives to attract new users to Optimism. As both an artist and the founder of a pioneering project on Optimism, my work garnered attention from companies and projects in the web2 realm, allowing me to introduce them to the world of Web3 through Optimism Stack.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://app.manifold.xyz/c/boredinblue","description":"Bored in Blue, the collection to promote Optimism NFT on Coinbase wallet.."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://x.com/sorryvrerror_co/status/1676029064002322433?s=20","description":"A post on X to promote Optimism quest on Coinbase wallet."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://x.com/sorryvrerror_co/status/1716658598275862899?s=20","description":"A post on X to promote RetroPGF."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://opensea.io/collection/bored-tarot","description":"Bored Tarot, the collection to collaborate with Galxe."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://opensea.io/collection/the-vintract","description":"The Vintract, the collection to promote SRANN skincare product on Optimism."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://opensea.io/collection/mangmoom","description":"Mangmoom, the collection to promote Mangmoom publishing on Optimism."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://opensea.io/collection/apewarrior","description":"Ape Warrior Redux, the collection to promote young artist on Optimism."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://opensea.io/collection/bored-101","description":"Bored 101, the unique 1/1 NFT collection on Optimism."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://youtu.be/477UdeqmHgI?si=CQ0GPNdDX2v6ynU-","description":"OP Radio interview about my projects on Optimism."}]
impactDescription:
I introduced five companies, namely SRANN, Mangmoom Publishing, Tripster, NFT360, and Starlet, to the world of web3 through Optimism Stacks. I also welcomed NFT projects and protocols from Ethereum, such as Flower Girls and Omnisea, to participate in events on Optimism.

Furthermore, I harnessed my art to promote Optimism NFT and onboard users to Optimism and Base by collaborating with prominent protocols like Coinbase, OpenSea, and Galxe.

bio: Layer2 Tutorials with Funny and Easy-to-understand Diagrams and Animation.
contributionDescription:
MyFirstLayer2 serves as an educational platform geared towards novices eager to explore and engage with Layer2 technologies. 

As suggested by our name, we cater to beginners who are keen on acquiring knowledge and delving into projects associated with Layer2, like optimistic rollup. And beginners also can mint a NFT in Optimism network after completed the tutorial.

Our approach involves the use of humorous and easily comprehensible diagrams and animations to elucidate Layer2 concepts in a fun and engaging manner.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/lxdao-official/myfirstlayer2-frontend","description":"Repository of the MyFirstLayer2 front-end project"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/lxdao-official/myfirstlayer2-contract","description":"Repository of the MyFirstLayer2 contracts project"}]
impactDescription:
Education:
Our Layer 2 project includes a chapter on Optimistic Rollup, enhancing comprehension of Optimism technologies among developers and blockchain enthusiasts, thereby fostering a technically informed community within the Optimism Collective.

Community Growth:
Our accessible educational content fosters an informed and engaged community, enriching the Optimism Collective ecosystem.

Technology Adoption:
Through education, we inspire more developers and organizations to adopt Optimism solutions, expanding its reach and application.

Certification:
Post-course, participants receive NFT “graduation certificates” minted on the Optimism Goerli Testnet, showcasing Optimism's practical application and adding value to their learning experience.

bio: Public goods centric. Active on DAO-endeavors, onboarding and decentralization
contributionDescription:
Onboarding, Governance, fostering Cross-DAO Communication, funding Public Goods and testing mechanisms, augmenting signal to noise ratio online and onchain around public goods.
Onboarding: Helped people mainly from underprivileged regions of Argentina to onboard to Ethereum ecosystem, Proof of Humanity and migrate from custodial services to non-custodial layer 1 (Ethereum) and layer 2 (Optimism and OpStack). Presented incentives alignment, use of blockchain and impact on Public Goods to the community at “Congreso Nacional 1° Edición – Gestión del Agua en Ciudades Sostenibles  “Experiencia de Uso Eficiente del Agua en Distintos Lavados Cotidianos” Villa Dolores, Córdoba, Argentina, Oral Presenter (2022).
Nominated Proof of Humanity to RPGF1.

impactDescription: bosco.eth tested technologies aligned with the optimistic vision while ensuring no-single point of failure for onboarding plans. While being at its infancy, bosco.eth is not reinventing the wheel but testing tools to becoming a decentralized onboarding public goods-oriented flywheel that bridges real world communities from a broad spectrum locally and globally using primarily Optimism and chains at the OpStack such as PGN, Zora and Base. All this while continuing active on governance, promoting and/or providing feedback at mayor public goods protocols such as PoH, ENS, diva, OPTIMISM (+OpStack), SISMO, D_D, etc. bosco.eth aids individuals and communities to explore trusted coordination tools with good UX. We expect smart contract wallets and social recovery will catalyze these endeavors.

bio: The easiest way to create and launch a Nounish DAO on the OP stack.
contributionDescription:
Builder DAO is seeking retroactive funding for the work completed in mid-August 2023 to bring Builder Protocol —our Nounish DAO-launch protocol—onto the Optimism Network (“OP Mainnet”) and other L2 rollup networks built on the OP Stack (e.g. Base and Zora Network). We believe that Builder technology being compatible with all networks built on the OP stack allows for greater proliferation to the OP network.

Leveraging the enhanced transaction speed and cost-effectiveness of OP Mainnet and the OP Stack within Builder, further empowers creators and innovators to deploy and run their own DAOs.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ourzora/nouns-builder","description":"Nouns Builder Frontend"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ourzora/nouns-protocol","description":"Nouns Builder Protocol"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://github.com/ourzora/nouns-protocol/blob/main/addresses/10.json","description":"Builder Protocol OP Mainnet Deployment Addresses"}]
impactDescription:
Since Builder Protocol launched on Optimism in mid-Aug 2023, 13 DAOs have launched using the protocol on OP. 

All DAOs launched on Nouns.Build may be seen by selecting the chain from the drop down button on the right at the following link: https://nouns.build/explore

The creation of DAOs via Builder on OP brings users that are familiar with and engaged in collective governance across the web3 ecosystem. Additionally, as many engaged in the DAO space are technical founders or contributors this engages those already part of the developer ecosystem to interact and build on the OP chain.

The ease of use of Builder Protocol to launch DAOs on OP greatly enhances the end user experience which helps to create a effortless pathway to seamless adoption bringing new users to the collective.

bio: Hedgey is onchain vesting & lockups, as afree public good for teams on Optimism
contributionDescription:
We've helped teams on Optimism to distribute locked and vesting tokens to their team, investors, and community. 

We've also helped these tokens become more active in governance by enabling locked and vesting tokens to participate in governance. 

A specific contribution has been Collab.Land using Hedgey to distribute locked and vesting tokens to their team and investors using our free, onchain token infrastructure. 

In addition to automating the distribution of these tokens to key supporters, Hedgey's contracts have enabled them to also become active in Onchain governance on Collab.Land proposals (via Tally.)

We don't expecting any funding and don't need it for our operations. Any funding we do get will be put back into Optimism in the form of a grant for new ideas launching on Optimsm
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/token/0x73cd8626b3cd47b009e68380720cfe6679a3ec3d","description":"Contract for our VotingTokenLockup PLans on Optimism"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/token/0x1b03d75094884714973f22867359de4b81af2f00","description":"Contract for our VotingToken Vesting Plans on Optimism"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x071f113b36a13cab991ba3e94cd48c27aa148600#code","description":"Example of a voting vault where delegated tokens are sent"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://app.hedgey.finance/nft/optimism/0x2aa5d15eb36e5960d056e8fea6e7bb3e2a06a351/88","description":"Random link to a 50k OP lockup that I think was a grant sent out on our contract"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://hedgey.finance/blog/case-study-collab-land-(team-token-vesting-investor-lockups)","description":"Article on the problem Hedgey solved for Collab.Land"}]
impactDescription: When Collab.Land distributed their team token vesting and investor lockups via Hedgey's contracts, the locked and vesting tokens were given governance rights that could flexibly be delegated and participate in onchain governance via Tally. This helped bring new participants into the collective by allowing the team and investors to delegate/ vote in a way they previously would not have been able to.

bio: Optimism Community Governance Calls and other Community Events
contributionDescription: This submission is for a) Optimism’s official bi-weekly community calls and b) other organized community events including mission pitch sessions, discord discussions, and badgeholder speed networking events. The community calls have provided a central place for updates, discussion, decision-making, and onboarding of new governance members. The additional events have filled communication needs for the community as they have surfaced. The mission pitch session allowed for a rapid display of mission proposals. The badgeholder speed networking provided a necessary medium for badgeholders to network and grow community around their shared commitment to the OP Collective.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/optimism-community-call-recaps-thread/6937","description":"Link to Community Call Recaps and Records"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/optimism-badgeholder-speed-networking-event/6924","description":"Link to Badgeholder Speed Networking Annoucement"}]
impactDescription: These calls have become a pillar of Optimism Governance infrastructure, and have had an outsized impact as the main place where governance decisions are made and important updates and announcements are shared. Many impactful decisions were facilitated by these calls; for example a large number of improvements to missions being implemented in Season 5 stemmed directly from community feedback on call #23. In addition, these calls have helped transition many delegates from new to active-and-contributing by being the go-to place for onboarding. The pitch session for mission proposals aided delegates in making better voting decisions for the batch of missions. The speed-networking for badgeholders fostered connection amongst a diverse group of individuals centered around Optimism.

bio: A Ready-Player-One-like 3D open world platform for gamifying token utilities
contributionDescription:
1. Another World won OP's hackathon prizes and we keep building it into a game-like digital world where players are 3D avatars to continue their web3/NFT adventures. NFTs are game items usable in players' inventory. Tokens can unlock access and gameplay. 

2. Another World is an OP+OP-stack game. NFTs can be acquired as in-game airdrops via Optimism. We built our OP-stack for treasure-hunt battles where players win or lose on-chain items. We also supply in-game $OP airdrops for players who retrieve certain game items.

3. Another World showcases a simplified UX for both web3 and web2 players to enter a 3D world. Web3 players opt-in by typing in ENS at the entry menu while web2 users are free to play using an URL. 

4. Our progress and game sample codes are open-source on GitHub.

impactDescription:
1. We are actively alpha-testing an OP + OP-stack powered digital world with web users and gamers on Epic Games Store and HyperPlay.

2. Another World is bringing Bored Ape Yacht Club members and ApeCoin DAO communities into the Superchain ecosystem through a series of game-related activities and received top votes from the ApeCoinDAO community to fund further experiments.

3. We showcased the shortest path from the official website to entering a 3D world using a web browser. Players can experience the gameplay first before using their wallets.

4. Our open-source code samples (such as Unreal Engine in-game airdrop mechanism and paying on L1 for L2 NFT mints) can bring more game devs into the Superchain ecosystem and reduce the friction of L2 tokens.

bio: A Dune dataset of rollup costs and revenues
contributionDescription:
𝗧𝗟𝗗𝗥
A Dune dataset that makes it easy to query revenues and costs for all OP stack rollups and other L2s

𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
I created a Dune Spell table that has data on rollup 
- on-chain revenues (transaction fees)
- costs (posting data to L1) 
- and raw materials (L1 calldata) of rollups

It automatically updates to support new OP stack rollups.

Here is a demo showing how to query Base revenue using the new Spell
https://youtu.be/T2_j_JlGeDQ

The dataset is a great tool that analysts can use to generate rollup business metrics for OP stack teams and their communities.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/duneanalytics/spellbook/commits/main/models/rollup_economics/ethereum","description":"Github history of the dataset. You can see that I created and updated the spell."}]
impactDescription:
This Dune Spell is an open-source model that makes it easy for analysts to surface useful rollup economics insights and share those with the community. 

It's already being used by popular L2 Dune dashboards with more than 730 stars combined. For example, 
- https://dune.com/niftytable/rollup-economics (built by me)
- https://dune.com/sealaunch/rollups-profits (built by the SeaLaunch team)

The open-source code is also being used by analytics platforms outside of Dune::

"At Artemis, we routinely use the roll-up economics spellbook as a reference to understand how to calculate profit across OP Mainnet, OP Stack chains, and other roll-ups in the Ethereum ecosystem."
- Nirmal Krishnan
  [Head of Engineering at Artemis.xyz]

bio: Liquidity Manager & Optimizer - for V3 CL DEXs and Lending Protocols
contributionDescription:
- liquidity manager & yield optimizer launched 2020. Supported OP Mainnet since 2022
- brought in TVL via unique strategies that automate + inc. yields for users

- Single-Token Vaults: Optimized the leveraged same-token borrow/supply on lending protocols. Attracted users + TVL via our automation and consistent APY, no IL and no liquidation risks. Started with Sonne, then expanded to partner with dForce

- Automated Conc. Liquidity Manager (ACLM) Vaults: Simplified the process in bringing users to V3 CL DEXs - Users easily provide liquidity (no hassle of setting ranges or out-of-range worries) We automate the ranges and positions, offer single-token deposits, fully automated rebalancing

- We expanded to Base Chain this year. Integrated and brought TVL to Moonwell, Sonne, UniV3 and SushiV3

bio: Institutional-grade research collective focused on Ethereum & rollups.
contributionDescription:
Uniting years of experience and deep expertise on infrastructure research & DeFi, we have dedicated 100s of hours towards holistically researching Optimism. Based on our research we have compiled the most comprehensive report that has ever been produced on Optimism, which we provide to the OP community for free as a public good.

On >100 pages we walk readers through:

- Scaling Ethereum
- Modular Thesis
- Rollup Mechanics
- OP Stack
- Superchain
- Key Metrics
- Ecosystem & Community
- Governance & Tokenomics
- Team, Funding & Financials
- Pumpamentals & Risks

The report had a profound impact on the community, educating existing users, inspiring new users to join the OP collective & encouraging developers to build on OP technology. Our impact is evidenced by the metrics of our posts on X!
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://redactedres.substack.com/p/optimism-a-holistic-research?sd=pf","description":"Substack Post of our Holistic Research Report"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/RedactedRes/status/1715431066604028318","description":"TLDR Thread about the Research Report on X"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/zerokn0wledge_/status/1716155282257277221","description":"A Technical Breakdown of the OP Stack based on our Research Report"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/RedactedRes/status/1716161033260478806","description":"Additional Research Insights on the OP Stack's Positioning as a Public Good"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/Louround_/status/1715443283869261914","description":"Announcement of Redacted Research OP Report on X (@Louround_)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/TheDeFISaint/status/1715783152738672708","description":"Announcement of Redacted Research OP Report on X (@TheDefiSaint)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/zerokn0wledge_/status/1715434163162255709","description":"Announcement of Redacted Research OP Report on X (@zerokn0wledge_)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/zerokn0wledge_/status/1716367441721528352","description":"Overview of OP Stack based chains based on Research Report"}]
impactDescription:
Our holistic research educates & empowers users to understand Optimism's technology & ecosystem, familiarizing them with the big potential the tech bears, the limitations it faces & the trust assumptions users are subject to. 

Based on feedback received, this resulted in many new users joining the OP collective & existing users feeling more comfortable to actively interact with the network. 

Also, the granular technical breakdown & ecosystem analysis have proven to resonate well with builders, as it introduces devs to the vast opportunities Optimism's technology & ecosystem provide. Based on talks with builders, our research has inspired a significant # of innovators to start building on OP Mainnet and/or OP Stack.

This profound impact is proven by the strong metrics of our X post(s)!

bio: On-chain analytics platform
contributionDescription:
Parsec Finance is an on-chain analytics platform. We index Optimism (and now Base) data for users of our platform to explore and navigate the on-chain environment. 

Our integration has not solely involved a chain-level integration and support for arbitrary contract analysis but we went one step further: integrating and building custom functionality for native DeFi Apps on Optimism like Velodrome Finance. 

Not only has our integration assisted on chain users in navigating Optimism, our data and dashboards have helped DAOs like Lido to monitor and gauge L2 adoption through flows analysis (linked below in Contribution links).
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://parsec.fi/layout/wilburforce/EN1kcmwE","description":"Dashboard used to help Lido to monitor and gauge Optimism adoption."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://parsec.fi/protocol/velodrome-v2","description":"Custom dashboard for Velodrome Finance, native Optimism DEX."}]
impactDescription:
By offering Optimism data in our platform not only have we exposed our existing userbase to Optimism and widened the funnel for adoption, we have also provided tools for Optimism users to better understand and navigate the on-chain environment. 

Without contextualised and visualised chain data, it can be hard to monitor the success of a given application or chain. Protocols and users alike have used Parsec to construct graphs/tables to monitor adoption/usage metrics and to derive key insights such as the most traded pair on Velodrome Finance.

bio: A scaling solution, developed as part of fully onchain game, Downstream.
contributionDescription:
We have developed a way of practically using ZK Proof technology to execute game logic in client code that is verifiable on-chain. The technique uses Circom SNARK circuits with players' transaction call data used as signal inputs. 

This minimises EVM execution and storage during mutliplayer game sessions and allows players to cheaply claim onchain rewards with proof of the session results generated in their game client.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://mirror.xyz/5p0rt5beard.eth/TG6jFqfYg3vHiX4yBbBuYVHiV2DX7umYmUbOKiRQzFs","description":"Write up of Client Side Proofs, their impact and implementation."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/playmint/exp-snark-combat","description":"Open Source repository implementing an example application of Client Side Proofs"}]
impactDescription:
The kind of games that are viable for writing entirely on chain is constrained by technical limitations and transaction costs. By increasing the complexity of game logic that can be run per transaction, we are opening up the design space available to fully onchain games.

Fully onchain games are a growing branch of decentralised applications and a potentially massive use case for the Optimism echo system. Furthermore, as Autonomous Worlds they are a test bed for the technical and governance structures required for a future of ownerless, composable applications.

Playmint's work on Client Side Proofs was released as a public good and shared with other teams in the space. Since the time of its release the idea of running proofs on clients has been considered a practical possibility.

bio: Web3 Identity management platform supercharging ENS utility.
contributionDescription:
Namespace is a subname management platform that brings customized solutions for ENS name owners (DAOs, collections, communities, individuals, etc.) and offers features that customize the subname managing and selling experience. 

Our platform has started expanding to the Optimism network, aiming to leverage its low-cost environment to mint ENS subnames effectively and store minting preferences on the OP chain by incorporating Chainlink's CCIP, with an option for klaster.io CCIP, to ensure a seamless experience.

bio: World-leading nonprofit research collective for DAOs and online self-governance.
contributionDescription:
Metagov is an 800-member research collective working at the frontier of online governance research and development. Our initiatives significantly align with Optimism's objectives: 

1. Development: Projects including Validator Commons, Web3 Grant Report, DAOstar, Metagov Gateway, DAOscience, PolicyKit, Agreement Engine, CommunityRule, and Collective Voice, have laid the groundwork for advanced governance experimentation.

2. Discussions: Initiatives like the ongoing Metagovernance Seminar since 2020, DAO Harvard, Stanford DAO Workshop, What’s Governing Web3 at RMIT, Building blocks of Web 3.0 at Harvard Law School, and Open Problems in DAOs at various locations, Metagov House @ ETH Denver, residencies such as DAO Palace, have facilitated focused discussions around online governance.
impactDescription:
1. Fostered an 800-member community of researchers, developers, and thinkers, becoming a hub for governance talks beneficial to Optimism.

2. Organized events like the Metagovernance Seminar, DAO Palace, workshops at Harvard, Stanford, NYU, and RMIT, and others that facilitated key partnerships, insights, and collaborations for Optimism.

3. Deployed tools like Govbase, Metagov Gateway, and PolicyKit, advancing governance experimentation and integration of sophisticated online structures.

4. By co-organizing workshops with industry giants like OpenAI and the Internet Archive, promoted DAO governance in industry. 

Through these impacts, Metagov has provided Optimism with tools, insights, and a robust community that collectively drives the evolution of digital self-governance.

bio: Beam is the easiest way to send money to anyone, anywhere. Built on OPStack + AA
contributionDescription: Beam is an attempt at what a Superchain wallet should look like. It solves the user confusion that can result from assets spread across multiple rollups. Beam’s ‘Supersend” feature is fully operational and has already proven that a solution to this challenge exists and that it can be delivered to users in a tool that is fast, cheap and a delight to use — with more than 70,000 users saving access to their Beam wallets.

More than 33,000 users now hold ECO on Optimism, almost entirely through Beam. Beam users are able to access the benefits of using the OP Stack to transfer value globally with low fees, but without needing to worry about much of the complexity that comes with typical crypto wallets.

bio: Jessy’s Hacker House supports a strong community of builders
contributionDescription: Jessy's hacker house is a beacon for engineers and innovators in the Ethereum ecosystem, offering a supportive community to navigate this niche industry. We prioritize our residents, fostering an environment where they can collaborate, learn, and form lasting bonds. Our rigorous selection process ensures we house genuine, curious, and resourceful individuals. We view our houses as a public good, never compromising our values for monetary gain. Living and hacking together fosters deeper connections than casual meetups. We value obsession, genuine curiosity, and resourcefulness. We will include a list of all projects built by our residents.

impactDescription: Jessy's hacker house and the Optimism Collective share a profound synergy in their commitment to Ethereum's sustainable future. While the Collective envisions a world where public goods equate to profitability, Jessy's house actualizes this by nurturing open-source projects. The single requirement for residents of Jessy's hacker house, is that whatever they build, it must be free open source. The house's emphasis on free open-source software resonates with the Collective's retroactive public goods funding, underscoring the belief that true value lies in communal benefits. We challenge traditional notions of profit, advocating for a model where community-driven initiatives and shared benefits define success in the Ethereum landscape.
