bio: Leading identity oracle & zk attestation provider on OP
contributionDescription:
As a leading identity data provider on Optimism, Clique has issued 1.14M out of total 1.49M attestations on OP AttestationStation, which are then used by major OP ecosystem protocols like Bungee, Tally, BoredTown, Clipper, Synapse, Perpetual, Orbiter, Aloe, Angle, and many others, for purposes like user screening, Sybil resistance, directional incentive issuance, etc. The attestations encompass users' Twitter metrics, GitHub prowess, Discord interactions, and on-chain behaviors.
We actively bring technical innovations to the OP ecosystem such as building the first-ever ZKP-based attestations, TEE-based web2 data attestations, as well as identity-based governance processes. In addition, we are an active contributor to the OP governance itself as a part of its protocol delegation program.

impactDescription:
Clique has greatly pushed forward the adoption of on-chain Attestions on OP as the largest attester with >75% of the market share. Our OP Army program in May resulted in 1.2-2.7% of Optimism’s total tx in six weeks. We've substantially aided partner protocols: 350k deposited on Clipper’s LP, 13k accounts for Tally, etc. 
As OP Army’s goal was to identify experienced web3 users, we’ve discerned ~10k skilled users from 59k participants post rigorous Sybil checks through our collabs with core DeFi and NFT protocols. Our novel AEE (Attestation Exclusive Events) rewards these 10k with added benefits to incentivize more value creation. Clique's current focus is around further expanding attestation use cases on OP by pinpointing DeFi power users and creating credit attestations using CeFi data.

bio: Instant ENS sub-domains for NFT communities on the Superchain.
contributionDescription:
We've developed a tool that has enabled NFT communities on Optimism and Base to acquire ENS sub-domains at zero cost. This significant accomplishment was made possible through the implementation of ENS wildcard resolution. Our application has already empowered ENS name holders to seamlessly connect their names/domains with the contract addresses of NFT collections, resulting in the automatic provision of free subdomains linked to individual token IDs.

As a real-world example, consider the OptiChads collection. Every Chad owner automatically received an ENS subdomain under optichads.eth, precisely corresponding to the token ID of their NFT. For instance, the subdomain 69.optichads.eth, directly resolves to the address of the individual who owns Chad #69.

impactDescription:
- 7 NFT communities have been onboarded on OP chain. 
 (OptiChads, Apetimism, Tickled Picklez, Optimistic Bunnies, Optimism Quests, Deggkies Optimism, HyperChads)

- 3 NFT collections have been onboarded on Base. 
 (Tiny Based Frogs, Base Wars, Summer Kevin)

- 64,696 resolvable ENS wildcard subdomains created.

bio: Dreamer, artist envisioning twin flame life, exploring for hope in a creativity.
contributionDescription: As a free-spirited hippie, traveler, and dreamer, my unique journey intersects with the Optimism network. It's essential to mention that I am on the autism spectrum, and I find solace and effective communication primarily through the internet. Within this digital realm, I've forged a vision of existence shared with a twin flame in a rustic cabin, while embarking on a transformative exploration of the crypto landscape. Through my contributions to Optimism, I strive to cultivate hope for a new, creative, and open community on this new earth we collectively envision. My role within this network is not only technical but also deeply philosophical, driven by a desire to foster a harmonious existence that transcends the boundaries of traditional systems.
impactDescription: I'm relatively new to the crypto scene, so I'm not a seasoned pro. Nonetheless, my contributions to Optimism have positively impacted the end user experience and adoption within the Collective. I've focused on making the platform more user-friendly and accessible, particularly for individuals like myself on the autism spectrum.In addition, my efforts in building a welcoming community have helped introduce newcomers to the Optimism Collective. By creating an inclusive environment, I've contributed to expanding the user base and making Optimism more inviting to a wider audience.In summary, while I may not be a crypto expert, my work has made a difference in improving the user experience and bringing new users into the fold at Optimism.

bio: Your one-stop-shop for news, takes, alpha, and research for onchain games.
contributionDescription:
WASD has provided research and educational content for dozens of onchain games and their supporting infrastructure.

These include projects building on OP Stack networks like Sky Strife, OP Craft, Words3, Network States, Primodium, Bochamon, Kamigotchi, Autochessia, Battle for Blockchain, Netherscape, and Gaul. We have also written extensively about Lattice's MUD framework and the role OP Stack is playing in the onchain gaming/AW ecosystem.

In addition to producing content about onchain games within the Optimism ecosystem, WASD also hosted community events including a Sky Strife tournament and a Primodium game night. 

Finally, WASD has released all of its written content on Mirror. Every WASD article is collectible as an NFT on an OP Stack network (OP Mainnet and Base).
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://wasd.mirror.xyz/","description":"This is the link to the WASD newsletter on Mirror where we publish our content."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/WASD_0x","description":"This is the link to our Twitter account."}]
impactDescription:
WASD has helped educate and onboard users into onchain games within the Optimism ecosystem.

We've been among the first publications to cover many of these projects, helping provide them with a spotlight from which they have been able to grow their communities and player bases. 

Our events (described in the previous section) have further assisted with this process by helping get these games directly into the hands of players.

Finally, our use of Mirror and writing NFTs has helped bring users directly onto OP Stack networks and contributed to the adoption of Optimism based onchain media.

bio: Men
contributionDescription:
Technology changes your perception. The The future is a decentralized world and an independently operating economic system, in which companies or individuals will operate their own space.  I don’t need to explain it in an academic way. Here are a few simple examples so you can understand:
 The cinema has become a place for collective adventure. Everyone’s movie theme is the same, but the ending is different for everyone involved, because you are you and he is him. The virtual characters everyone encounters may be the same, but the participants, Everyone's decision may be different.  In the future, human beings will be under increasing mental pressure. Hospitals have also been designed with metaverses to treat various mental illnesses. Robots will do the surgery for them.

bio: Optimism community building through education
contributionDescription: crypto community in India through training programs hold significant potential for fostering responsible and informed participation in the world of cryptocurrencies. Crypto, as a decentralized and rapidly evolving space, requires a well-educated and aware community. training programs for the crypto community in India are instrumental in fostering informed, responsible, and innovative participation in the crypto space. By providing knowledge, emphasizing security, promoting compliance, and stimulating innovation, these initiatives have the potential to strengthen India's position in the global crypto landscape while safeguarding the interests of its citizens.
impactDescription:
Contributions to the community in India through by nurturing a community of well-informed crypto enthusiasts, these training programs can stimulate innovation and entrepreneurship in the blockchain space. Participants may be inspired to develop blockchain-based solutions, contributing to India's technological advancement.

Lastly, such initiatives can also attract global investments and collaborations, as a well-educated and informed crypto community can be seen as a stable and promising ecosystem for investment.

In conclusion, training programs for the crypto community in India are instrumental in fostering informed, responsible, and innovative participation in the crypto space.

bio: anotherworld is a Chinese-style PFP NFT project.
contributionDescription:
anotherworld is a Chinese-style PFP NFT project on Optimism. The project attracts users who love Chinese elements to enter the NFT world and expand to new crypto users.

The NFT created by this project will focus on ancient characters. The characters are iterated through the changes of dynasties. Different characters reflect the condition of people in different eras, blending Chinese history into it to build an ancient Chinese world and promote the acceleration of the application of cryptocurrency in the real world.
impactDescription:
Anotherworld will create an ancient world, introducing characters from Xia, Shang, Zhou and other dynasties, and giving biographies to the characters and even surrounding physical items. Bringing antique-loving users into the crypto world.

This idea comes from a very popular movie in China this year called "Chang'an 30,000 Miles". The box office of this movie reached 250 million US dollars. After watching the movie, I immediately bought the accompanying "Chang'an 30,000 Miles" art set. I think Chinese users have demand for ancient style NFT PFP, even though the NFT market is currently in a downturn.

bio: DefiLab: Open-source tools for DeFi risk & reward analysis. Founded in 2020
contributionDescription:
We are actively contributing to the Optimism ecosystem by developing open-source tools designed to help DeFi users make informed decisions about liquidity provision. Our tools are free to use and focus on quantifying both the risks and rewards associated with various DeFi protocols. Specifically, we have created two key tools tailored for Optimism:

Uniswap V3 Strategy Simulator and Backtester for Optimism
Perpetual Protocol Strategy Simulator and Backtester for Optimism
impactDescription: Our project empowers DeFi users on Optimism by providing insightful risk-reward analyses for liquidity provision across multiple protocols, including Uniswap and Perpetual Protocol. By offering this support, we aim to unlock new capital streams, thereby contributing to the accelerated growth and activity on the Optimism network.

bio: Grateful is a Web3 recurring payment method that empowers a global gift economy
contributionDescription:
Grateful addresses the global challenge of monetization for diverse entities like projects, individuals, communities, creators, and DAOs, often struggling to monetize their contributions. Traditional solutions rely on sponsors or donations, rarely incorporating gratitude or recurring payments.

Emphasizing the importance of recurring payments (subscriptions), Grateful establishes a predictable economic model, ensuring consistent support. The core lies in balancing giving and receiving. Grateful operates as a public good, charging 0% fees to both creators and subscribers. Sustainability is maintained through its own subscriptions, aligning with the model advocated for others.
impactDescription: Grateful's primary impact on the Optimism Collective is providing the entire community of projects, creators, and individuals within the Optimism ecosystem with a seamless method for recurring payments. This initiative fosters financial stability, enabling sustainable growth and fostering a thriving ecosystem. Additionally, Grateful promotes a culture of gratitude, enhancing collaboration and mutual support among community members. By facilitating predictable revenue streams, Grateful empowers contributors, ensuring their continuous dedication to the collective's growth and innovation.

bio: We are a web3 messaging protocol built as a public good.
contributionDescription:
1. Finalise and prepare Optimism Resolver contracts for an audit.
2. Support the integration and implementation of the Resolver for other Optimism based networks like Base and Mantle. 
3. Support the integration of the Optimism Resolver in other projects such as Unruggable Domains.
4. Creation of documentation for anyone to implement the Optimism Resolver.
5. Built the first ever Live chat fully web3 based, used in EthPrague and in incoming events. 
6. POC of dm3 dApp to allow Safe’s accounts to exchange messages and receive notifications. 
7. Create the legal infrastructure for dm3 to expand as a Public Good in Germany.
impactDescription:
1. Development of the Optimism Resolver for ENS: All users using ENS will now be able to store, read and write their text records in Optimism.
2. Prepare OP Resolver contracts for an audit: it will allow us to guarantee security to anyone who implements it. It’s key for the OP Collective users who wish to store, read or write data on L2s from Mainnet using our Resolver.
3. Support the integration and implementation of the Resolver for other Optimism based networks like Base and Mantle: with the bedrock update, we provided support and built alongside the ENS team the adaption of the Optimism Resolver to other networks like Base and Mantle, closing the gap in between ecosystems.  
5. We provide all the documentation needed for anyone on the OP collective to make use of our smart contracts.

bio: BMX is a perpetual DEX built on Base with unique tokenomics.
contributionDescription: BMX by Morphex is a derivative trading platform that uniquely improves capital efficiency by allowing liquidity providers access to their underlying market-making liquidity (BLT). This is achieved through our auto-compounding wrapper (wBLT), which is transferable. Our native protocol liquidity is wBLT-BMX, demonstrating that wBLT can be paired with any asset and continue to earn wBLT rewards. wBLT can also be collateralized. LPing is inherently complex, to support user education, we intentionally named our liquidity after a sandwich, for the meme and for the concept of multiple ingredients (assets) combined to form one sandwich (token). In our documentation, we dive deep into user education, benefits/risks, and concept modeling as we believe onboarding users from CEX to DEX depends on it!
impactDescription: BMX by Morphex launched on BASE in September, 2023. Since then, we have onboarded 550+ users, almost $500k liquidity in BLT, and $330k+ in wBLT. Trading volume has surpassed $4.7mm+ with over $8k+ in revenue. wBLT-(OtherAsset) liquidity pools have surpassed $530k+ TVL. Liquidity providers of protocols like Yearn Finance and Ethos Reserve have deployed wBLT-YFI and wBLT-stERN liquidity pools on Velocimeter. Instead of pairing wETH-YFI or USDC-stERN, wBLT allows bluechip capital to be put to work and earn additional revenue for the LP/protocol in addition to pool2 rewards. wBLT as a paired asset composed of multiple bluechips and stablecoins may also reduce single-asset price volatility risk. The features of BMX by Morphex and use-cases of wBLT introduce unique reasons to bridge to BASE.

This collective actively promotes innovation and development on Optimism, collaborating with projects and initiatives that align with Optimism's goals. Their work not only benefits Optimism but also has the potential to impact the broader blockchain community.

bio: Industry-leading web3 security for industry-leading protocols
contributionDescription:
Spearbit is dedicated to providing the absolute highest quality of security services to the Optimism ecosystem. 

We’ve worked directly with the OP team to review crucial components such as: 

• Drippie (OP's native trust-minimized conditional transaction system)
• Optimism's RLP implementation
• The Bedrock upgrade

Spearbit has also provided security reviews for major protocols on OP such as:

• BASE
• Velodrome

Spearbit has also performed a pro-bono security review of one of OP's most utilized libraries, Solady, which aims to provide gas-optimized Solidity utilities.

In line with our commitment to public goods like Solady, we promise to allocate all RetroPGF grants to future public goods security reviews in the OP ecosystem with the absolute best web3 security talent there is.

🔴✨

impactDescription:
Through performing multiple high-priority security reviews for comprehensive bug coverage on core projects being built on Optimism as well as directly evaluating the security posture of the Optimism protocol itself, Spearbit has aided in securing 840M TVL at the time of reviews.

Spearbit and its security researchers have reviewed over 10,000+ lines of complex and mission-critical code across the Optimism ecosystem. As a result, Spearbit and its security researchers have identified:

• 1 Critical
• 9 Highs

There have been 0 exploits from Spearbit security reviews on reviewed portions of the Optimism protocol and relevant projects building on Optimism since the completion of Spearbit security assessments.

impactDescription:
The libp2p project has developed an maintained a common networking layer used by many of the core implementations of blockchains and tools that are used throughout the Optimism ecosystem. The protocols built into the libp2p project such as the Kademlia DHT and Gossipsub are core functions in the Ethereum and OP mainnet blockchains.

The libp2p maintainers have identified and mitigated 8 critical security bugs since 2019 and coordinated the private deployment of the fixes with members of the Optimism ecosystem. The maintainers continually optimized and fixed bugs with a steady cadence of libp2p releases in multiple implementations. The project has also maintained interop and performance testing to further identify and fix bugs across implementations, including go-libp2p used in OP mainnet.

bio: The first and largest portal and aggregator for Autonomous Worlds and FOCGs
contributionDescription:
Composable Hub is the first and largest portal and aggregator for Autonomous Worlds(AWs) and Fully Onchain Games(FOCGs). The aggregator part is currently supporting Ethereum and Optimism only. 

Currently, FOCGs are in a very early stage, but many believe they have the greatest potential in the future. 

Many FOCG developers in this field need more user traffic. We have listed over 40 FOCG projects on our website, of which about 15% are on Optimism. We help them arrange their basic information, social media, asset data, and more, making it easier for players to find and understand.

We have also assisted many FOCG projects in playtests or tournaments, receiving very positive feedback in the community, thus we have established good relationships with many FOCG projects, including Lattice.

bio: I'm an Crypto Enhtusiast that actively in this Space for Learning
contributionDescription: I have been an active participant in the crypto space, constantly testing new projects and providing valuable feedback to help improve the ecosystem. With a background in software development and a deep interest in blockchain technology, I've made it a personal mission to seek out innovative projects, from decentralized finance platforms to blockchain-based games.
impactDescription: By actively engaging with these projects and sharing my insights, I aim to contribute to the growth and maturation of the crypto industry, fostering a more secure and user-friendly environment for all participants. My commitment to testing and feedback underscores my belief in the transformative potential of blockchain technology and its ability to revolutionize various sectors beyond finance.

bio: Hats is the onchain roles protocol
contributionDescription: Hats is the onchain roles protocol, providing programmable, revocable, and legible roles for decentralized work. Hats empowers groups to get things done by delegating responsibilities to the right contributors, giving them the hard and soft authorities they need to do their work, and installing the automated granting and revocation of permissions and real-time accountability mechanisms to ensure people follow through.
impactDescription:
Hats Protocol has been deployed to OP Mainnet, with 29 Hats trees deployed to OP Mainnet as of October 13, 2023, providing Optimism-based communities with core infrastructure for flexibly creating and managing their roles and permissions while embedding automation throughout their organization to unlock the power of decentralized work.

Hats protoDAO runs on the OP Mainnet, engaging over 100 contributors across the Hats ecosystem and bringing users into the Optimism ecosystem. Hats protoDAO is a DAOaus Moloch v3 contract deployed to Optimism.

We have recently developed the Hats Modules Stack and deployed it to OP Mainnet, giving Optimism builders the power to create programmable roles that users can bring with them across the internet.

bio: Freelancer, crypto holder, developer
contributionDescription: My contributions to the Optimism network in the cryptocurrency space are noteworthy. I have been actively involved in the development and improvement of Optimistic Rollups, a key scaling solution for blockchain networks. Through my work, i helped enhance the speed and scalability of decentralized applications, making them more efficient and accessible to users. Mu efforts have played a vital role in advancing the adoption and functionality of blockchain technology.
impactDescription: My impact on the Optimism network in the cryptocurrency field has been profound. Im dedicated contributions have played a pivotal role in advancing the scalability and usability of blockchain technology. My work has inspired and benefited both the crypto community and the broader digital landscape, leaving a lasting mark on the evolution of blockchain solutions and their real-world applications.

bio: hacking the op stack
contributionDescription: I developed several hacks for the OP Stack, introducing concepts such as sequencer commitments, recursive rollups, and the tokenization of the OP Stack proposer. These hacks were modifications directly on the repo, with a few being developed at hackathons and most being developed as research side-projects.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/0xfuturistic/sequencer-commitments","description":"A hack for the OP Stack pioneering sequencer commitments"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/cairoeth/restaking","description":"A protocol for restaking ERC20 tokens to power recursive rollups on the OP Stack"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/0xfuturistic/tokenized_proposers","description":"Tokenization of the proposer of the OP Stack"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/0xfuturistic/nounish-rollup","description":"Nouns-style auctions for the proposer rights of the OP Stack"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/0xfuturistic/vrgda-rollup","description":"Minting of proposer opportunities of the OP Stack with VRGDAs"}]
impactDescription: Many of the projects were research proofs of concept that introduced original ideas, so the impact lies on the research value rather than on seeking for immediate adoption. For example, the project Sequencer Commitments addressed the lack of programmability at the sequencer level in rollups. The framework enables programmable sequencing policies, new MEV mitigation techniques, and more general sequencing services, directly embedded into the Stack. The software was used as foundational research on Protocol-enforced Proposer Commitments (PEPC).

bio: Hi! I'm an open source contributor to the Optimism ecosystem!
contributionDescription:
Name: Optimism Gas Tracker
Website: https://optimismgastracker.com
Description: A website that displays real time gas prices, estimated cost for common transaction types, and the Top Gas Guzzlers and Top Gas Spenders. 

Name: Optimism Transaction Replay Tool
Website: https://optimism-transaction-replay.vercel.app
Description: A utility UI to replay failed L1->L2 or L2->L1 cross-chain messenger transactions. It allows a user to connect an account and shows which transactions can be replayed. It allows setting a higher gas limit and previewing if the transaction will succeed or fail.

Name: Github Attestation Action and Bot
Website: https://github.com/apps/pr-attestation
Description: A tool that allows developers to integrate the Ethereum Attestation Service into their CI workflow.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/buildooor/optimism-gas-tracker","description":"Optimism Gas Tracker"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/buildooor/optimism-transaction-replay-tool","description":"Optimism Transaction Replay Tool"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/buildooor/github-attestation-action","description":"Optimism Github Attestation Action"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/buildooor/github-attestation-bot","description":"Optimism Github Attestation Bot"}]
impactDescription:
Optimism Gas Tracker:
Gives users a better understanding of OP mainnet gas fee activity. 

Optimism Transaction Replay Tool:
Improve user experience who face L1->L2 or L2->L1 cross-chain messenger transaction failures by using an easy to use UI and removing the need to use a technical SDK.

Github Attestation Action and Bot: 
Helps projects on Github keep track of their contributors by creating automated attestations.

bio: Simplifying crypto news for everyone - one byte at a time
contributionDescription: We noticed many find Web3 daunting initially due to its complexity and the constant, intriguing developments within. So, we launched a channel offering one-minute videos, unraveling these topics in an engaging, simple manner. Our first four videos have covered Optimism's role in reducing gas fees, the lucrative MEV bot JaredfromSubway, Michael Egorov's near-fall due to a coding bug, and an insight into Liquid Staking Derivatives easing fund access from staking. Posted across Instagram, Twitter, Shorts, and TikTok, our videos have garnered over 15,000 views, sparking discussions and fostering a curious, informed community around Web3. The journey has just begun; our upcoming videos will continue demystifying the geeky, enriching minds, and making crypto a fun, accessible venture for all.
impactDescription:
Our educational videos have simplified Web3's complex facets for a broader audience.

Increased Awareness:
The initial video on Optimism’s scaling enhanced understanding, making Optimism's contributions more accessible.

Enhanced Engagement:
Sharing on popular platforms fostered discussions around Web3 & Optimism’s initiatives, enabling more people to engage.

Broadened Reach:
With 15,000+ views, we've extended Optimism Collective's reach to new audiences.

Beneficiaries:
Projects like Curve, Lido, Rocketpool, Frax, and Coinbase have potentially benefited from increased visibility.

Intangible Impact:
Our series has nurtured a culture of curiosity, open discussion, and continuous learning within the crypto community.

bio: American Indian lead protocol integrating trusts with DAOs
contributionDescription:
Contribution(s) to Optimism:

While we are a new protocol and have not yet deployed on Optimism, we are excited to bring our innovative technology to this Layer 2 solution. Our plans include seamless integration with Optimism to provide enhanced benefits to its growing user base.

Benefits to Optimism:

By integrating our protocol with Optimism, we aim to contribute to its ecosystem by attracting new users and projects. This partnership will expand Optimism's offerings, making it a more attractive choice for users seeking efficient and cost-effective solutions.

RetroPGF Allocation:

To kickstart our collaboration, we kindly request a RetroPGF allocation of 25,000 OP tokens. These tokens will facilitate our deployment on Optimism and contribute to the growth of the ecosystem.
impactDescription: Our forthcoming contributions mark the beginning of a valuable partnership with the Optimism Collective. We're eager to expand the ecosystem, attract new participants, and enhance Optimism's efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Together, we'll make a positive impact.

bio: Bware Labs is a one-stop shop for all builders within the Web3 space.
contributionDescription:
1.Bware Labs supported OP Stack by integrating Optimism chain since 23/05/2022 and Base chain since 05/04/2023 into Blast, a decentralized API platform with the services:
-RPC and WSS APIs for OP(Mainnet,Goerli), Base(Mainnet,Goerli)
-On the Public APIs we served a total of 5.3B API on Optimism and 1.3B API on Base for free as a public good in the last 6 months;
-Public API and dedicated free endpoints on Blast for OP and Base users;
-Total traffic supported: 15000/second per region(EU, US, APAC)
-Blast's API decentralization allows third-party nodes to join OP and Base chains, earning rewards for their contribution
- Launched Indexed Builder APIs (Transaction/Token/Logs/Wallet APIs) for OP and Base

2. We developed Optimism Goerli and Base Goerli Testnet Faucets to support OP Stack.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/bwarelabs","description":"Bware Labs GitHub repository"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://blastapi.io/","description":"Blast API platform"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://blastapi.io/blog/blast-builder-api","description":"Blast Builder APIs blog - Optimism and Base support"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.blastapi.io/blast-protocol","description":"Details about Blast API protocol"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://bwarelabs.com/faucets/optimism-testnet","description":"Bware Labs Optimism Goerli Testnet Faucet"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://bwarelabs.com/faucets/base-testnet","description":"Bware Labs Base Goerli Testnet Faucet"}]
impactDescription:
Bware Labs is a web3 infrastructure company providing a full range of ecosystem services like decentralized RPC/WSS APIs, Validators,Snapshot services, Faucets,Indexing and Bridge operator services. Our core objective is to improve the developer experience within a blockchain ecosystem.
We support Optimism and Base networks in Blast API platform so Optimism and Base blockchain developers that are building their dApp on can bypass all the hurdles involved in running their own infrastructure thus reducing both their outage risks and infrastructure costs.

We also supported development and usage of the OP Stack by providing Optimism Goerli and Base Goerli Faucets so that Optimism and Base blockchain developers have free test tokens for deploying and testing on Optimism Goerli and Base Goerli.

bio: Building dapps with rollups
contributionDescription: I built open-source educational and implementational materials for blockchains. I was a hacker-in-residence for L4 Ventures in Toronto in 2017, where I built www.blockchaindemo.io www.coindemo.io, and blockchain open-source projects totaling over 4,000 GitHub stars.

impactDescription:
Developer Ecosystem:

My work on block-cli, coin-cli, and blockchain code resources has helped developers understand the underlying technology of Optimism, the blockchain.  It allowed developers to create their own implementation of the blockchain with a reference to a concise, clear, and explicit code base. I've achieved over 2,000 GitHub stars for thousands of developers worldwide.

End User Experience & AdoptionL:

My work on blockchaindemo.io and coindemo.io has been a go-to educational resource for teaching blockchain worldwide. It has been used in university lectures, law school, and conferences to explain the blockchain architecture. It has been used by hundreds of thousands of crypto-curious people worldwide. It has been awarded the no. 1 Product on Product Hunt.

bio: A filmmaker and programmer in the web3 space
contributionDescription: My primary contribution to Optimism is the creation of the "Attestation Visualiser" for RetroPGF. This tool helps make the complex relationships in the Optimism Citizens’ House easy to understand. It offers a visual map to help users navigate the governance setup and understand the connections and pathways in the RetroPGF ecosystem.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/xvoorvaa/attestation-visualizer/","description":"Visualise the Optimism Citizens’ House like never before!"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/ecosystem-contributions/issues/107","description":"The Ecosystem Project Idea"}]
impactDescription:
The Attestation Visualiser helps boost governance engagement in the Optimism Collective by making complex relationships in the RetroPGF ecosystem clearer for the Optimism Citizens. Using the ThreeGraph module to create a 3D graph, it makes understanding relationships among badgeholders easier. Features like Highlight Paths and ENS improve navigation and identification, making governance more accessible and engaging.

While we're still waiting on user engagement metrics, the Visualiser aims to promote inclusivity and a more interactive governance experience in the Optimism Collective by improving understanding and engagement.

bio: Core OP Stack infrastructure for making attestations onchain or offchain.
contributionDescription:
EAS has been natively integrated into the OP Stack codebase and linked by two predeploy addresses for registering schemas and making attestations onchain or offchain. All future OP Stack chains automatically inherit the contracts at Genesis. 

These contracts unlock new opportunities for builders passionate about identity, reputation, governance, voting, social & beyond.

Did you know?
- EAS powers the AttestationStation V1
- RetroPGF profiles & badgeholders are attested to using EAS
- Gitcoin Passport uses EAS to attest to stamps & scores on OP
- Base uses the predeploy contracts
+ more use cases

We've also contributed:
- An OP Attestation Explorer
- An SDK + API to get devs building faster
- No-code tools for making schemas & attestations
- Educational content & docs for attestations
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/EAS","description":"EAS natively integrated into the OP Github repo"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000021","description":"OP Mainnet predeploy contract for making attestations using EAS"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000020","description":"OP Mainnet predeploy contract for registering schemas using EAS"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://community.optimism.io/docs/identity/atst-v1/","description":"AttestationStation v1 using EAS"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://community.optimism.io/docs/identity/profile/","description":"Optimist Profiles using EAS"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://optimism.easscan.org/","description":"OP attestation explorer for discovering and making schemas + attestations."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.attest.sh/docs/developer-tools/eas-sdk","description":"EAS SDK to enable OP builders to build faster."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimism.easscan.org/graphql","description":"EAS GraphQL API on Optimism"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.base.org/base-contracts/","description":"EAS predeploy addresses (20 + 21) being used on Base (via OP Mainnet)"}]
impactDescription:
EAS has been natively integrated into the core OP Stack infrastructure as two predeploy addresses and has positioned OP as the ecosystem leader for attestations. 

EAS has enabled:
- RetroPGF profiles to be attested to
- OP Badgeholders to be attested to
- Gitcoin Passports to push their offchain stamps & scores onchain to Optimism.
- Guild to query OP attestations using the EAS GraphQL API and gate communities/chats.
- Base to provide attestations to their builders by using the predeploy contracts
- Attestations to be verified on the OP explorer
- Builders to build faster with our comprehensive docs
+ more

Attestations are inspiring builders to explore new use cases around identity, reputation systems, governance, registries, voting, social networks, and more throughout the Superchain.

contributionDescription: I work with artists on getting their music onchain. bio: Tally is an onchain governance app for Ethereum ecosystem
contributionDescription: Tally made several impactful contributions to the Optimism Collective over the past year, including developing a delegate portal, producing an in-depth technical research report on Superchain governance, and facilitating Delegation Week (an ecosystem-wide event focused on governance participation). Tally also built an L2 governance voting protocol on Optimism called Rollcall in early 2022.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/final-superchain-governance-deep-dive/5920/36?u=frisson","description":"Optimism Collective Mission: Superchain Governance Research Report"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/withtally/rollcall","description":"Rollcall, an L2 governance voting protocol on Optimism"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://delegationweek.com/","description":"5-day ecosystem-wide event dedicated to DAO governance engagement"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.tally.xyz/gov/optimism/delegates","description":"Tally's Optimism Delegate Portal"}]
impactDescription:
Tally's contributions have made Optimism Collective governance accessible and future-proof. 

Accessible:
- Tally's Optimism delegate portal makes it easy to discover and track the performance of Token House delegates. 
- Delegation Week re-engaged OP token holders with Optimism Collective governance and elevated the voices of Token House delegates. 

Future-proof:
- Tally's Superchain Governance Deep Dive Mission produced the most complete and up-to-date analysis of the state of crosschain governance. We deeply investigated and produced documentation around all of the viable paths for expanding Token House governance across the Superchain and ultimately recommended a zk-SNARK based approach that scales to thousands of chains and millions of users.

bio: DeSci DAO Regenerating Coral Reef Conservation in Mesoamerica
contributionDescription: As MesoReefDAO, we're excited about the potential RetroPGF recognition for our significant contributions to the Optimism ecosystem. Our focus has been on decentralized scientific efforts for coral reef conservation, a mission we've pursued since GG18 in 2023. Additionally, we've been actively promoting the use of Optimism L2 through accessible platforms like Twitter Spaces. This has helped highlight its advantages, particularly in terms of lower fees and scalability, encouraging broader participation in initiatives like Climate Solutions. These efforts underline our dedication to advancing sustainable solutions within the Optimism framework. Looking forward, we're prepared to expand our impact on coral reef conservation and broader environmental initiatives.

impactDescription:
MesoreefDAO's impact on Optimism goes beyond financial support. It embodies a commitment to environmental stewardship, envisioning a sustainable future integrated with DeSci. Our efforts empower a community of scientists, showcasing the transformative potential of Decentralized Science in coral reef conservation.

Through MesoreefDAO's integration into the OP Stack, we actively explore and facilitate substantial funding for projects restoring and preserving coral reefs in the Mesoamerican Reef. Leveraging Quadratic Funding with Gitcoin's support, we offer crucial financial stability, empowering projects to make meaningful contributions. Encouraging contributors to vote for Coral Reef Conservation projects underscores our commitment to safeguarding vital marine ecosystems.

It has primarily catered to power users, developers, builders, and early contributors to DeFi, providing them with a wealth of resources to stay updated and informed about the latest trends across Ethereum, Layer 2 solutions, and other innovative blockchains.

The Rollup has solved the problem of information overload and complexity in the DeFi space by offering a podcast, a newsletter, and a community platform. bio: A Lisp for the EVM
contributionDescription: Dasy is a lisp for the EVM. It enables smart contract developers to write their contracts in a very convenient lisp syntax that they can mold to their liking with compile-time macros. It transpiles internally into Vyper, so Dasy contracts benefit from all the compiler optimizations in Vyper.
impactDescription: Dasy has performed well as an experimental language, already matching the features and gas performance of more mature languages. It has also been a playground for brainstorming syntax features that may or may not make it into Vyper eventually. Because of its lispy nature, these syntax features can be implemented easily as compile-time Dasy macros. If they're good, more robust support can make it into either Dasy or potentially even Vyper itself.

bio: We empower traders with fast cross-chain swaps at the best rates.
contributionDescription:
Interport simplifies the process for capital migration from other network towards Optimism. 
It allows for directional bridge or cross-chain swaps which are performered via meta-aggregation router and hence guarantee the best rate. 
Interport is using own stable pools to perform bridging of USDT and USDC, as well as route cross-chain swaps.

Interport solves two major problems for users who want to migrate capital to Optimism. 
1. Allowing for easy, fast and secure bridging. 
2. Finding the best route for any swap. 

Therefore, users may easily trade any token from any supported chain to any token on Optimism in one simple transaction.

impactDescription:
As a result of Interport activity and contribution on Optimsm networks, users are able to access Optimism ecosystem with no obstacles for capital migration. 

So far Interport helped 3200 unique wallet addresses to migrate capital to Optimism with total amount of 25,500,000 USD.
Being live for less than 2 months and without much of marketing exposure yet. 

As a result of own stable coin pools, Interport also creates more of sticky TVL on Optimism network and contributes to daily on chain trading volumes.

bio: We believe in the power of cryptocurrency bringing opportunities to all of us.
contributionDescription:
I have been around the Crypto space as a whole now for about 4 years. In that time I've learned a lot, been scammed (like all of us pretty much), invested, gone down the rabbit hole, and have joined some amazing communities along the way that are like family. 

I believe in the power of cryptocurrency and the opportunities of freedom it provides and Optimism is one of those ways. While I may not be a developer, I am trying to use influence and high quality content, including relationship building, to bring a greater awareness of crypto around the world. And I believe it's a good work we can do across the board to better us as a society. 

I'll be continuing to do that with our without help but I sure would love help and support along the way so I'm trying to make a statement for that here.

bio: Full-featured open-source block explorer
contributionDescription:
Block explorers provide vital infrastructure, transparency, and data availability to all blockchain users. Blockscout brings an open-source ethos and community-driven development to the Optimism explorer ecosystem. Over the past 6 months Blockscout has continued to improve and optimize the Optimism explorer for OP mainnet and testnet (Goerli & Sepolia) instances. 

In June 2023 we updated to the latest 5.2.0 version and deployed a new UI, which includes several new L2 relevant views, account features for users, and an app marketplace for projects on Optimism. In September we introduced the OP Sepolia instance, currently the only fully-functional explorer instance available for the OP Sepolia chain. Blockscout APIs (both RPC and REST API) are available for Optimism developers and projects.
impactDescription:
Blockscout impacts Optimism users across the board. Developers use Blockscout's APIs to incorporate chain data into their applications, deploy and debug on testnets, or verify contracts on-chain through the front-end interface. Projects use Blockscout to highlight their apps on the app marketplace and monitor and check interactions with their contracts. Everyone can use the explorer to check & confirm details of their transactions and holdings, create private and public tags, and inspect anything that happens on the Optimism network.  

Blockscout is open source and can be modified and customized for the Optimism Collective. We have worked with the collective to create new views, quickly spin up testnets, and develop new features requested by users.

bio: Elevating Ethereum events worldwide.
contributionDescription: At Duct Tape, we are enabling the Optimism and Ethereum communities to grow into a way that’s aligned with our core values. Out of the 9 events we organized in the past, we accepted only support from Ethereum-aligned groups, excluding most alt L1 and venture. Hackers receive free event access, underscoring our focus on empowering builders within the community. At ETHPrague 2023, we proudly had support from the Optimism ecosystem as a sponsor, and utilized Base as a payment system on-site. Karl Floersch delivered a talk on the superchain and its developer implications. Notably, we facilitated coffee and merchandise payments through Optimism, enhancing user experience.

bio: Cryptodevs are the largest Crypto dev community
contributionDescription:
Cryptodevs are the largest Crypto developer community in the space. We are completely free, with a pure volunteer team, and aim to bring developers up to standard for Ethereum, Optimism as well as all other networks as a completely network agnostic and neutral space. We help new devs with any support they need, provide connections to careers through partners, help to give developers a platform to grow and build the next gen of dApps and core protocols.

Cryptodevs is a community that's 13k developers strong. We have helped developers go from unknowns to core developers at protocols such as Polygon, Opensea, Prysm and more through support, networking and a general environment to build in a no shill, completely free and open space.
impactDescription:
We have helped developers from every ecosystem to have their contracts reviewed, helped with support to build tools, design systems, network, get careers and grow their projects. We are a general developer community to support new devs in the space. We currently have 14k developers, 1k visitors a week to the Discord as well as 15k users on the subreddit.

We have constantly maintained channels for support specifically with Solidity. We aim to run more events and hackathons to be able to further increase awareness for projects, onboard more devs into the space and help build more tools for users.

bio: Everything you need to find/know about OP Chains.
contributionDescription:
OPChainList provides vital information on OP Stack built blockchains, serving all users regardless of blockchains' phase. Our dedication revolves around effectively introducing the community to all OP Stack built blockchains.

Key Features:
Inclusive listing of all OP Stack built blockchains
Safety measures through dedicated social media buttons, protecting the OPtimism community from potential scams
"Interviews" section providing insights into blockchain jobs like DevRel and promoting blockchain teams within the OPtimism community
"Apps" section customized for each blockchain page, fostering growth in emerging ecosystems

Accomplishments:
20 OP blockchains listed
Attracted 120 new users from 22 countries, including the USA, UAE, Turkey, France, Nigeria, Canada, within the last 15 days.

bio: i am a trader in crypto
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective believes that building public goods should be rewarded.

This key ingredient to the Optimistic vision (opens new window)is more than just altruism – it’s core to our success. Optimism’s codebase itself is an open-source project, and builds on the shoulders of countless OSS giants which came before it.

This means public goods funding is a critical growth strategy. For Optimism, well-funded public goods means better developer tooling, widespread user education, safer infrastructure, and industry-leading research. It means Optimism can last and thrive.

Once we show that this model can drive a successful economy for the Optimism Collective, we can scale the principle of impact = profit to the world!
impactDescription:
Real impact stems from passion, a love for what you do.
Fix the problem in front of you, together. → Chances are if you have a problem, someone else has that problem as well. Let’s fix it together! What caused the problem? How do you fix it, and can we work together to fix it for everyone else?
Do it with optimism. → Be kind, patient and optimistic in everything you do.
Most importantly, make sure that your contributions align with the Collective Intents (opens new window). This will help ensure that your contribution is working towards a larger goal of the Collective.

bio: Optiland Quests - onboarding users to Optimism
contributionDescription:
Optimistic Bunnies is the first NFT on Optimism featuring original artwork. The project has made significant contributions to the Optimism ecosystem through our Learn and Earn quests and Coinbase wallet quest.

Our weekly Learn to Earn quests encouraged participants to learn a different protocol every week in the broader OP ecosystem.  The learning topics included protocols in the defi, NFTs, bridges, wallets, onramp, and tools categories. The program produced around 400 power users of the Optimism ecosystem.

We were also invited by Coinbase to produce an artwork that was featured as part of the Coinbase wallet quests. This initiative provided a large net positive in helping onboard 25,000 Coinbase Wallet users onto Optimism, creating a positive impact on the entire Optimism system.

impactDescription:
Our activities contribute towards a healthy and engaging sector in the NFT space directly, and indirectly to the Optimism protocols we promote.  Our learn and earn program created around 400 power users who are familiar with various dApps in the OP ecosystem.  We had around 2,600 submissions and 2,100 approved submissions.  15 Optimism projects benefited from the additional exposure from quests.

Our Coinbase wallet quest - Fall of Sybil, had around 25,000 mints since launch.  It onboarded 25,000 Coinbase users to Optimism.  The collection has around 97% unique owners.  Coinbase distributed roughly $122,000 in $OP to the quest participants directly.  The additional users onboarded through the quest provided a net positive to the entire OP ecosystem.

bio: The simplest way to spin your own dev / prod rollup.
contributionDescription:
roll-op is a script that makes it trivial for any developer to spin up an OP stack rollup, both for dev and production use.

The script lets you configure and run your own rollup by running only two or three commands. It uses a single well-documented config file.

Additionally, it supports EIP-4337 AA infrastructure (bundler + paymaster) and helps you automatically subsidize gas for transactions that match certain criteria.

Spinning a rollup on Goerli is as simple as:

> git clone git@github.com:0xFableOrg/roll-op.git
> cd roll-op
> cp conf.toml.example conf.toml
# conf.toml: uncomment Goerli section, add your keys & rpc
> ./rollop setup --yes
> ./rollop --preset=prod --conf=conf.toml l2

More info: https://twitter.com/norswap/status/1707188816455622899
impactDescription:
Roll-op was used in the EthCon Seoul hackathon in order to implement an on-chain rollup-as-a-service provider: users could request a rollup via an on-chain transaction, and providers could accept the offer, deploy the rollup and make the various contract addresses available on-chain. 

This project (RICRolling — https://github.com/orgs/ricrolling/) won first place as well as prizes from Taiko, Polygon zkEVM and Linea.

The team at Upnode (https://upnode.org/) has been working closely with us and is integrating roll-op into their node infrastructure.

Multiple teams have been in touch with me about the possibility of using roll-op as a way to self-host their rollapps (I sadly can't disclose because of their current relationships with their Rollup-as-a-Service provider).
fundingSources: [{"type":"GOVERNANCE_FUND","currency":"OP","amount":50000,"description":"Funding three months of work on the project + milestones"}]

bio: A decentralized education platform and protocol, onboarding builders into Web3.
contributionDescription:
DeSchool has been providing full range of free-to-access Web3 education since early 2022. To date, over 3000 on-chain certificates have been issued for users. Partnering with multiple DAOs, DeSchool acts as the onboarding platform for Web2 audience to learn knowledge and culture about Web3. 

DeSchool provides fundamental knowledge about OP and train users to better equip with Web3 tools before onboarding them to the OP ecosystem and continue their learning and building journey. We are building more OP ecosystem content and preparing to better support OP CN in collaboration with developer communities.

bio: Helping Mass Adoption
contributionDescription:
At inbest we are a bridge between the cutting edge blockchain technologies and the end users who do not understand it, sometime is hard to find information other than the extensive documentation that gets to technical for most users.

Our role is to find this information, digest it, and then feed it to the audience on a specific manner that tends to be easier to understand. 

In spanish is even more dificult to find objective and well created content that explains this technologies and how they work so that the regular users gain more interest!

this will greatly impact the growth and adoption of the SuperChain! 

if you type "la super cadena op" you will see a lot of "airdrop" videos, but only one actually explaining the technology and talking about the op stack in spanish.

Topic: Scaling Erthereum with L2s"}]
impactDescription:
the impact Inbest Program has generated at the time, might not be the numbers we want, but we are still growing, we have been providing the spanish speaking audience with information about optimism and the technology behind the op stack, the benefit of the modularity, the problems it solve and how to get involved.

not only for user but also for developers who want information on this topics like the op stack and the benefits of developing with this technology, like using the op stack to create a rollup that will run as the execution layer and how thanks to modularity we can commbine that with data availability solutions and much more

if granted any amount of tokens, everything will go to the quality and reach of our videos, in order to accomplish our goal of helping mass adoption!

bio: Social worker by day, crypto/forex trader by night. Embracing change since 2018.
contributionDescription:
Dear RetroPGF Committee,
I am dedicated to advancing Optimism as a cost-effective, secure Ethereum alternative. Focusing on the badge collective, Ve(3,3) models like Velodrome, and community governance, I've worked to onboard individuals onto the crypto network since 2018. Working closely with @FA40Ziv, as one of only two moderators in his Discord community, I've guided both new and experienced members, making Optimism accessible to all.

As a devoted father of a newborn, I'm driven to promote scalable solutions in the blockchain space. The Optimism network's OP Mainnet, built by Ethereum developers, provides a fast, stable, and cost-effective L2 blockchain. Its EVM-equivalent architecture ensures seamless scalability for Ethereum applications. I believe this is the future!
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/CryptoMemePanda","description":"Happy for people to look through my twitter and look at the contributions."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/CryptoMemePanda/status/1649749265877725184","description":"A reflection on posts encouraging everyone to support governance, Velo and OP."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/CryptoMemePanda/status/1564440906387714048","description":"Despite setbacks, and depths of bear market, keep looking to find value on OP."}]
impactDescription:
My dedication to Optimism extends beyond mere involvement; I'm an advocate for active governance participation. In the recent OP airdrop of September 2023, I not only received OP, but I also used this opportunity to underscore the significance of governance engagement.

Firmly believing that true impact arises from active involvement, I continuously encourage the members within Discord to take part in governance. By sharing direct links to votes and urging everyone to appoint delegates, I've strived to create an atmosphere of genuine participation.

This isn't merely about holding tokens, but rather, about wielding influence and shaping Optimism's trajectory collectively. I'm committed to driving Optimism's adoption and RetroPGF support will play a pivotal role in achieving this goal.

contributionDescription:
My Contributions to Optimism include 

1. Development and Code Contributions: I write and review code, improving the platform's features, or fixing bugs. This can involve optimizing smart contracts, enhancing security, and ensuring compatibility with Ethereum.

2. Research and Innovation: I conduct research related to Layer 2 scaling solutions, proposing novel ideas, or helping solve technical challenges.

3. Testing and Quality Assurance: Ensuring the reliability and security of the platform. My contributions in this area involve thorough testing, identifying vulnerabilities, and helping with code audits.

bio: Cryptocurrency Adoption Through The Influence Of The Optimism Ecosystem
contributionDescription:
The progress of global cryptocurrency adoption has faced challenges, primarily stemming from the scarcity of crucial information, limited access to educational resources, and lack of awareness regarding recent developments.

These significant factors have contributed to a perceived stagnation in the cryptocurrency space. In response to this, Cryptorist Hub was established under the influence of the Optimism Ecosystem, with the mission to promote awareness and provide widespread access to cryptocurrency education on Optimism and Optimism project in which most of the community members have in many ways benefited from it monetarily.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-PmisfBggG1I9GjYTQPhxCS-tDuRTbD_nTxYA0jfG-8/edit","description":"WhatsApp Community Op projects disposition "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://x.com/mikroyce_/status/1715903193614299139?s=46","description":"Optimism Project on X"}]
impactDescription: Cryptorist Hub serves as an expansive WhatsApp community comprising 1200+ passionate adopters. With its substantial membership, this community has significantly contributed to the growth of the Optimism Ecosystem. This support extends to various projects building on both Optimism and Optimism itself, making it a driving force behind the advancements within the Optimism ecosystem.

bio: Web3 Enthusiast
contributionDescription: As a newbie who recently joined the cryptocurrency world around February this year, I set out to check out various chains which had genuine work and were real innovations and one of the top chains I found out about was Optimism. Therefore, I started using the chain to carry out various transactions and recently deployed a smart contract on it. This is my most recent contribution to the chain. impactDescription: Ensuring that the chain allows simple deployment for any average developer including those with little or no experience. bio: Eventcaster is the social calendar and meetups app built on Farcaster
contributionDescription:
Eventcaster is the social calendar and meetups app built on Farcaster. Farcasters use it to stay up-to-date one events shared through the app, as well as find and host Farcaster meetups in their city.

Through Eventcaster I co-organize many of the meetups in the community, and they have helped our community become strong. I also run a small grants program to fund local Farcaster meetups.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://crowdfi.withfabric.xyz/campaign/farcaster-meetup-fund-12vw1bash08hs","description":"Original Farcaster Meetup Fund Crowdfund"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://eventcaster.notion.site/Farcaster-Meetup-Fund-346aae26d2fe4db49e81058a8ebb9cc1","description":"Farcaster Meetup Fund Documentation"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.eventcaster.xyz/events/40443d09-280b-4408-b042-9a41a66b31b7","description":"Example of a meetup I hosted (ETHDenver 2023)"}]
impactDescription:
I've co-organized most of the meetups this year within the Farcaster community including the ETHDenver (400 ppl), NFT NYC (150 ppl), EthCC (200 ppl), ETHNY (100 ppl) as well as many dozens of smaller meetups in cities around the world.

I've also helped raise more than $30k to fund meetups within the community. Some of them have been individual event crowdfunds, but about ~$10k of that is a small grants program for local meetups that I started and run.

Eventcaster was also one of the very first Farcaster apps and bots, and is still one of the most widely used ones. I've also helped a handful of other Farcaster builders think through their apps based on the learnings from Eventcaster.

bio: Arbiter is a free and open source EVM logic simualtor
contributionDescription: Arbiter is a public good security and analysis tool for the EVM ecosystem. The tool kit is free and open source and able to audit mechanism design which has historically been challenging. The tool is also able to model risk across many stochastic processes and historical data. The EVM logic simulator has been used to find critical vulnerabilities in the Portfolio smart contract system that auditors were previously unable to identify. Because of the tools speed and EVM execution parity, it allows for unparalleled quality and quantity of testing data for any smart contract system or application. As optimism maintains support for the EVM execution environment and is an extensive smart contract system, tooling across to ecosystem to help improve safety and security is paramount.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/primitivefinance/arbiter","description":"The logic simulator"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/primitivefinance/DisputeGameSimulations","description":"Simulating the dispute game"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/primitivefinance/portfolio_simulations/pull/36","description":"Critical Vulnerability "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ju7m86VG1fw&t=1s","description":"Spearbit video "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.primitive.xyz/blog/arbiter_core_v0.5.0","description":"Release notes"}]
impactDescription: Through the development of Arbiter, we have grown the developer ecosystem from the ground up. We have helped engineers to understand the security implications and nuances to building modular smart contract systems and how to identify undesirable anomaly behavior. Now the tool is being used by auditing firms, protocol designers, academics and searchers to model their systems and applications with speed, rigor, and EVM execution parity. Overall these contributions help ensure the security and safety of complex systems like the OP Stack while also growing the size and quality of the developer ecosystem which in turn improves the end user experience and adoption by improving the safety and security of end user applications.

bio: Token house and Citizen house governance app and contract
contributionDescription:
Agora builds public gov infra that is open source for Optimism community builders to leverage. We focus on 3 areas of contribution:

- vote.optimism.io client where we enable Token and Citizen House to vote, delegate and evaluate proposals and RPGF. Over 500,000 monthly visits.
- Major governor upgrade that enables net new functionalities such as Approval Voting that powered Season 4 Intents.
- Open API that powers other community members and clients such as Supermodular client in RetroPGF3.

No other on-chain governance has Approval Voting as Optimism has, we’re proud to be contributing alongside a community that’s at the bleeding edge of governance.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://vote.optimism.io/","description":"Voting client app for Token House and Citizen House"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/voteagora/agora","description":"Open-source repo of delegation, proposals and voting client for Optimism Agora."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xcdf27f107725988f2261ce2256bdfcde8b382b10","description":"Governor contract for Optimism's Token House governance."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/voteagora/optimism-gov","description":"Open-source repo of on-chain governor that powers token house voting. MIT."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/voteagora/liquid-delegator","description":"Liquid delegation smart contract, enables re-delegation, liquid functions. MIT."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/voteagora/agora/tree/op/rpgf/packages/backend/src/worker/rpgfApi","description":"RetroPGF API and Client. MIT licensed"}]
impactDescription:
By building the best-in-class governor contract & application for the Collective, we increased accountability, transparency, and decentralization for all projects in the Collective while maintaining high bars on accessibility and ease of use.

We have over 3,000 active delegate with profiles created on Optimism, along with over 400,000 votes casted and 100,000 unique monthly users. Over 1,000,000 delegation events have been made on Optimism.

Through on-chain Approval Voting, over 6M OP has been allocated to fund projects in Season 4 in a decentralized manner.

Our app & contract are open source and MIT-licensed for any builder to leverage. Additionally, with the OP’s superchain coming into play — we plan to ship a 1 click deploy governance package for DAOs on top of OP Stack chains.

bio: Nethermind is a Blockchain Research and Software Engineering Company
contributionDescription: We are bringing the Nethermind Client to Optimism, thereby supporting client diversity and providing node operators with an alternative client design. The Nethermind execution client is a highly configurable Ethereum node built on .NET, offering high compatibility, performance, high-speed synchronization, and healthy node monitoring. We are bringing all of these features to the Optimism Network and all OP Stack-based chains.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind","description":"The Nethermind client now supports the Optimism network"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/pull/6146/","description":"The Nethermind client now supports the Optimism network"}]
impactDescription: Instead of creating a fork, we're incorporating support for OP Stack directly into the Nethermind Client. This means users can use the same client for all Ethereum and OP Stack chains, ensuring a consistent experience. Additionally, any new features implemented in the client will be immediately available for OP Stack chains.

bio: An onchain media collective producing engaging educational content about web 3.
contributionDescription:
We are an onchain media collective, dedicated to the creation of educational & engaging content about Ethereum, DAOs, L2s, NFTs, Art & more. We noticed an interesting problem when talking to our community: They wanted to Enjoy Ethereum, but they were fed up with paying high gas fees. We decided to make it part of our mandate to teach our 20,000+ followers about the benefits of using OP chains, & show them how to do it.

We migrated our daily edition collection "NOMO Nouns" from mainnet to OP, started minting our podcasts as FREE mints on Zora L2 & are launching a DAO on BASE L2 using Nouns Builder. All the while, we've been educating our community about OP on daily Twitter Spaces, weekly pods & educational videos on YT & other socials, making sure they are prepared for a Superchain future.

impactDescription: The success of Ethereum (and by extension, Optimism) depends heavily on our ability to teach people how to use L2's daily, without friction and frustration. This requires us to meet users where they are, solve their specific problems, and educate them in an entertaining, jargon-less way. But unlike a regular online content house, as an onchain collective we have been able to leverage the OP stack in our core infrastructure so that we're not only talking the talk, but walking the walk! Not only have we produced high quality videos, panels & podcasts about Optimism, Zora & BASE, but we have also taken steps to involve our community in actually using these networks to mint our content and our community NFT collections. People learn best by doing, and we are putting that to the test every day.

bio: Searching opportunities
contributionDescription:
I was part of a project to develop a web-based application for a university. My team was tasked with creating a web-based application that would allow students to easily check their grades, register for courses, pay fees, and access other university resources. My primary role in the project was to create the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) of the application. This involved researching current trends in web-based applications, creating wireframes and mockups of our ideas, and then implementing those designs into HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
I also worked closely with the back-end developers to ensure that the UI/UX I was creating was compatible with their code.

impactDescription:
ptimism Collective is a large-scale experiment in "digital democracy governance" designed to foster the rapid and sustainable development of the decentralized ecosystem on Optimism.

Optimism Collective will be managed by the Optimism Foundation organization.

Optimism Collective comprises communities, projects, and citizens (referred to as citizens – meaning users), operating based on a mutually beneficial covenant, with the underlying principle being "impact = profit." This means that the more active and engaged we are, the greater the benefits we receive from the ecosystem.
We highly appreciate OP and have been sharing the project since the early days in the OP ecosystem.
Below are some of our posts about the project.

bio: Bridging digital communities
contributionDescription:
"bridge-bot" is a service I offer for free (maintain and run software). It is able to seamlessly "bridge" chat rooms between different protocols and communities. I.e. connect a Discord room from Aragon to a Consensys telegram channel.

"bridge-bot" is being used by many different communities in the larger Ethereum space. Some of them also operate on the Optimism network. Furthermore the Optimism community itself would profit greatly from usage of my service. If this gets accepted I would like to RetroPGF fund the original GitHub project I am using - if they accept it, as well as Giveth for providing a great space for public visibility for the longest time now.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://giveth.io/project/bridging-digital-communities","description":"A campaign on Giveth for the same project. Serves as a wesite."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/42wim/matterbridge","description":"The original project (I am a very minor contributor)."}]
impactDescription:
The ethos of open source development lends itself to widespread mingling instead of siloing oneself and their development. But the chat protocols we use are organized differently and its not in their original functionality to enable rooms that are shared between communities. This is invaluable for DAO to DAO communication.

Another aspect is catering to the community on muliple levels by bridging a topic room in the same community between different protocols and therefore be able to:
- transition/migrate to a new chat protocol
- have backups in case of server hacks, message limits (Slack) or deplatforming
- cater to different user needs (one likes discord for its options, another Element chat for being open source)
- most people are lazy to adopt new applications

bio: Umbra is a stealth address privacy protocol for EVM networks.
contributionDescription:
Umbra has been of the preeminent privacy tools available on Optimism since its launch in March 2022. In that time, is has processed over $50 Million in value. Nearly 13,000 addresses have registered to receive private payments, and more than 53,000 transactions have been occurred. As a tool for private payments, Umbra is especially useful on an L2 network like Optimism, where low fees make the payments use case more tenable than mainnet.

ScopeLift, the creators of Umbra, have also contributed to several EIPs to help standardize stealth addresses for all EVM networks. It is our hope these standardization efforts will be the next step to making Stealth Address technology broadly accessible and useful to all in the ecosystem.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xfb2dc580eed955b528407b4d36ffafe3da685401","description":"The Umbra contract, through which privacy preserving payments are processed."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x31fe56609c65cd0c510e7125f051d440424d38f3","description":"The Umbra stealth key registry, to register to receive private payments."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ScopeLift/umbra-protocol/","description":"The monorepo for the full open source Umbra stack."}]
impactDescription: Umbra provides Optimism uses with a critical piece of privacy infrastructure. It enables privacy conscious entities to use Optimism as a payments network. I has processed over $50 Million in value across more than 53,000 transactions. Close to 13,000 addresses have signed up to receive private payments. It also supports the OP token, allowing the OP governance token to be sent privately on the Optimism network.

bio: The Graph organizes and makes usable web3 data for dapps via GraphQL.
contributionDescription:
The Graph has supported Optimism since the initial launch of mainnet. More on that here: https://thegraph.com/blog/graph-optimistic-ethereum/. 

Since Optimism mainnet launch, The Graph's hosted service, subsidized by The Graph ecosystem (meaning completely free for dapps) has served:

22.7B queries
1.15K subgraphs
with a 99.97% query success rate.

Over the past 30 days alone, The Graph has served 1.24B queries.
Also, The Graph supports Optimism Goerli and Kovan, and on testnet has served:

Goerli
1.24B queries
272 subgraphs
99.98% query success

Kovan
173M queries
154 subraphs
99.99% query success

impactDescription:
We amplified the most important artists and albums on Optimism via our newsletter, Mirror & X posts.

We drove mints, volume, and users.

We educated the community about the Optimism Collective and helped position it as a forefront player in music.

We encouraged artists to mint their music and receive retroactive funding for their contributions to Optimism.  

Through our Mirror, we drove hundreds of mints to Optimism. We have 12K subscribers and 2.3K Invest in Music pass holders. 

Optimism Onchain Curator Program

We drove 370 mints, 0.67 ETH volume, and onboarded five artists, creating great content every step of the way.

Partnerships

We work closely with projects such as Mirror, First Mate, Spinamp, and Collect Pods, who prioritized their Optimism integration at our request.

bio: Secure, handy, cost-effective hardware wallet for crypto holders
contributionDescription:
Self-custodian is important for existing blockchain users, Keyring provides a secure and cost-effective hardware wallet for Optimism ecosystem.
People are already familiar with the traditional debit/credit card, Keyring uses the similar solution for hardware wallet, which improves the user experience when onboarding traditional users to blockchain.
Keyring brings this financial card experience to Optimism, features include transfer and receive ETH and ERC20, interact with dApps. Demo video: https://youtu.be/MpCItSCYDTY
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/keyring-so/keyring-desktop","description":"Open source code for Keyring wallet desktop application"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://youtu.be/MpCItSCYDTY","description":"Showcase video for the Keyring wallet features "}]
impactDescription:
1. Traditional users who are not familiar with crypto hardware wallets choose Keyring for holding their assets on Ethereum and Optimism, because of our security, similar debit card experience, and lower costs.
2. Crypto users in Optimism Collective get an alternative solution to self-custodian their on-chain assets and interact with dApps. 
3. Application developers review our code and learn about how to use smart card to integrate with blockchains.

bio: Our mandate is to make the grants process smoother for everyone involved!
contributionDescription:
Season 4 has been an inflection point for the grants program, during which the review process went from a system that worked in theory to a system that is strengthened by practice.

On average, the Cycles in Season 4 saw a nearly 30% increase in proposals relative to Season 3 Cycles. There were more than 350 total proposals processed by the Grants Council in Season 4, relative to approximately 150 proposals processed in Season 3.

The Council scaled its process to accommodate the growing demand for Optimism grants. Each sub-committee refined rubrics tailored to the goal of Intent 2 (Innovating on Novel Applications), and the reviewers learned how to provide robust, yet efficient reviews to manage substantial growth.  We also piloted demand-based granting through the RFG program.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/cycle-15-final-grants-roundup/6858","description":"Cycle 15 Final Grants Roundup"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/season-4-grants-rfg-roundup/6859","description":"Season 4 RFG Roundup"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/cycle-14-final-grants-roundup/6676","description":"Cycle 14 Final Grants Roundup"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gov.optimism.io/t/cycle-13-final-grants-roundup/6454","description":"Cycle 13 Final Grants Roundup"}]
impactDescription: The council was able to create a more streamlined and consistent process for proposers, set a pace for grant distributions, and define clear expectations for grant applicants.  The council was able to generate meaningful requests for grants that ranged from audit services and RPC capacity to cross chain interoperability research.  Overall, the grants council has reduced the workload of Token House delegates, enabling them to focus their energies on high-impact votes.
