bio: I'm Ejike Mgbebu from Nigeria.
contributionDescription: Optimism is a layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum. Optimism aims to improve scalability and reduce transaction fees on the Ethereum network, enabling faster and more cost-effective decentralized applications. It utilizes Optimistic Rollups, a technology that increases transaction throughput by batching multiple transactions together and validating them off-chain, while ensuring the same level of security as the Ethereum mainnet. By reducing congestion and increasing efficiency, Optimism contributes to a more inclusive and sustainable Ethereum ecosystem. If you have specific questions about Optimism, I'd be happy to help!

bio: Head od Design
contributionDescription:
Conducted an expert review of user experience audit based on Web3 usability guidelines and expert review checkpoints for the following DApps: Curve Finance, Beefy Finance, Velodrome and KyberSwap.

The aim was to assess the platform's alignment with industry best practices, ensuring a seamless and user-centric experience for all users interacting with Web3 technologies.
The review focused on evaluating critical aspects such as platform accessibility, navigation, search functionality, user education, error handling, and the integration of Web3 wallet functionalities. Through a meticulous assessment, several areas were identified that require immediate attention to enhance the overall user experience.
impactDescription:
A good app UX may influence people to use other OP Mainnet apps.
UX Audits help application developers better serve their target audience.
Every audit includes suggestions to improve the Web3 experience of the DApp, developers and product owners can use this information to provide better experiences to their users, increase traffic and DApp usage, which should also reflect to positive user adoption.

bio: A Dune dashboard that presents data on the adoption of ERC4337 Smart Accounts
contributionDescription:
𝗧𝗟𝗗𝗥
Built a Dune dashboard on ERC4337 Smart Accounts. Provides valuable insight for teams building smart account infrastructure.

𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
This dashboard breaks down 
- Overview statistics  (accounts deployed, monthly transactions .etc)
- Bundler Performance (marketshare, revenue .etc)
- Paymaster activity (marketshare, gas spend .etc)
- Application usage by ERC4337 accounts 

It is currently the most popular Dune dashboard for ERC4337 with 410+ stars.
impactDescription:
190k+ ERC4337 accounts have been deployed on Optimism and Base, making the Superchain one of the top ecosystems for smart account activity. 

Most teams building ERC4337 infrastructure use the data from this dashboard to track the category's growth and inform their strategies.

𝗧𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗮𝗹𝘀

“Kofi has substantially contributed to the excitement around Account Abstraction over the last months. Being able to transparently see the continued adoption of Smart Accounts via his Dune Dashboard clearly showed the community the progress this new ecosystem is making.”
Lukas Schor
Founder of Safe

“Kofi has built the go-to dashboard for all ERC4337 data. I check it all the time!”
Kristof Gazso
Co-author of EIP4337
Founder of Pimlico [ERC4337 Bundler and Paymaster provider]

bio: Uniswap V3 Pool Manager.
contributionDescription: I built and maintain seedle.finance. It's a tool for tracking performance and managing Uniswap V3 positions. With Seedle, LPs can easily see the fee APYs, net gains (including impermanent losses), and full transaction history of the positions (incl. gas fees). Also, they can use Seedle to swap & add liquidity to positions easily.
impactDescription:
* Seedle added support for Optimism as soon as Uniswap V3 launched on Optimism.
* It was also one of the first UIs that showed positions across networks, which promoted Optimism for LPs who haven't discovered it before.
* Seedle also includes gas costs when calculating position gains, this helps LPs to choose between mainnet and L2s when deploying their liquidity.

I also did a couple of YT educational videos for 28k followers on how to use Velo website.

Assisted with developer inquiries and ecosystem products, earning unanimous acclaim.

I also hosted a podcast interviewing builders on Farcaster. Finally I hosted a meetup for Farcaster builders in SF and over 30 people attended.

bio: Web3 education and culture for over 75 million Pidgin speakers in Africa/beyond
contributionDescription:
Increased Optimism awareness, adoption and participation among pidgin speakers across Africa and beyond. 

We created series of content that explained Layer 2 and Optimism  in a clear and simple way that pidgin speakers can understand across Africa/beyond. We also provide practical examples and use cases that shows how Optimism and the Layer 2  can solve real problems or create value for Africans. All these were done with the use of Pidgin language, which is widely spoken and understood by millions of Africans across different countries.
impactDescription:
Pidgin Parlour helped lots of pidgin speakers in Africa to understand Optimism easily using Pidgin language. We used podcasts, blogs, and newsletters to explain complex things around Optimism. We showed how Optimism could solve real problems for Africans with simple examples. We translated important optimism content to Pidgin so more people could understand.

We also educated and inspired Pidgin speakers to use Optimism and its tech. We talked about how to use OP tokens, join communities, and more. Our goal was to include everyone and make sure Pidgin speakers felt confident using Optimism and participating in the collective.

bio: Kwenta is a perpetual futures exchange on Optimism
contributionDescription:
Kwenta has grown to one of the largest perps DEXes by volume, and has helped onboard thousands of users, both large and small, to the Optimism ecosystem.

Although we believe this contribution alone is valuable, we are particularly proud of Kwenta's work being published entirely open source, both backend and frontend. Our work has served as a blueprint for other builders in the space, including Rage Trade, a project which previously integrated only GMX on Arbitrum. Our open source Python SDK was cited as one of the tools they used to build their integration on Optimism. 

We've also worked directly with integrators such as Tradao, STFX, and Copin to provide marketing, business development, and technical support to build the Optimism community.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/Kwenta","description":"The Kwenta Github has the source for our frontend, python SDK, and governance"}]
impactDescription:
Through the onboarding of users, community developers, and ecosystem partners, Kwenta has contributed significantly to growth and activity on the Optimism chain, and participation in the wider ecosystem.

Our commitment to building open source tools and our encouragement to other developers to share and build on collective work has helped give Optimism a reputation as one of the best places to innovate in the onchain derivatives space.

We facilitate thousands of trades per day in v2 alone, leading to millions of individual transactions on OP.

bio: Hildr is an OP Stack rollup client written in latest Java with GraalVM native.
contributionDescription: For OP rollup client diversity, I created Hildr project which implemented OP rollup client with Java. It already supported Bedrock mainnet, testnet and Base mainnet, testnet. It is the third rollup client implementation besides the official Go version and a16z Rust version.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/optimism-java/hildr","description":"Hildr is an OP Stack rollup client written in latest Java with GraalVM native."}]
impactDescription: AFAIK OP stack is the first L2 rollup which support and encourage client diversity, which is important for decentralized. A16Z team build Magi which is the first non official client written   in Rust. Then we build Hildr which is the second non official client written in Java. Hildr and Magi makes OP stack client diversity far ahead of other L2 teams.

bio: Empowering the Portuguese-speaking community with education about web3.
contributionDescription:
Modular Crypto is delivering credible Portuguese content about crypto & web3. Through shows like "The State of Ethereum," "The State of DeFi", the daily "Modular News" podcast, and an insightful newsletter, we simplify Optimism for Portuguese speakers, especially in Brazil, fostering engagement.

With 3,000+ subscribers and 5,000+ monthly listeners, we educate and facilitate adoption within the Portuguese crypto community, significantly contributing to awareness and understanding of Optimism, the OP Stack, and crypto in general.

impactDescription:
Modular Crypto is one of the largest sources of original content from Optimism in Portuguese. We’ve created podcasts, articles, guides, workshops, threads and virtual events to spread the Optimistic vision and educate people.

With more than 130 podcasts and interviews published, 27 articles posted about Optimism/Ethereum ecosystem, and, in total, more than 50 content dedicated to Optimism, OP Stack and OP Chains, we believe that we have positively influenced the OP ecosystem, especially with regard to adoption by the Brazilian crypto community.

Furthermore, we recently created a guide of projects that are using the OP Stack, consisting of 4 articles dedicated to exploring OP Chains and OP Forks, and also a visual map of this, to facilitate the understanding.

And all this 100% free.

bio: 🏡Exploring Web3 real estate opportunities. Earn while you hold. Rentable Airbnb
contributionDescription:
Hello and good morning,

I'm launching a real estate investment opportunity leveraging my 20 years of experience building homes with my father. Together, we bring over 40 years of expertise in crafting custom homes.

We're seeking $500-650K USD to:
1.) Purchase land
2.) Construct the home
3.) Furnish it

Once completed, the property joins our rental program, generating income for investors. With our housing background, investors should recoup their investment by year 5.

Afterward, we sell the home and share the profits. Investors can also use the property, akin to a timeshare but without pesky fees. This property pays you back over time, and we never charge maintenance fees.

bio: Airdrop Hunter
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective is excited to announce the third round of RetroPGF. This fall, 30 million OP will be distributed to builders, creators, and educators who have provided positive impact to the Optimism Collective. If you want to get started building, head to our Ecosystem Contributions board to find a project.

Optimism is building an economy that empowers community members to be recognized and rewarded for their contributions to the Collective. These regular rounds of RetroPGF are key to growing Optimism’s economy, and eventually, to scaling the principle of “impact = profit” to the world.
impactDescription: "It’s had a huge impact. The potential for RetroPGF makes it easier to focus on providing maximal value without worrying as much about monetization. It’s also been a great motivation. Working on public goods for years with no reward can be demotivating.”

How Ditto Network can help Optimism to introduce new automation experience:
1) Use Ditto Intuitive platform to Automate any combination of transactions and interactions with decentralized applications on Optimism.  
2) Choose any time based or event based trigger to define when actions need to be executed.

Why Optimism Ecosystem will benefit?
Removing barriers to entry and expand possible use cases and experience

bio: Run a ~$300 PnP Ethereum L1 and L2 node on ARM boads that uses only ~10w to run.
contributionDescription:
Our primary contributions lie in the development of Optimism/Base packages and comprehensive documentation that enable general users to run an Optimism node on affordable and low-powered ARM64 boards, including Op-Geth, Op-node clients and Base configurations.

This work lower the barriers to entry by automating complex processes, ultimately encouraging more users to participate in the network. This contributes directly to network decentralization.

Additionally, our work empowers developers by providing them with the tools necessary to run a development or testing node. This includes running a L1 node on a similar device so L2 nodes can connect to it.

Lastly, we focused on enabling support for the Superchain (via Optimism+Base) to contribute to the multi-chain idea of scaling Ethereum.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/EOA-Blockchain-Labs/ethereumonarm/tree/main/fpm-package-builder/l2-clients/optimism-base","description":"Ethereum on ARM Optimism/Base code"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethereum-on-arm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user-guide/running-l2-clients.html#id5","description":"Optimism node howto on Ethereum on ARM node"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethereum-on-arm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user-guide/running-l2-clients.html#base","description":"Base node howto on Ethereum on ARM node"}]
impactDescription:
Our impact is best illustrated through community engagement and the growth in the number of independently operated nodes contributing to network's decentralization:

Community Engagement: Our announcements on social platforms, especially Twitter, have garnered substantial attention, with numerous retweets, likes, and comments, indicating a strong community interest.

Decentralization Contribution: Although challenging to quantify precisely, the requests for help in our Discord channel (for both Optimism and recently Base) indicates a direct contribution to the network's decentralization. Every new node introduced to the network enhances Ethereum's resilience.

bio: A decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification (dMRV) system.
contributionDescription: To empower open source coders, Base offers initial contracts, and Code Connect helps onboard relevant methodologies for regenerative finance into Optimism. By incorporating decentralized monitoring, reporting, and verification (dMRV) of regenerative actions, such as tree planting for clean air, into Optimism, we support our goal of funding public good and enhance understanding of the technology's benefits. Connected methods are analyzed and stored in a data claim resolution NFT, designed for Filecoin's tech stack. Throughout development, we adhere to international standards like the Ecological Benefits Framework. Recently, we conducted a real-life dMRV trial for a land regeneration organization using a specialized tech stack from Athena Protocol, later with Althea connectivity devices.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"http://dmeter4dmrv.org/","description":"Our organizational website. "},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/orgs/dMeter4dMRV/","description":"The organizational Github repository. Code related to dMeter is stored here. "},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://basescan.org/address/0x5cef0380ce0ad3daeefef8bdb85dbded7965adf9#code","description":"This is the contract deployed on Base for Code Connect"}]
impactDescription: Through dMeter we have channeled over 50k dollars’ worth of funding to open source coders creating a decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification (dMRV) system. This system has already been used by projects on the ground doing regenerative work and has plans to expand globally. By creating these mechanisms, we can further empower the Optimism tech stack for monitoring the profound impact public good funding has and the cascading benefits that result from it. The initlal codebases we have created, such as Code Connect and data claim resolution NFT, further empower Optimism’s tech stack for the use of regenerative finance projects.

bio: Currently contribution to OSS projects. Mostly TS and Solidity.
contributionDescription:
Most of my work to help grow the ecosystem has been with the wagmi libraries. I am currently working as a collaborator on Abitype with one of the wagmi folks. I started working on the projects by the end of January with the contribution of the human-readable type/runtime parser and from there on I've tried to contribute/help as much as I could and hope to continue to do so in the future.
Other notables contributions are some commits into to the early stage of viem's public release where i helped develop the parse/serialize transaction functionality.
I've also contributed to Solady in 2022, where I contributed to the LibString library that it uses.
As for my own repos I created a Library of string utils where the focus was to share resources to learn and my own experience in writing yul.

bio: Helping Web3 startups with grants and fundraising support
contributionDescription:
Web3Native is a public good project that manages one of the largest Web3 Grants databases. With the grants database, web3 startups can identify the possible funding routes for their projects in a single platform.  The web3Native team thus helps Web3 founders 

1) go-to grants database. Find out grants by several categories, blockchains, tags and apply to the most promising ones. 

2) Accelerator database: Similar to grants, our team also gathered data on Web3 support programs like accelerators and incubators. 

3) Advisory: Help projects identify the perfect grants. We don't charge any fees for our services. Its public good.

4) VC List: 174+ crypto-focused VCs to apply for funding. This also lists portfolio startups, network founders so that applicants can identify warm contact methods.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.web3native.co/grants","description":"Grants database: Record of more than 90 grant programs"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.web3native.co/web3-accelerators","description":"Accelerators database: A record of more than 26 Web3 focused accelerators"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://www.web3native.co/web3-vc","description":"VC List: 174+ Web3 vcs "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.web3native.co/vcs/chapter-one","description":"Investor network map:for each investor,find portfolio founders to get warm intro"}]
impactDescription:
We help projects with our knowledge and expertise in the grants field, free of cost. To this extent, monthly more than 11750 users on the site find grant programs that could benefit their project.

A few of the startups that we have advised have also gained grants from OP. For example Robo labs was one of the projects we referred to apply for OP grants.

The voluntary nature of the project and no fee involved means we can only dedicate limited resources to our efforts. Hence we never properly documented the number of projects that have secured grants directly or indirectly through help from Web3 Native.

Our accelerator and VC lists provide projects with additional options to get support when grants might not be the best route to get funding.

bio: A rich toolset for the entire journey of Web3 contract development
contributionDescription:
In mid-2022, Remix Project built direct support for deployments to Optimism mainnet and testnets within the main Remix IDE feature set. 

Remix also built and continues to maintain and promote the Remix Rewards program, which mints non-transferable NFT badges on Optimism mainnet to contributors, beta testers, and UX research participants.

As part of the workshops Remix also provides at various Ethereum events and online, "Remix Challenges" are given to participants using ZKPs with NFT rewards for successful completion minted on Optimism mainnet.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ethereum/remix-project/pull/2584","description":"PR that added support for deployments to Optimism mainnet and testnets in Remix"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/yann300/remix-reward","description":"Repo for Remix Rewards on Optimism mainnet"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/yann300/remix-rewards-ui","description":"Repo for Remix Rewards website and minting dApp"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x5d470270e889b61c08c51784cdc73442c4554011","description":"Remix Rewards contract"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://rewards.remix.ethereum.eth.limo/","description":"Website and minting dApp for Remix Rewards"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/yann300/remix-challenges","description":"Repo for Remix Challenges"}]
impactDescription:
Adding direct support for Optimism in Remix is an important signal to developers and end users on Optimism's vital role in the future of the Ethereum ecosystem.

Similarly, the Remix Rewards program is a way to help grow our user base into a larger and more genuine open source community of practice, and allows the future possibility of granting the holders of these non-transferable NFTs with proportional voting power to help the community decide on new features for the IDE and/or other issues governing the development of the Remix toolset.

The shared governance ethos of the Optimism network lends credibility to these goals of the Remix Rewards program and, we hope, vice versa.

bio: DOUBLETOP is crypto media which produces useful content for the community
contributionDescription:

We have published posts, tweets, videos, guides, translations, conducted community support about, within and for Optimism, Optimism ecosystem protocols, OP Stack chains + held huge L2 narrative in our community from the very beginning. Needless to say, everyone in our team and most of our community have interacted with Optimism both onchain and on community side at least once. 

Thanks to all that, the level of Optimism and L2 ETH knowledge has definitely risen significantly.

impactDescription:
DOUBLETOP is one of the biggest crypto community in Eastern Europe and every year we set each year narratives. We have made positive, both direct and indirect impact on overall level of understanding and knowledge of Optimism and other ETH L2s.  

In regards to impact, we are part of Optimism community and impacted adoption in various ways. The easiest way to measure the impact is probably views for us, however one should also look through likes/comments/activity/quality of the content/quality of the community etc. For that one would need to go directly to the piece of content and look it through. bio: Mosaic is accelerating retroactive rewards for web3 adoption and retention.
contributionDescription:
Mosaic deployed its retroactive rewards platform earlier this year with the support of Aave Grants DAO to analyze user activity on Optimism. We provisioned deposit and borrow data, gained user insights, and determined retroactive rewards for Aave to incentivize meaningful LP usage on OP.

In August we joined buildspace and launched three alpha campaigns to trial various forms of loyalty rewards on OP. Rewards were issued as NFTs with each consecutive campaign outperforming the one before it. 

Most recently, we participated in the Permissionless hackathon where we integrated Gitcoin Passport data including Stamps attestations on OP. We helped users visualize their Passport journey, incentivized them to add more Stamps (attestations on OP), and unlock Gitcoin’s RPGF matching pool.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://mosaicdrops.com","description":"Our website where we have hosted retroactive rewards campaigns"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x0fB6C784f1ef51dE522b7E3f620E881D86224995","description":"First alpha campaign NFT smart contract rewards on OP"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x07651181EEC2E978cA46E49b9b7B4FB6aD1e0342","description":"Second alpha campaign NFT smart contract rewards on OP "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x1F4005a548068Acb991FfcBDb835BC8883FF0546","description":"Third and final alpha campaign NFT smart contract rewards on OP"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/MosaicFun/data-models","description":"Mosaic GitHub showing models created from Aave deposit and borrow activity on OP"},{"type":"OTHER","url":" https://www.regenscore.xyz/ ","description":"Mosaic hackathon project rewards Gitcoin Passport users with attestations on OP"}]
impactDescription:
Mosaic rewards issued as NFTs on OP didn’t just outperform our expectations, each consecutive campaign also outperformed the one before it. Our combined alpha rewards campaigns totaled nearly 6000 NFTs.

Furthermore, our work with Passport data hosted by EAS on Optimism was recognized by Gitcoin as the best use of onchain data and earned us the top prize at the hackathon.

bio: Im a Developer and Crypto Enthusiast
contributionDescription:
building a large community so that users feel comfortable using the Optimism network in terms of security for user finances and maintaining scalability.

The Optimism Network is here to overcome the scalability problems that have been plaguing the Ethereum network. As is known, Ethereum has now become the main smart contract network in the crypto arena. However, Ethereum's increasing popularity means that the scalability of transactions on the network is becoming increasingly stagnant.

bio: token Governance
contributionDescription: More decentralized governance: Optimism is governed by a decentralized community of stakeholders. This means that the future of Optimism is in the hands of its users and not a single entity. This can help to ensure that your token remains decentralized and fair.
impactDescription:
Improved user experience: I can help to improve the user experience of Optimism by providing educational resources and by helping to troubleshoot problems.
Improved communication and collaboration: I can help to improve communication and collaboration within the Optimism Collective by providing a central repository of information and by facilitating discussions and debates.
Increased developer productivity: I can help to increase developer productivity by providing tools and resources that make it easier to develop and test applications on Optimism.

bio: Discover the best new web3 projects. Like Product Hunt, but for Web3.
contributionDescription:
Launchcaster built a solution and a community for builders to launch and discover the best projects on the Superchain. Think Product Hunt, but for the Superchain!

How Launchcaster works:
1. Builders post to Farcaster or Lens
2. Builders reply with @launch to launch
3. Anyone can connect their wallet, upvote, and see wallet supporters

Launchcaster’s contributions:
- Launch using social protocols, including Farcaster and Lens.
- Discover Superchain launches using home, user, project, and newsletter feeds.
- Explore Superchain builders by browsing through their profiles and leaderboards.
- Discover Superchain apps through product pages, top app leaderboard, search, and ecosystems.
- Deploy, import, and mint Superchain NFTs for apps and launches.
- And so much more 🙏

impactDescription:
Launchcaster has amassed over 10K builders, more than half of active ETH developers. It has also attracted over 50K unique users and facilitated over 1K successful Superchain launches. Many of these launches are built on the OP stack!

Launchcaster Weekly, our weekly newsletter summarizing the top launches of the week, has sent over 150K emails to 5K subscribers.

Launchcaster has assisted in deploying over 40 Superchain NFTs, processing +9K mints, importing thousands, and indexing millions.

bio: Beleive your self
contributionDescription: Retroactive Public Goods Funding (RetroPGF) is one of the leading economic experiments to help decentralize and grow crypto ecosystems. While still in its very early days, the Optimism Collective is excited to lead the charge on RetroPGF experimentation, and we aim to inspire more builders to contribute to the Optimism ecosystem with the hope – and expectation – of getting funded retroactively for their contributions.
impactDescription: The diversity of projects funded during this round improved compared to Round 1. The majority of the funded projects in RetroPGF 2 were not specific to Optimism but were part of the broader Ethereum ecosystem. Funded projects spanned a wide range of areas, from infrastructure to education, and operated in different languages and regions.

bio: Ducky City is a metaverse, socialfi project built on multi-chain
contributionDescription:
We are in the process of development, and currently, we have implemented support for connecting and logging in to our metaverse system using the OP network.

Here's a brief introduction to our business model:

Premium: The packages in the metaverse include various types such as Verification, VIP 1, VIP 2, etc. Users need to pay to upgrade to premium. 
Skins:
There will be special and limited skins and users will have to pay to own them.
Celebrity space: Celebrities can create private spaces to meet with fans, and users must have a "KEY" to enter the space. 
Online office: Users need to pay to use the online office.

We will use the OP network to carry out all transactions in our business model.

bio: Contributing to the growth of non-fungible technology on L2.
contributionDescription: I've contributed to Optimism by to expanding access to NFTs for thousands of users on Optimism. I got involved with building a project called NFTEarth upon the news of the closure of the largest OP native marketplace, Quix. I helped to design the strategy for launch, the token NFTE, the airdrop campaign, build the team, deploy the marketplace contracts (we cloned OpenSea Seaport in the first iteration) and get the marketplace up and running in ~40 days. There were several competing teams in early 2023 vying to launch a Quix replacement - a badly needed solution, but only 2 teams actually ever did launch (NFTEarth and Zonic). The team also built the only self-hosted Indexer from Reservoirs open-source repository. NFTEarth code can be seen on the GitHub profile link provided.

impactDescription: 1,689 addresses claiming an NFT marketplace token was not an insignificant number of users, and the project launched with great promise for promoting Layer2 adoption, specifically to Optimism, for non-fungible technology and all the interesting and novel potential use cases for NFTs. Additionally, the NFTEarth team worked to creatively showcase a proof-of-concept model that music NFTs could be made to potentially transform the entire music industry by using non-fungible technology to remove intermediaries and improved the relationship between Artist/Consumer. 4,771 token-gated music NFTs, called Better With L2 (a tribute to the song made by musician 3LAU), were minted on Optimism.

bio: The smart contract wallet made Ethereum safe and easy. #socialRecovery #4337
contributionDescription:
- First asset / keystore separation architecture implementation on Optimism
  - Which enables Optimism users to change their keys
  - Sync across multi-networks, including mainnet, arbitrum, scroll, and others
  - Receive and store tokens without needing to deploy the smart contract wallet
- The earliest passkey wallet
  - Create a wallet, send transaction with a face/touch ID
  - Web-based. No need to download the plugin
- Permissionless Social recovery with privacy built-in
  - Your friends won't know your wallet address (until they perform social recovery)
  - Add any Ethereum wallet addresses as guardian permissionless
- Basic account abstraction features
  - Pay gas fee on Optimism with stablecoin
  - Free/Sponsored wallet creation

bio: hello world!
contributionDescription: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. Optimism is a mental attitude characterized by hope and confidence in success and a positive future. Optimists tend to view hardships as learning experiences or temporary setbacks. Even the most miserable day holds the promise for them that “tomorrow will probably be better.” Optimists expect good things to happen, whereas pessimists instead predict unfavorable outcomes. Optimistic attitudes are linked to several benefits, including better coping skills, lower stress levels, better physical health, and higher persistence when pursuing goals
impactDescription: I'm so glad to have been given the opportunity to participate this event. The Optimism Collective is a group of companies, communities, and citizens working together to reward public goods and build a sustainable future for Ethereum. The collective aims to dispel the myth that public goods cannot be profitable by deploying a new model for rewarding those who create or sustain public goods - retroactive public goods funding (RetroPGF) - to support projects and communities building for the common good. RetroPGF is advantageous because it is relatively easy to agree on what is useful and see who built it. It is a lot harder to identify in advance what will be useful and which team will do the best job of building it.

bio: Fe is a high-level language for the EVM.
contributionDescription: Fe is a high-level language for the EVM. It is heavily inspired by Rust and implemented in it too. You can use Fe to write smart contracts for Ethereum or any EVM-equivalent platform. Developers who have come to appreciate Rust will enjoy many of the features currently supported by Fe.
impactDescription: Since the Fe compiler targets EVM, developers can write Fe code for Ethereum or any EVM-equivalent platform. Fe support's a number features that developers have come to love. That list includes things like, enums and pattern matching, libraries and modules, a standard library, traits, built-in testing, and more. By improving languages we are able to improve the ecosystem as a whole.

impactDescription:
User Base Growth: Through our #aPRENDOcripto program, we've educated and graduated underprivileged individuals who are now well-equipped to be active users in the Optimism ecosystem. They not only utilize the platform for their transactions and activities but also become advocates for Op within their communities, thereby contributing to organic growth.

Ecosystem Diversity: Our outreach in vulnerable communities brings new perspectives into the Optimism ecosystem. By incorporating these diverse viewpoints, Optimism becomes a more adaptable and inclusive platform.

Active Engagement: Our #criptoIMPULSO learn2earn program serves as a catalyst for active interaction with Op. By offering financial incentives through the platform, we provide a real-world use-case for Optimism's solutions.

displayName: Hope: A Curated AI Assistant for the Optimism Ecosystem
bio: Hope is an interactive, continually updated AI Assistant for the OP ecosystem
contributionDescription:
Hope is a free, publicly available, continually updated AI Assistant that is helping users and developers on the OP Stack find answers quickly and easily. To date, we have provided responses to more than 130 user questions (directly through the website or as a response from our team to a query in the Optimism Discord), and this reach can readily be expanded with direct Discord and/or Telegram integration of the Assistant. 

What's unique about using Hope is that doing so directly supports people in underserved communities who are learning about and contributing to web3. humanDAO funds wages for contributors who monitor Optimism's social accounts, Discord, and other forums to ensure Hope remains up to date, provides accurate sources, and responds to user feedback.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://op.humandao.org","description":"This is the website address for Hope, our AI Assistant"}]
impactDescription: We have already helped over 30 users and developers explore and engage with the Optimism ecosystem. Questions have ranged from governance to the $OP token, detailed development queries, management of the Optimism Foundation and its priorities, and the mechanics of the various OP airdrops. With greater implementation, Hope can significantly reduce the overhead and complexity of Optimism's support functions and create a much more scalable support function for the next wave of users.

bio: A fun loving girl from Texas
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective was born to dispel the myth that public goods cannot be profitable. The OP Stack is an MIT-licensed public good. Anyone can use or fork it however they see fit.

And yet, the benefits of a shared standard turn the incentive to fork into an incentive to coordinate, driving disparate chains to cohere into a collective network – the Superchain. By encoding a fee split into that shared standard, the original Optimistic Vision starts to emerge: sustainable funding for the open-source code that upholds an optimistic economy.

bio: Open source smart contracts that price any ERC20 asset on OP & Base trustlessly
contributionDescription: We built Optimism Prices, a set of open source smart contracts that can price any ERC20 asset that exists in a liquidity pool on Optimism or Base, which is capable of entirely replacing the need for centralized price APIs. The contracts support pricing that requires complex routes with many hops, support non-standard ERC20 implementations and non-standard AMM curves, and are even optimized to allow for pricing 100+ tokens in a single function call so that it can best take advantage of the public Optimism RPC without using unnecessary computation and getting throttled. The Optimism Prices contracts have been iterated upon for many months with direct feedback from some of the largest projects in the Optimism ecosystem, like Velodrome and Aerodrome, which use Optimism Prices in production.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ethzoomer/optimism-prices","description":"Optimism Prices github repo containing the suite of smart contracts, tests, docs"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x1bc48045232cC0BCe1Fa12F8dA9143B136C53531","description":"Optimism Prices pricing contract latest release (OP Mainnet)"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://basescan.org/address/0x2DCD9B33F0721000Dc1F8f84B804d4CFA23d7713","description":"Optimism Prices pricing contract latest release (Base)"}]
impactDescription: Optimism Prices has encouraged the growth of the Optimism developer community by building a component of the stack that is not only public, trustless, and reliable, but also superior to shortcut centralized solutions. Optimism ecosystem devs no longer need to shell out cash for centralized pricing APIs with spotty uptime, instead they can merely execute a single RPC call using Optimism Prices. Optimism Prices' sole focus and dedication to the Optimism ecosystem allows us to maintain well-engineered integrations for the popular destinations for tokens on Optimism and Base, which lets us guarantee 100% coverage for pricing any asset. As a result, Optimism Prices is the sole price feed relied on by Velodrome and Aerodrome, the #2 and #1 projects by TVL on OP Mainnet and Base respectively.

Resources for Future Projects: Retroactive funding can provide you with the resources necessary to pursue future projects or initiatives. This can include funding for research, development, or other activities that contribute to the growth and improvement of the Optimism ecosystem.

They not only provide you with recognition and financial support but also contribute to the growth, sustainability, and vibrancy of the Optimism ecosystem. My work inspires others and helps build a strong, collaborative community focused on achieving shared goals.

bio: Most Used 4337 UserOp Explorer for Account Abstraction
contributionDescription:
EIP 4337 introduced new abstracts entities called UserOps, Bundler, paymater and factory, which are not understood by the underlying ethereum protocol. 
Thus no infrastructure component recognizes these entities unless specifically designed for it.
Jiffyscan is the only tool to let you explore details of a UserOp introduced by ERC-4337, just by giving the UserOp Hash.
Users can explore details across 16 different mainnets and testnets.
There's a data API available as well to query the details of a given UserOp, currently for free.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/jiffy-labs/jiffyscan-frontend","description":"Repositories empowering the Explorer"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://jiffyscan.readme.io/","description":"APIs available for free for wallet developers building on 4337 ecosystem"}]
impactDescription:
1.The tools is most helpful for developers to confirm the status of a UserOp and share it with their teammates or users, as no other tool currently supports search/lookup by a UserOp.
2. The Explorer is actively used by the developers of the top teams empowering 4337.
3. The explorer has seen a Cumulative Monthly Growth of 27% for the last 5 months in terms of page views, with the september hitting ~18k views. 
4. We have had 26 teams request for our APIs and are the most performant and rich historical UserOp lookup service out there

bio: All resources related to Optimism governance on a single website
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Resource Center consolidates more than 100 resources related to Optimism governance on a single website. Previously, those resources were scattered across a range of locations such as the Community Hub, Governance Forum, Mirror, Charmverse, Notion, and GitHub. This fragmentation made it challenging to find relevant information.

Some of the most popular features of the Optimism Resource Center are the popover previews that are displayed when you hover over a linked page (just like in Wikipedia), and the graph view that allows you to visually explore the connections between the governance resources.
 
We also opened 5 pull requests (3 merged) to the official Community Hub repo to fix outdated information we found while searching for resources to include in the site.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://optimism.help","description":"Optimism Resource Center Website"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/govguide/optimism-resource-center","description":"Github repo for Optimism Resource Center"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/community-hub/pulls/govguide","description":"Open and merged PRs to official Community Hub repo on GitHub"}]
impactDescription:
By bringing together all resources related to Optimism governance, the center simplifies the process of finding information, making it easier and more time-efficient for governance participants and users alike.

In October alone (Oct 1st - 23rd), the site has reached 665 unique visitors and 3465 page views. 

We are particularly proud to hear about many OP Labs contributors using the site: Maurelian mentioned on Farcaster that the Optimism Resource Center “is blowing up in the OP Labs slack”, Michael Silberling praised it as "insanely cool", and Harper shared that "we are all stoked".

bio: A Dune dashboard that presents data on the adoption of ERC4337 Smart Accounts
contributionDescription:
𝗧𝗟𝗗𝗥
Built a Dune dashboard on ERC4337 Smart Accounts. Provides valuable insight for teams building smart account infrastructure.

𝗗𝗲𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻
This dashboard breaks down 
- Overview statistics  (accounts deployed, monthly transactions .etc)
- Bundler Performance (marketshare, revenue .etc)
- Paymaster activity (marketshare, gas spend .etc)
- Application usage by ERC4337 accounts 

It is currently the most popular Dune dashboard for ERC4337 with 410+ stars.
impactDescription:
190k+ ERC4337 accounts have been deployed on Optimism and Base, making the Superchain one of the top ecosystems for smart account activity. 

Most teams building ERC4337 infrastructure use the data from this dashboard to track the category's growth and inform their strategies.

bio: Optimism University: Engage, Educate, and Elevate in the World of Optimism.
contributionDescription:
Starting with Optimism can be challenging, which is why we created Optimism University. This platform makes learning about Optimism engaging and interactive. We cover all the essential topics in various formats, allowing the community to choose and interact with their preferred content.

Our educational materials are highly interactive. We offer guides that delve deeply into each topic and can be completed in 5-10 minutes. We also have 'tidbits' that highlight key points and can be finished in just 30 seconds, as well as simulations such as clickable demos, timelines, and courses.

Optimism University aims to:

1) Increase community involvement.
2) Broaden awareness of Optimism, leading to greater adoption.
3) Establish lasting trust and a strong reputation for Optimism.
impactDescription:
Our creation, Optimism University, has a big positive effect on the Optimism Collective. By setting up this educational platform, we made it much easier for people to learn about Optimism. We provided different types of content, like detailed guides, quick tidbits, and interactive demos, catering to various learning preferences. This variety means that everyone can find a way to learn that suits them best.

As people can understand Optimism better, they're more likely to take part in its activities and discussions. Additionally, with more individuals getting to know about Optimism through the University, it helps raise the collective's trustworthiness.

bio: Bringing positive-sum, regenerative digital systems to the world
contributionDescription:
We're shifting from discussing crypto's potential global impact to demonstrating it through action. Our approach spans education, content creation, and real-world impact. We seek funding for expansion and supporting the GreenPill Network. Our initiatives include:

Education: We have the GreenPilled book on regenerative cryptoeconomics (multiple languages), a podcast, YouTube channel, a blog, local impact guides and other resources. We create onboarding resources for regen web3, Optimism and the PGN ecosystem.

Manager Round Training: We provide free training to support the growing demand for Gitcoin Grant Stack, helping communities fund public goods via QF rounds. Grants can be executed on OP and PGN.

Local Chapters: We have 22+ global chapters hosting web3 workshops and events.

impactDescription:
The GreenPill book has over 50,000 downloads and has been translated into 12 languages, the podcast has over 230,000 downloads, the YouTube channel has 883 subscribers and 26408 views and our community has over 730 members. 
 
We’ve built out applications, created wallets, ran QF rounds, created content and hosted trainings that brought new users to the Optimism ecosystem. 

We’ve created over 22 chapters globally that run onboarding workshops, run web3 regen events, drive local impact, help onboard NGOs into web3 and work to teach people how to use crypto to regenerate the world. To date, we’ve hosted over IRL 73 events. 

All of these data points are focused on providing people with the tools needed to regenerate the world using crypto and building in ecosystems like Optimism.

bio: Open Source Ethereum Explorer
contributionDescription:
beaconcha.in explorer is the backbone for Ethereum's consensus and execution layer. It is the only all-in-one (CL+EL) explorer and played a pivotal role during the merge and subsequent hardforks. Due to its design, core devs use beaconcha.in to simulate and test upcoming hardforks.

To support for homestakers and decentralization, beaconcha.in provides an open-source mobile app for both iOS and Android, aiming to enhance the solo staking experience.

Currently, the codebase is undergoing significant rework to support any EVM chain, including the Optimism network.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer","description":"Repository of the beaconcha.in web project."},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://github.com/gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer-app","description":"Repository of the beaconcha.in mobile app."}]
impactDescription:
- beaconcha.in is the *only* consensus layer explorer in the ecosystem.

- Easy way for Local Explorer and Testnet Simulation
gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer/tree/master/local-deployment

-  A significant backend rework to allow anyone spin up any EVM explorer, thus giving developers a new playground for the OP stack

- Seamless User Navigation through Network Data:
End users can navigate network-related data, without noticing the various layers of the Ethereum stack (CL/EL/L2).

- Improved Staking Experience with our Open Source Mobile App
Our open-source mobile app allows for monitoring of validators, enhancing the staking experience and contributing to decentralization.

- Public API Access for Consensus and Execution Layer. beaconcha.in is the only CL API provider in the ecosystem.

bio: Interact with a DApp to rate it. Address usage ensures genuine ratings.
contributionDescription: DApps Rating Platform: Only users who have interacted with a specific DApp can rate it. Users must log in with an ETH address. Users can evaluate a project only if there is activity associated with their address and the relevant contract addresses. This system ensures that only genuine users can rate DApps, contributing to a more secure Optimism ecosystem, which aligns with broader adoption.

bio: Web3 product studio
contributionDescription:
We built the Superbridge (https://superbridge.app), an all in one solution for bridging assets to and from chains in the Superchain.

The Superbridge supports bridging ETH and ERC20 tokens to and from OP Mainnet, Base and Zora. With deployments to Mode, PGN, Orderly Network, Ancient8, Lyra and Aevo planned in the short term.

We've also partnered with Conduit (https://conduit.xyz), offering all testnets launched via their platform a free deployment of the Superbridge. You can read their announcement about the integration here https://twitter.com/KAndrewHuang/status/1707065523274739854.
impactDescription:
We're giving chains the ability to launch a user friendly bridge on the same day as they launch their mainnet or testnet network. We saw the launch of Base, where users were sending funds directly to a contract on Etherscan and thought that this needn't be the UX the Superchain is striving for.

On top of basic token bridging functionality, our easy mode feature enables users to not worry about coming back to prove (2 hours later) and finalize (7 days later) their withdrawals - Fugu Works does it for them. Drastically improving the withdrawal process and cutting transactions needed from users from 3 to 1.

bio: DecentrAgora is a metaverse terminal via the Ethereum network.
contributionDescription:
Decentragora is an OP-native project focused on open-source tools and accessibility for the benefit of the public. We actively contribute to the OP stack by building open-source tech and maintaining an open space focused on impact over profit.

The technology we build is for anyone from newcomers to shadowy super coders. Our organization has been an entry point for anyone interested in Web3 and technology. That's why it's free— for maximum accessibility for the public! (Learn more here) 

We strive for access and inclusivity, welcoming newcomers and experienced coders. Our tools include:
Membership NFT contract
Smart contract deployer
Attestation tool.
Gas faucet & educational content.

Our office space is where we onboard locals and work with students interested in tech development.

impactDescription:
Since we focus on developing open technology and maintaining equal access for anyone.
We develop user-friendly tools for the Optimistic collective.

Smart contracts and repositories open-sourced
Hosted meetups and educational sessions for Web3
Created & distributed educational material that is free to the public
Represented and publicized the collective in our community

Our Gas Faucet provides free ETH for first-time transactions. Our EVM Gas Station dApp monitors network prices and estimates costs for L1 and L2 networks.

Anyone can use our technology & access resources that onboard them directly to Optimism.
We provide resources beyond our office doors; our technology is open source. We aim to foster infinite positive-sum games by lowering the entry barrier for adopting Optimism.

bio: Building Unlock Protocol to create a better web
contributionDescription:
Unlock Labs, the creators of Unlock Protocol, will enhance the features and functionality of Events, an application built to bring events onchain on Optimism.

Events by Unlock Labs is a free and easy way organizers can create events (contracts deployed on Optimism) and share an event details page for 10-10000+ person where users can claim or purchase tickets. Setting up an event takes less than a minute, and it works for both free and paid events.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x99b1348a9129ac49c6de7F11245773dE2f51fB0c","description":"Unlock Protocol's Contracts on Optimism (Deployed on Nov-21-2021)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://unlock-protocol.com/","description":"Unlock Protocol's Website"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://app.unlock-protocol.com/event","description":"Events by Unlock Labs"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://github.com/unlock-protocol","description":"Unlock Protocol's Github"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://dune.com/ccarfi/Unlock-Protocol-Rankings","description":"Unlock Protocol's Leaderboard (Dune)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://discord.unlock-protocol.com/","description":"Unlock Protocol's Discord"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/UnlockProtocol","description":"Unlock Protocol's Twitter"}]
impactDescription:
Consumer use cases for Optimism are critical to increasing onboarding, adoption, and usage. Events are an obvious use case for Optimism, enabling people with and without crypto wallets to register for or buy tickets to an event.

Legacy ticketing solutions don’t meet the needs of web3 and crypto event organizers.

Events by Unlock Labs enables no-code event creation, deploying a smart contract to Optimism that creates tickets that include event details, metadata, and other information relevant to an event. Enhancing the features and functionality of Events allows crypto-centric event organizers using web2 platforms (Eventbrite, Luma, Partiful) to embrace the technology their attendees expect them to champion..

bio: The leading DAO analytics engine with 19k+ DAOs and 8+ million wallet profiles.
contributionDescription:
We help the DAO ecosystem benefit from accurate data. We have manually enriched 1000s of DAOs, and display their treasury, governance, and voter data on our website and API.

Our direct contributions to Optimism include: 

- Displaying Optimism DAO at the top of our listing, helping establish it as a leading DAO.
- Creating a platform for indexing, and self listing DAOs on Optimism.
- Creating governance profiles for all OP Collective voters & delegates
- Making Optimism DAO data available on our website and API, with comprehensive treasury and governance information of the Optimism Collective ecosystem. 
- The most comprehensive list of DAO tools available on Optimism. 

Our efforts have made the Optimism DAO ecosystem healthier, transparent and widely appreciated.

impactDescription:
1. Made crypto and mainstream media outlets, VCs, academic researchers, and everyone in the DAO ecosystem aware of Optimism DAO and its activity and contributions. 

2. Created profiles for 275+ DAOs on Optimism, and 88k+ voters and all delegates of the Optimism Collective, emphasizing our commitment to data transparency.

3. By curating and listing 38 DAO tools available on Optimism, we display the most comprehensive resource for individuals and organizations looking to deploy a DAO on Optimism.

5. Over the past 24 months, governance data on DeepDAO has been accessed by over 120,000 people, underscoring our pivotal role in creating stakeholder engagement in the DAO ecosystem. 

6. Our comprehensive dataset enables stakeholders access to deeper, analytical treasury and governance metrics.

bio: 1st French-speaking media about crypto
contributionDescription:
As an education and information medium, we've been following Optimism's progress closely and have detailed it in numerous articles.

Very early on (in April 2022) we offered a comprehensive guide to our community, entitled "Optimism: the first optimistic rollups solution to improve Ethereum (ETH) scalability". This enabled them to discover the ecosystem and understand how it works, as well as its advantages.

Afterwards, we covered a number of news items, such as the $150 million fundraising in March 2022, the airdrop in June 2022, or more technical topics like the improvements brought about by the Bedrock update. We also reported on the network's successes, with articles on the number of active addresses and the number of transactions.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://cryptoast.fr/optimism-optimstic-rollup-scalabilite-ethereum-eth/","description":"Our complete guide to Optimism"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://cryptoast.fr/optimism-leve-150-millions-dollars-valorisation-1-6-milliard-dollars/","description":"Our article on Optimism fundraising"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://cryptoast.fr/airdrop-optimism-officiellement-lance-250000-wallets-concernes/","description":"Our article about the airdrop"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://cryptoast.fr/optimism-nombre-adresses-layer-2-augmente-45-pourcents-janvier/","description":"One of our article about Optimism success"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://cryptoast.fr/optimism-op-quelles-ameliorations-mise-a-jour-bedrock/","description":"Our article on the Bedrock update"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/CryptoastMedia/status/1703408017264250999","description":"One of our tweets to announce one of Optimism's news"}]
impactDescription:
Thanks to our various articles, we've enabled the French-speaking community to discover Optimism through a medium in which they have full confidence.

We've enabled them to understand how Optimism works and its relevance to today's challenges, to learn how to interact with the ecosystem, and to follow the project's news on a regular basis.

We also covered the launch of the token to highlight its potential interest for investors and regular DeFi users.

We are likely to have redirected our community of 10 million readers (in 2022) towards Optimism in a neutral, objective but enthusiastic way.

bio: A Governor extension for building powerful DAO voting integrations.
contributionDescription:
Flexible Voting is an extension to the widely used OpenZeppelin Governor that enables novel DAO voting schemes to be created. Flexible Voting is developed and maintained by ScopeLift.

For a DAO that adopts it, the Flexible Voting extension allows delegates to split their voting weight across For/Against/Abstain options for a given proposal. This new building block allows arbitrary delegate contracts to be developed which can unlock all kinds of new use cases. Of particular relevance to Optimism is the ability to vote with tokens bridged to L2, a use case ScopeLift is currently building.

It also enables other use cases like Voting with tokens while earning yield in DeFi, shielded voting (i.e. secret/private voting), liquid delegation and more.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ScopeLift/flexible-voting","description":"The core Flexible Voting repository."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ScopeLift/l2-flexible-voting","description":"The Layer 2 Flexible Voting repository, targeting Optimism as its first network."}]
impactDescription:
Flexible Voting has already been adopted by three significant DAOs: Gitcoin, PoolTogether, and Frax Finance. All three of these DAOs are heavily active in the Optimism ecosystem. Notably, Gitcoin runs Grants Rounds on Optimism, and has just launched their own OP Stack network (PGN), and PoolTogether just launched version 5 of their protocol on Optimism first.

ScopeLift is actively building a solution to cross chain voting, i.e. enable token holders for these DAOs (and future adopters of Flexible Voting), to bridge their tokens off mainnet and vote with them. The first network we are targeting for this product is Optimism. Within the next few months, we expect to go live, allowing token holders for these DAOs to bridge and vote from Optimism.

bio: I write about crypto-related topics like governance, sustainability and scaling.
contributionDescription: I have written over 100 blog posts about rollups and governance, in addition to countless Reddit & Twitter posts, with the caveat they are not specifically related to Optimism but about rollups in general. All my writings are public domain, and anyone can remix/republish/adapt etc as they please. I've been an Optimism Collective delegate since day 1, and governance has been a key topic in my writings in the last year or so, inspired by my work as a delegate, aimed partly at improving Optimism's governance systems and onboarding more people to Optimism's governance. Kindly note that I'm a recipient for RPGF #2, so it may be prudent to consider my more recent writings about topics like governance for RPGF #3.
impactDescription: The impact of writers is harder to gauge with metrics. I could post viewing stats and social media numbers, but instead, let me try something different. Here's my pitch: have you, as a badgeholder, read my content and in some way informed & influenced your thoughts and work? Or your colleagues, friends, and teams building on Optimism? It's not for me to say how impactful my writing has been - so I'll let badgeholders be the judge. Kindly also note that I'm no longer active on Twitter, but still write on Mirror, Farcaster and Reddit with a smaller audience than in the past, so you may consider that when you gauge "impact".

bio: Explorer. Code, design, and mountains. Building: https://pincaster.xyz/
contributionDescription:
Onchain Reads is a decentralized social network for book enthusiasts.

The platform allows users to create virtual bookshelves, where they can organize and track the books they've read, are currently reading, or plan to read in the future. Users can also rate and review books and provide recommendations.

Onchain Reads provides a space for users to connect with like-minded individuals and participate in communities. Users can explore new books based on their interests and engage in discussions with fellow readers.
impactDescription:
Winner of one of the 100 Builders grants.

Onchain Reads is built on Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS) https://attest.sh/ and deployed on Base. Visit https://onchainreads.phyles.app/ to mark a book as read onchain.

After you sign the attestation you can check it on the app and EAS Scan https://base.easscan.org/schema/view/0x033ac28e96914866bb41e63e9439560a83521eb856ecdb711ef520ae43994d18

By storing data onchain, we ensure a credibly neutral platform, and enabling developers to create new applications permissionlessly.

In this prototype, you can view users who have read a book and visit profiles to see the books they've read https://onchainreads.phyles.app/u/0xCf7ecA52dE76E72e562ADddb513CeF4c609f1fd2

bio: Incubating global communities with multilingual crypto education and onboarding
contributionDescription:
The project is divided into: the IMN team which stewards the projects and does fundraising, and the nodes which produce content and onboard people into web3 in their local language.
Coordination
We have been practising social coordination at scale since 2021. For the bDAO Optimism Global Campaign, we coordinate nodes from 11 languages to promote the creation and shipping of content, as well as reporting and accounting for them.
Additionally we coordinated with Bankless Academy to ship translation of their OP lesson in 5 languages.
Content Creation
Nodes are independent entities stewarded by local teams and have submitted their own applications. However Chinese and Tamil nodes were unable to submit their own applications due various reasons so we would like to report stats on their behalf.

impactDescription:
From coordination side:
The Optimism collective was able to market its vision and values to a global community which generated 29,640 views in 11 languages, through 191 pieces of translated content including Newsletter, twitter threads and youtube videos. (detailed stats: https://www.notion.so/adfe3690f22f45099250abe727dd6fee?v=bff82ebe46a2441d8d419a455a943a9d)

We also helped translate the Bankless Academy lesson on Optimism into 5 languages.

From content creation side (reported in impact metrics below)
Chinese node - 3,830 views form 17 pieces of translated content.
Tamil node - 1,399 views from 22 pieces of translated content.

Overall our effort was able to help raise awareness of the OP stack, help adoption of the chain and assist in the improvement of collective governance.

bio: The standards body for DAOs, with 80+ member organizations.
contributionDescription:
We help protocols, service providers, and DAOs on Optimism participate in, track, and benefit from standards for DAO metadata, proposals, governance, grants, regulatory compliance, and more.

Our direct contributions to Optimism include: 
1. authoring EIP-4824,
2. deploying and maintaining the EIP-4824 contracts, subgraphs, and explorer for Optimism,
3. simplifying daoURI creation by building supporting infrastructure,
4. engaging 20+ DAOs and tools on Optimism, with the Optimism Collective, ShapeShift, Unlock Protocol, Snapshot X, and LXDAO committing to adopt EIP-4824, and
5. authoring standards on grants management and attestations. 

Our collaborative efforts have streamlined governance on Optimism and positioned DAOstar’s standards as key drivers for the ecosystem's DAO strategy.

impactDescription:
Adoption: 4 DAOs on Optimism have already adopted EIP-4824. The adoption by Snapshot ensures that future DAOs using the framework on Optimism will automatically comply with EIP-4824. 

Engagement: We collected feedback from the 20+ projects on Optimism, ensuring that the implementation of EIP-4824 aligns with community needs. 

Access: Our technical infrastructure improvements (contract upgrades, integrations with Snapshot & Boardroom, the explorer for Optimism, etc.) have made the adoption of EIP-4824 on Optimism easier. 

Innovation: Our work on attestations, grants, delegations, and regulatory interoperability take inspiration from EIP-4824. Multiple Optimism projects including Gitcoin, Tally, OpenZepplin, EAS, Agora, and others are involved in the projects.

bio: Making learning Optimism 10x easier.
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Academy is a place where people can learn about Optimism in a structured and engaging way.

We created a series of to-the-point, engaging video courses combined with interactive quizzes and “real-world” assignments to facilitate understanding of the Collective and its underlying vision and tech.

Our endgame is to have courses on all the major topics concerning Optimism. We started with an intro to Optimism course which features more than 20 videos covering:

1. The Optimism Collective and it's vision
2. Public Goods and RetroPGF
3. Optimism Technology
4. Optimism Governance
5. How to get involved
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://app.optimistic.academy/","description":"Platform to learn about Optimism in a structured and engaging way"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ZCm1jiGyWZ-g3xBxS28pQ","description":"Youtube channel with all our videos (created very recently)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/OptimismAcademy","description":"Twitter account (created very recently)"}]
impactDescription:
We created the first Optimism Academy and an Intro to Optimism course that makes learning about Optimism 10x easier.

The course features more than 20 videos (so far), all tied together in a structured way and complemented with quizzes and assignments.

After months of work, we launched the academy a few weeks ago and had more than 30 people joining, despite not doing any marketing or publicity apart from publishing the link on the forum.

We've recently created Twitter and Youtube accounts to start distributing the content and reaching more people, but it's too soon to see it's real impact.

bio: The NFT artist introducing Optimism blockchain to Layer1 and Web2 business.
contributionDescription:
I am a graphic designer, writer, and entrepreneur passionate about art. In June 2021, I embarked on my journey as an NFT artist, and it eventually became my full-time occupation, with my projects primarily on the Ethereum blockchain.

In June 2022, I launched my first project on Optimism, recognizing it as an ideal platform for NFTs due to its lower gas fees. I leveraged NFTs to promote businesses and events, using my art and marketing initiatives to attract new users to Optimism. As both an artist and the founder of a pioneering project on Optimism, my work garnered attention from companies and projects in the web2 realm, allowing me to introduce them to the world of Web3 through Optimism Stack.

I introduced five companies, namely SRANN, Mangmoom Publishing, Tripster, NFT360, and Starlet, to the world of web3 through Optimism Stacks. I also welcomed NFT projects and protocols from Ethereum, such as Flower Girls and Omnisea, to participate in events on Optimism.

bio: Bress is an alternative client for browsing Mirror articles
contributionDescription: We build bress to make Mirror articles searching and discovery more convenient. Mirror is the most important content platform on Optimism but it lacks the key feature of articles searching. To help readers find Mirror articles easier we build bress. At bress users can browse featured Mirror articles by us, search any Mirror article with keywords, follow Mirror writers, read new published articles.
impactDescription: At bress our website has served more than 22,139 unique users and has 81,472 total page views , with around 100 daily active users. We help onboard and maintain users for Mirror. Our service reaches users in different countries which means we have a gloable users base.

bio: A governance data platform helping stakeholders make more informed decisions
contributionDescription:
Optimism Governance Support:

Since inception, Boardroom has integrated the entire governance stack, streamlining governance for voters and standardizing interactions for developers on our SDK and API.

- Snapshot: Initial support for proposals launched with Snapshot and onchain delegation.
- Onchain Integration: In collaboration with Agora, Boardroom ensured support for upgraded onchain governance contracts, becoming an alternative to vote.optimism.io by Feb 2023.
- Dashboard: From launch, our Dashboard has supported governance on boardroom.io/optimism.

Governance Facilitation: 

Since August 2022, our "Weekly Recaps" offer a governance-focused summary for the Optimism community, covering key proposals, changes, suggestions, and discussions. This initiative paused from Aug to Oct 2023.
impactDescription:
Increased Participation:
The initial support for Snapshot proposals and early onchain delegations, and the subsequent onchain integration has expanded the avenues for community participation. By offering an alternative to vote.optimism.io, we've broadened the choices available to voters, driving higher engagement in governance processes.

Standardized Governance Experience:
By integrating the entire Optimism governance stack, Boardroom has provided a consistent and user-friendly governance experience for developers accessing standardized data and governance interactions via our APIs and SDK.  

Informed Community:
Our "Weekly Recaps" initiative has ensured that the Optimism community remains updated on key governance activities.

bio: Test in Prod is a core development team of Optimism Collective.
contributionDescription:
From core protocol development to DevOps tools, Test in Prod builds things that matter to OP Stack.
—

OP-Erigon: We built OP-Erigon, the first alternative execution client to OP Stack built with the Erigon client. We maintain OP-Erigon by keeping it updated with upstream, supporting more features, building OP-Otterscan, etc.

Span Batch: We researched and implemented Span Batch with OP Labs—new batch specs that minimize L1 data cost, initial design by Proto; aims to deploy with Canyon hardfork.

Engine P2P Sync: We implemented Engine P2P Sync support for OP-Node that reduces block sync time—e.g., snap sync.

Public RPC & Block Explorer: We host OP-Erigon public RPCs & OP-Otterscan on OP Mainnet / Goerli.

OP Charts: We built OP Charts, a Helm chart repository for OP Stack infrastructures.

impactDescription:
TiP's impacts focus on technical OPtimization and building tech stacks for OP Stack—some impacts are quantitive, but some should be qualitatively measured.
—

OP-Erigon: It secures OP Stack with client diversity and allows devs to enjoy Erigon's disk saving; it uses 70% less than OP Mainnet Geth archive nodes, 2.4→0.7TB.

Span Batch: It allows low-active OP Chains by cutting minimum L1 fees by ~97% (165→5 ETH a year), expecting to cut OP Mainnet's L1 fees by ~9%.

Engine P2P Sync: It allows Geth's snap sync—reduces sync time by ~82% on OP Mainnet compared to the derivation.

Public RPC & Block Explorer: It allows devs to test OP-Erigon on OP Mainnet / Goerli—processing 138k req/day.

OP Charts: It provides easy OP Stack deployments on k8s. Some devs forked it to build an OP Chain launcher.

bio: Velocimeter is a ve33 Dex offering options tokens as emissions and as a service.
contributionDescription:
One of the first dexes on Base supporting 100s of tokens/projects since launch.
Airdropped oBVM to our users from Fantom Canto & Pulse during our launch phase.
Pioneered options tokens as emissions which funded over $300,000 in $ETH rewards for LPs on Velocimeter.

Cumulative 40m in volume across the chains we are deployed (source DeFi Llama) on. ~10m on Base.

Velocimeter Pro Options as a service - which we invented supports projects such as BMX w/ oBMX.

Granted veBVM to dozens of projects creators & contributors via our contributer program.

Onboarded 1000s of users to Base via our Zealy program.
impactDescription:
Provided launchpad contracts and frontend to friendtech33 who raised $400,000 using our contracts and frontend launchpad.

Several other projects are in various stages of launching via our launchpad on Base.

Helped to onboard projects such as Firebird Finance, Beefy, Qi DAO, Ethos Reserve & many more to Base via veBVM grants & emmissions.

bio: Explore fun rabbit holes generated LLMs using crypto micropayments
contributionDescription:
We used Account Abstraction to solve the largest issue that new AI developers face today: getting paid for their work while preventing spam. They are overwhelmed by bots after releasing a new product and can't charge a monthly fee that users are not willing to pay.

Crypto micropayments have not historically been possible due to high mainnet gas costs and slow, cumbersome transaction UX. However, we use embedded wallets and ERC4337 to allow new users to sign up via SMS, fund their account, and directly pay developers every time they use the app. No seed phrases, no transaction confirmation, no gas.

On an L2 like Optimism or Base, users can try out new AI apps for cents on the dollar and developers can bootstrap a user base without going broke.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://bunnyai.vercel.app/","description":"Live production frontend"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/justindomingue/bunnyai","description":"BunnyAI frontend repo"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/zhongeric/bunnyAI-contracts","description":"BunnyAI contracts"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://basescan.org/address/0x981C5b436121C75cf043A622d078988248Ef203d","description":"Deployment on Base mainnet"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethglobal.com/showcase/bunnyai-mzkgn","description":"Project page from EthGlobal"}]
impactDescription:
We premiered this project during the EthGlobal NYC hackathon and were overwhelmed with support from those that we demo'ed and spoke to. Many of the people we talked to told us that they were surprised to learn that such a “web2” like UX was already possible to achieve! Apps that bridge the knowledge gap between web2 and web3 are necessary for mass adoption — we just wanted to create a really fun LLM app while using crypto as the infrastructure, and we succeeded in doing so.

We also wanted to share just how great our developing experience was with other builders so we did a quick demo at the first Base Builders community session. We hope that other developers were inspired by our work!

bio: Web3's collaborative hub driving regenerative change and supporting public goods
contributionDescription:
Hub of Collaboration:

The Giveth House has become a nexus for Optimism-related projects, hosting contributors and innovators from the Optimism Collective.
Notable projects: RetroPGF, L2Beat, EthBarcelona 2023.

RetroPGF Engagement:

The space not only hosts RetroPGF signage to the circulating community but also serves as an active hub for RetroPGF collaborations.
Roundtables produce heightened awareness and actionable insight on RetroPGF.

Focused Community Dialogues:

The house regularly hosts deep-dive conversations explicitly focused on Optimism Collective's goals and challenges, effectively serving as an "Optimism think-tank."

EthBarcelona:

Served as the primary venue for the RetroPGF crew during EthBarcelona 2023, emphasizing our alignment with Optimism's mission for public goods.

impactDescription:
Community Catalyst:

Peterpan's journey from Giveth House directly impacted the founding of MetaCartel, a notable entity in the Optimism ecosystem.
The founders of EthBarcelona, an Optimism-focused event, utilized Giveth House as their brainstorming and planning hub.

Innovation Hub:

The Giveth House's environment enabled Jordi Baylina to contribute significantly to Hermez, further enriching Optimism's L2 capabilities.

Public Goods and Optimism:

The financial ease provided by the house has empowered numerous contributors to focus solely on public goods within the Optimism ecosystem.
Giveth House hosts the RetroPGF team during ETHBarcelona.

Solar Punk Ethos:

The house embodies Optimism Collective’s values, serving as a living space that fosters community-driven innovation for Optimism.
