bio: Candide builds open Account Abstraction software
contributionDescription:
Native to Optimism from day 1 and one of the first teams to release a smart wallet with Account Abstraction. Offers on-chain recovery contacts, paying gas in stablecoin, and one click dapps. Built the Candide core contracts as 4337 compliant based on Safe and wrote the Social Recovery Module. Deployed the first verifying paymaster contract with an open source backend. Launched Voltaire, a fast python Bundler client written in Python. Progress on mempool decentralization and censorship resistance. Built AbstractionKit, the TS library to easily build smart wallets.

End-to-end open source, and 100% built for the global public good.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/candidelabs/","description":"Candide org's README includes a list of important repos of the stack"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.candide.dev/","description":"Developer documentations for building smart wallets"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.candidewallet.com/","description":"Candide Wallet Mobile App"}]
impactDescription: Candide raised the bar for wallet UX and safety without compromising on self-custody. Candide Wallet codebase has been leveraged by several teams including versawallet.io mobile client, bananawallet.xyz base accounts and openfort.xyz account recovery module. Voltaire, a vital infrastructure, is being used by major RPC providers LlamaNodes, BlockPi, and BlockNative to offer AA as a Service and is provided as a free endpoint instance on testnets. The AbstractionKit SDK finds utility among a growing number of independent developers and notable companies like picnicinvestimentos.com and getjoin.io

bio: Mode Domains provides “.mode” handles for the Mode Blockchain community.
contributionDescription:
Mode Domains is a decentralized naming system created on the Mode blockchain. It uses smart contracts to manage domain name registration, renewal, and resolution. It manages domains in a decentralized way, enhancing registration and resolution performance.

Thus, we allow users to claim personalized '.mode' handles for their blockchain addresses, simplifying blockchain use for a wider audience.

We allocate fees from Mode Domains to back Optimism Collective and Mode's growth. The rest funds project development and integration.

As Mode Network grows, it boosts demand for Optimism's layer 2 solutions with more users and developers. 

Overall, Mode Domains and Mode Network's growth fuels OP Stack and Optimism Collective, creating a positive feedback loop of development.

impactDescription:
One big impact is that many people have started using Mode Domains, and we have more than 28,000 people who claimed their own '.mode' addresses, which brought in a lot of new users, creating a more diverse and engaged community that's vital for the Optimism ecosystem.

We have a great community with 962 Twitter followers. This helps more people know about what we're doing and work together within the Optimism ecosystem. So, in short, what we do for the OP Stack with Mode Domains is make things better for users, get more people to use it, and work closely with the community to help the Optimism ecosystem become more efficient, secure, and successful.

impactDescription:
Kromatika has deployed Limit Orders (FELO)  and a Swap Aggregator on OP.

By using UniV3 liquidity and Keeper smart contracts, we automate limit trades, eliminating price slippage, BOT attacks and swap fees. To date : 
- $3.6M in limit orders,
- Average $924/order
- Between 1 & 9% LP fees on top of their trades.

It boasts an impressive market fit with 60-70% of new users becoming returning users!
The MetaDex Aggregator is an "aggregator of aggregators" searching for the deepest liquidity pools with lowest slippage to provide the best instant swap rates to users.
Gasless Swap will also be released soon (using Biconomy relayers) as part of the Gov Fund received.

Without any VCs/ICO rounds, Kromatika is organically growing, expanding its suite of products and among top 10 DEXs by TVL.

bio: I am a blockchain engineer who specializes in in smart contract development
contributionDescription:
1) Refactoring Optimism Codebase for Security & Standardization

OP Stack has technical debt as tests suites are split between two different frameworks. To solve this, I have refactored the code and standardized into single framework\ and make sure that we’re covering every possible case  and that we’re not missing anything, improving security.

I has done this by opening and getting them merged the following 6 PRs:

impactDescription:
Referring to Optimism monorepo ‘s issue ( https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/4980):

The smart contracts for Optimism’s  Bedrock  includes a set of test suites  written with Echidna for property testing. These contracts also have a set of test suites with Forge  for invariant tests.

In order to improving security and standardize tooling of OP stack, OP Labs is looking for contributors to help converting the Echidna tests into to Forge invariant tests.

I has completed this task by opening and getting them merged the following 6 PRs:

bio: Protocols research from all angles across many domains, open-sourced findings.
contributionDescription:
Over the summer of 2023, a group of 33 researchers participated in the inaugural Summer of Protocols program. They were tasked with exploring protocols, broadly construed, from various angles and across a range of different domains. By going broad, the researchers were able to find insights that applied in many contexts, including blockchain protocols such as Optimism and Ethereum. 

Some themes explored include the evolution of safety protocols, what "protocol death" looks like, the interplay of human agency and formulaic protocols, and more. 

The output of the program is being published for all to access. The hope is for the program to help the Ethereum and Optimism communities become more "protocol literate" and have a better theoretical understanding of how protocols work.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://summerofprotocols.com/","description":"All program and currently published outputs. "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://venkatesh-rao.gitbook.io/summer-of-protocols/","description":"Original study launching the program. "}]
impactDescription:
By studying protocols across a wide range of domains, Summer of Protocols can hopefully give participants in the Optimism Collective and the Ethereum community more generally better mental models to understand protocols. 

Blockchain ecosystems are often analogized to countries, tech platforms, companies, etc. and most reasoning happens by analogies rather than first principles thinking. SoP aims to give the OP Collective the tools to get better at the latter. 

SoP is also a way for the Ethereum community to engage with experts outside of blockchain that want to also better understand protocols for their domain of interest, and build bridges with communities we may otherwise not be able to.

bio: Node Guardians is an RPG-platform for skilled devs to test their coding skills.
contributionDescription:
Following Bedrock, Optimism has been working on Next-Gen Fault Proofs and Cannon. We wanted to be part of it by contributing to the Optimism community and help the masses shed some light on Optimism’s advancements in these areas.

We’ve provided developers an original way to learn about what interactive fraud proofs are, and why Cannon is fraud proof compatible. This resource encompasses challenges, bisection protocol, one step proof verification, and MIPS EVM.

We've also partnered with the leading French crypto media to produce a video  explaining the Superchain concept targeting end users. Our intent is to clear frequent misconceptions (that we noticed on socials) and facilitate a comprehensive understanding.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://nodeguardians.io/dev-hub/quests/interactive-fraud-proofs","description":"A programming quest about Cannon & fraud proofs."}]
impactDescription:
1. Developers' Growth: The devs delved into innovative problem-solving, exploring new avenues and methodologies, necessary for uncovering unexplored possibilities within the Optimism ecosystem.
 
2. Community Cohesion: Engaged 90+ developers, note that each user on Node Guardians has to connect his Github account to solve quests and this is how the metrics are tracked.

3. Visibility Boost: 35k views and 100+ likes on Twitter, strengthening Optimism Collective's stance in the space.

4. Technology Showcase: The fraud proof challenge highlighted the real-world applicability and efficiency of Optimism's tech.

5. Valuable Feedback: Post-quest, participants had a better understanding of OP's fraud proofs and expressed interest to delve deeper into Optimism.

6. Video - Awareness - no shilling

bio: Our team develops and maintains "Nitro" state channel protocol.
contributionDescription:
State channels research has long been central to the development of layer 2 scaling solutions, of which Optimism represents one of the foremost promising examples. In the last couple of years, our team completed a scheme of work relating to the "dispute game" mechanism which is central to the security and therefore the success of Optimism. This was approximately 18 developer weeks of effort and resulted in a github repo (https://github.com/statechannels/dispute-game) containing a detailed design of a "dissection" approach, and implementations in Typescipt and Solidity which were optimized for gas. 

We have recently written about this work on our blog https://blog.statechannels.org/dispute-game/.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/statechannels/dispute-game","description":"Dispute Game design and implementation in Solidity and Typescript"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://blog.statechannels.org/dispute-game/","description":"Blog post on our work on the dispute game"}]
impactDescription: We understand clabby (who has written recently on the latest modular approach to dispute games) found our repo most helpful. If his work is a continuation of ours, even in a small way, we feel that our efforts have certainly increased the efficiency and security of the OP Stack. By writing about the work on our blog, we have increased awareness of the OP Stack and its provenance.

bio: A collective of Ethereum's active core protocol contributors
contributionDescription:
As a rollup, Optimism leverages Ethereum for settlement & security assurances. It also uses several core infrastructure components (client implementations, specifications, test suites, etc) developed and maintained by Protocol Guild contributors over the years. Optimism also directly benefits from protocol upgrades such as proto-danksharding (EIP-4844), which will reduce the fees its users need to pay.

All of this work supports a mutual relationship;
- Ethereum provides an infrastructural foundation with particular characteristics (eg social, political, technical, economic) that only it can provide
- Optimism produces lower-cost blockspace, while still inheriting some of Ethereum's characteristics, but at the same time allowing for more experimentation
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ethereum","description":"Main repository for Ethereum’s core protocol development"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://youtu.be/xISUVbyJp6k","description":"Podcast deep dive on why something like Protocol Guild needs to exist"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YE30D6F2k28","description":"EthCC prez covering the past, present & future of Protocol Guild"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/4-roles-expectations.html#qualifications","description":"Guild member eligibility framework (requires 6+ months of core protocol work) "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-4844-shard-blob-transactions/8430","description":"EIP for proto-danksharding, which will significantly scale Ethereum’s L2s"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://notes.ethereum.org/@dankrad/new_sharding","description":"Research work for danksharding, to scale L2s by orders of magnitude"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/mega-eof-specification","description":"EOF spec, enabling opcodes for more efficient & secure development on Optimism"}]
impactDescription:
- Optimism can rely on Ethereum for settlement & security assurances, in no small part due to the research & implementation work that went into migrating to Proof-of-Stake, which helped make Ethereum the most secure & decentralized smart-contract platform
- Guild members' efforts to reduce rollup fees through proto-danksharding & danksharding will expand Optimism's use-cases and user base
- Optimism’s execution engine is a fork of Go Ethereum aka Geth, which is maintained by Guild members
- Optimism leverages the Ethereum Virtual Machine with its EVM-equivalent architecture, making Optimism's ecosystem more accessible to builders
- Ethereum's core protocol development has played a key role in establishing Ethereum's prominent reputation, lending credibility & legitimacy to Optimism as well

bio: Gas optimized Solidity snippets
contributionDescription:
- Hyper optimized low-level Solidity code, wrapped up in flexible high-level APIs.
- Implements unique features (e.g. JSONParserLib, LibSort) that make Solidity feel like a proper-high level language.
- Solady LibZip: Generalized calldata compression and Lz77 compression. With an accompanying JS / TS library.
- Cross-pollination: novel math, optimization, EVM tricks developed in Solady are ported to other projects across the OP ecosystem.
- Used by sound.xyz, OpenSea, 0xSplits, Optimism, Friendtech, etc.
- Learning resource for Solidity inline-assembly.

Overall, Solady empowers Solidity developers to develop harder, better, faster, stronger on OP ecosystem chains.

contributionDescription: RetroPGF is an awesome initiative, and I appreciate your interest in contributing. To answer your question, I think it would be great to receive contributions related to economic solutions for the current slowdown. This could include research on the effectiveness of quantitative easing in stimulating the economy. It's an important topic to explore, especially considering the potential challenges of implementing quantitative easing when inflation is high. It would also be helpful to consider other factors that should be taken into account when deciding whether to implement quantitative easing, such as the overall economic conditions and the risks involved.

bio: Love Crypto
contributionDescription: Currently, the Optimism Foundation runs the sole sequencer on OP Mainnet. This does not mean that Optimism can censor user transactions. However, it is still desirable to decentralize the sequencer over time, eliminating Optimism's role entirely so that anyone can participate in the network as a block producer.
impactDescription: As part of the OVM 2.0 upgrade, the Optimism fault proof mechanism had to be temporarily disabled. This means that users of the OP Mainnet network currently need to trust the Sequencer node (run by Optimism Foundation) to publish valid state roots to Ethereum. You can read more about our security model

bio: The central trading and liquidity marketplace on Base.
contributionDescription: Base is the Collective’s first step towards the Superchain and requires a native liquidity layer to fuel its growth. Aerodrome is a public good for Base (having had no VC funding) that returns 100% of its revenue to the ecosystem. Aerodrome is Base's largest protocol, has already onboarded 20 new protocols to the ecosystem, and has generated over $7.5M in value in 7 weeks. It is designed to support public goods, as 21% of the protocol’s voting power is dedicated to supporting key ecosystem liquidity pairs, with fees created from those pairs used to direct support to public goods on Base. Further, we have improved the developer ecosystem and decentralization by bringing best practices and ensuring 3rd-party development apps function on BASE.

bio: Exploring decentralized onchain music curation
contributionDescription:
MusicTribes pioneers the mode of interaction within the Optimism music ecosystem, bridging artists, collectives, and fans.

It aggregates NFTs from platforms like Sound.xyz, Catalog, Zora, Lens and others. Unlike traditional platforms, recommendations are defined externally by tokenized communities' input parameters. Users get content based on the community tokens they hold, avoiding conventional algorithm-driven models and fostering direct artist-to-fan engagement. This empowers artists and utility for community members, with the potential for communities to earn referral fees. Most communities have minted their tokens on the Optimism blockchain. 

Music Tribes also incorporates artists' Mirror articles, integrating another OP platform. 

Web 2 fans are Onboarded with Spotify Login
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.musictribes.xyz/","description":"recommendations of onchain music from tokenized communities "},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.musictribes.xyz/artist?artist=lnrz.eth","description":"onchain artist path with music NFTs and mirror posts"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.figma.com/file/AXqWcE6Lrq3Dgvh8LZRlXG/MusicTribes-Demos?type=whiteboard&node-id=0%3A1&t=7CvILFcOWrJWyJeO-1","description":"Demo videos"}]
impactDescription:
Bridging the gap between artists, collectives and music fans in Optimism. 

Multiple music NFT platforms are aggregated giving visibility to a large number of artists, with most being minted in OP. 

A majority of the music NFT-centric communities integrated have their tokens on Optimism. Some notable examples include: ZiggyZiggy with 3987 members, latin collective MúsicaW3, DANC3 that creates a lot of curational content,  UK based WildAwake, Invest in Music which has a curational program on Optimism, among others. On the artist side, most music NFTs recommended are minted in the Sound.xyz platform in Optimism. 

Spotify login onboards web2 users. 

Development has been a solo endeavor, with myself building backend, frontend, and design, no funding received

bio: Uniswap claim ugp
contributionDescription: Get paid to build the future of finance. Uniswap Governance offers grant funding for people building apps, tools, and activities on the Uniswap Protocol , This program is meant to be the simplest possible MVP of a Uniswap Ecosystem Grants initiative. While the multi-sig committee comes with trust assumptions about the members, our hope is the community will approve this limited engagement to get the ball rolling in an efficient structure.
impactDescription: The mission of the UGP is to provide valuable resources to help grow the Uniswap ecosystem. Through public discourse and inbound applications, the community will get first-hand exposure to identify and respond to the most pressing needs of the ecosystem, as well as the ability to support innovative projects expanding the capabilities of Uniswap. By rewarding talent early with developer incentives, bounties, and infrastructure support, UGP acts as a catalyst for growth and helps to maintain Uniswap as a nexus for DeFi on Ethereum.

bio: Golden Boys is a DeFi community of builders creating new products on Base.
contributionDescription:
Golden Boys ($GOLD) isn't just another DeFi project; it's a sanctuary for seasoned DeFi enthusiasts, developers, and marketers. Led by the renowned whale, Humpy, and featuring web3 experts from Consensys, Balancer, Badger, and Aura, we're not just here for the short game. We've weathered DeFi's ups and downs and are committed to building something enduring.

Our mission transcends just building products; we aim to cultivate a vibrant, supportive community on Base. 

Why are we so dedicated, even working below our usual rates? Because we've found a home—a place free from the "wen moon" mentality, where newcomers eager to learn can truly flourish. We're not just managing the waves of BS; we're setting a new standard for what a DeFi community can be.

impactDescription:
1. Developer Ecosystem growth
The Golden Boys project has brought 6 Web3 developers (representing the full stack) into the Optimism ecosystem. Our development team have contributed to Balancer, Badger, and other leading DeFi protocols. The launch of Golden Boys on Base has crystallized our activity on the OP stack and created a committed team of developers who are new to the Optimism Collective. We are excited to help build the DeFi ecosystem on Base.

End User Experience & Adoption
Golden Boys has brought hundreds of new users to Base. Many of these members bridged to Base the first time to participate. Our project has developed the deepest WETH/USDC liquidity on Base, a necessary asset to future growth on Base. 

A major DeFi player, Humpy, has also come to Base as our founder.

contributionDescription:
I'm excited to share with you my contributions to the cause of optimism and why I'm seeking Retroactive Public Goods Funding.
Over the past few months, I've actively participated in discussions, events, and initiatives within our community aimed at spreading positivity and fostering a welcoming atmosphere. I've made it my mission to uplift the spirits of our fellow members, offering words of encouragement, support. impactDescription:
I'd like to take a moment to reflect on the impact my contributions have had on the Optimism Collective.
I've had the privilege of witnessing and being part of a positive transformation within our community. One of my significant contributions has been the creation and maintenance of a dedicated support and mentoring channel, where I've been actively helping fellow members navigate their challenges, share advice, & provide a listening ear during their tough times.

This mentoring initiative has led to noticeable increase in the sense of unity and optimism within our community. Many members have expressed their gratitude for the support and guidance they've received & I've seen firsthand how these interactions have boosted their spirits & contributed to an overall atmosphere of positivity.

bio: Simplifying the voting RetroPGF experience: easier to face 2 than 2000
contributionDescription:
Pairwise simplifies complex decision-making by presenting only two projects at a time for list creation. This method eases voting and introduces a system where citizens can project lists with budget allocations. Offering a solution to the RetroPGF 2 challenge of assigning percentages to 196 projects for example, Pairwise divides and reduces workload by categorizing projects and emphasizing individual expertise so that citizens can focus their vote on their areas of knowledge, ensuring both simplified and informed voting. The algorithm mirrors the Elo system used in games like League of Legends, where project comparison leads to more precise decisions.

We've crafted a completely new game experience for citizens, and we're eager for citizens to explore it.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-frontend","description":"Optimism game UI with Rainbow Kit wallet connect."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-backend","description":"Backend for Optimism game: collations & algorithm."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-retropgf3-categorize","description":"AI-driven API for project categorization in Optimism game."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://pairwise.retropgf.com/","description":"Witness innovative list creation & reshaping of community decisions."}]
impactDescription: Pairwise was developed to enhance the RetroPGF decision-making process. Optimism currently has the power to use it when RetroPGF final data is made available. With streamlined choices, members can engage with projects more intuitively and suited to their knowledge, ensuring better decisions. The dynamic unlocking feature keeps the process engaging, allowing greater influence over time. Strategic allocation ensures votes align with individual visions. Beyond just vote simplification, Pairwise amplifies badgeholders' voices, championing true digital democracy. Focused on strengthening Optimism’s ecosystem, Pairwise stands as a pivotal tool, enabling badgeholders to efficiently contribute their expertise, maximizing impact with minimal time and creating a realm where every insight is valued.

bio: Cross-Chain Privacy Protocol
contributionDescription: Nata Network has been live on Mainnet since June 2023. The privacy focused ZK-rollup is a fork of Aztec deployed to Polygon POS, granting users fully private transactions at an affordable cost. The network has surpassed 10,000 unique addresses and has been optimizing the network for multiple chain support with a unified privacy set.
impactDescription: Optimism's users have very little privacy focused application (only zkBOB?) to choose from natively on the rollup. Users on Optimism can bridge funds to Polygon to access Nata Network's privacy ZK-rollup, then bridge funds back to a new address on Optimism.

bio: a blockchain data analyst
contributionDescription:
Here are some potential contributions I can make:

Network Metrics: Monitor and analyze key network metrics such as transaction throughput, block confirmation times, gas fees, and network congestion. Visualize these metrics to provide a clear understanding of the network's performance and scalability.

User Activity: Track and analyze user activity on the Optimism blockchain, including the number of active addresses, daily transaction volume, and popular dApps or smart contracts. Identify trends and patterns to gain insights into user behavior and adoption.

bio: Expert Cryptographer for 19 years (17 Defense then 2 Eth ecosystem).
contributionDescription:
I deployed the most gas optimized version of the computation of curve secp256r1, as described in my paper. I pushed the contract over polygon and optimism testnet so that anyone can build application on top.

Main application is the verification of WebAuthn authentication. Using this work, we managed to win the Ethereum NY hackaton with our project wallet abstraction. https://github.com/qd-qd/wallet-abstraction. 

The maths implied there will also be applicable to ed25519 i'm working on, when this curve, that belongs to FIDO2 spec is integrated in WebAuthn.

Please note that the eoA I used to deploy the contract is the same that i used to win the hackaton. (verifiable Poaps and prizes there).
impactDescription:
The deployment makes something tought as possible only through precompiles with pure solidity code. While some less efficient implementation are available there and there, our precomputation version remains at least x5 cheaper than our competitors.

It also makes secp256r1 as a candidate for EIP4337 custom signer, to couple with the secure enclave of a smartphone. Now available on Optimism.

bio: We're a web3 software development studio.
contributionDescription:
We identified a great barrier hindering the integration of blockchain technology in regular projects: the complexity and steep learning curve associated with blockchain interaction.
Hence, we created a platform simplifying blockchain interaction for developers. It provides user-friendly REST APIs for various blockchain functionalities: creating and managing NFTs, decentralized file storage, creating ERC20 tokens, etc., making it easier and faster for devs to integrate apps on the OP Mainnet

Our impact:
Adoption: Our platform has significantly reduced the barrier to entry

Education: Through our series of workshops, we've educated developers, helping them deploy their first smart contract

Engagement: Our engagement with local and global communities has fostered a collaborative environment
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://platform.wakeuplabs.io/","description":"WakeUp's Platform"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/wakeuplabs/Optimism-Workshop-Clase1","description":"OP Workshop Class 1"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/wakeuplabs/Optimism-Workshop-Clase2","description":"OP Workshop Class 2"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/wakeuplabs/workshop-seed-mendoza","description":"OP Workshop IRL"}]
impactDescription:
Our contributions have played a pivotal role in bridging the knowledge gap, enabling a broader spectrum of developers to engage with blockchain technologies without the need for extensive prior knowledge. By simplifying blockchain interaction, we have accelerated the rate of adoption and innovation on the Optimism network. 

Our educational initiatives, in partnership with local communities for developer workshops, have further fostered a robust developer community, expanding the pool of skilled individuals capable of contributing to the Optimism ecosystem. We generated a meeting point with developers interested in developing on Optimism, with a focus on Latin America, creating high-quality Spanish content.

impactDescription: Utilizing ZK technology, Tusima zkBridge securely transmits the source chain’s status to the destination chain. Users can directly access the source chain certificate on the destination chain and independently verify it, thereby enhancing security. Throughout the entire proof process of Tusima zkBridge — starting from ‘Chain A → Sender → zkRelayer → ZK Verifier → Receiver → Chain B’ — verification of information transfer relies solely on mathematical and cryptographic formulas. Once the code is successfully deployed, no external forces can affect or interfere with this cross-chain process.

bio: REYIELD is an AI investment platform that simplifies the investment tools.
contributionDescription: We've simplified complex DeFi investment tools and offer an AI personal financial assistant along with an automatic compound interest tool. We've integrated with the Optimism Pair on Uniswap V3. Leveraging Optimism's low gas fees, users can maximize their asset returns.
impactDescription: By integrating with the Uniswap V3 Optimism Pair, users can easily provide liquidity on Optimism through REYIELD Finance, enhancing the depth of the Optimism trading pool. Users can also understand the advantages of Optimism through our product. Apart from the low Gas Fee, the transaction speed is much faster than Ethereum's.

bio: Web2 dev by day, web3 dev in spare time. Pooltogether contributor
contributionDescription:
mint-to-atst: This project allows to issue an attestation from the deployer of a NFT smart contract to the minter of said NFT automatically.

We use a demo smart contract for NFT from thirdweb https://thirdweb.com/thirdweb.eth/OpenEditionERC721

Alchemy is used for listening to the NFT smart contract mints and send a webhook to a cloudflare worker https://www.alchemy.com/custom-webhooks

The cloudflare worker receives mint events from the alchemy webhook. It does the atst creation from the contract deployer

bio: Digital Laboratory building public goods for cities
contributionDescription:
Since 2020, zenbit.eth has undertaken an extensive collaborative research and development initiative with 27 talented individuals with a diverse skill set, from around the world. Together, they have developed over 25 public Open Source Projects, primarily at ETH Global hackathons.

These digital solutions encompass seven categories, leveraging advanced Ethereum technologies to address cities´ challenges like transparency, efficiency, and coordination. Our main contribution is the development of over 60 Solidity contracts deployed across multiple EVMs, with ≈28% of these contracts tested on the Optimism mainnet or Op Goerli networks. This has resulted in gas fee expenditure of  .116 ETH, bridging ≈10 ETH to the OP mainnet, and locking ≈4k USD in 2 OP chains until 2026.

bio: Open Source, Permissionless & privacy conscious DeFi portfolio tracker
contributionDescription:
LlamaFolio is a portfolio tool to help users track their on-chain assets.

At a high level, end users can check (for any wallet address):
- Wallet positions: ERC20 balances
- DeFi positions: lending/borrowing, farming, staking, claimable rewards, health factors, stable vs volatile distribution and more
- Transactions history: transactions from/to, tokens sent/received, gas used
- Calendar: important upcoming events like ENS expiration, DAO proposals of tokens they're invested in, tokens vest/unlock

LlamaFolio is open source and accepts contributions from all developers to help gather the most accurate on-chain info and be as transparent as possible.
impactDescription:
- LlamaFolio supports 38 DeFi protocols on Optimism for a cumulative TVL of $577m (according to DefiLlama).
- Our API is being used by LlamaSwap (DEX aggregator) to retrieve users tokens balances (>$726m volume on Optimism and Base).
- Open sourced our API (http://github.com/llamafolio/llamafolio-api) (8 contributors)
- Open sourced a registry of popular tokens (https://github.com/llamafolio/llamafolio-tokens) (~4k download on npm)
- Open sourced an EVM indexer (compatible with Optimism)(https://github.com/llamafolio/evm-indexer) (20+ forks on github)

bio: I make YouTube videos explaining Ethereum, L2s, and the World Computer vision.
contributionDescription:
I try in my videos to explain important concepts relating to Ethereum and L2s in a visual way. I aim to make the diagrams intricate, visually appealing, and technically accurate. The technology in this space is complex and moving quickly. Most resources are text-only. I find it really helpful to have high quality visuals to refer to.

The people that I hope to help and inspire with my videos are the founders and creators of tomorrow. If we can inspire builders to build great things in this space, the rest will follow. I don't make videos for a broad/casual audience, I make content for those who want to go deep!

I've had many people and orgs reach out and say that my videos have helped them. I hope to help many more!
impactDescription: It's hard for me to measure the impact of my videos, but I think that I've helped many builders and enthusiasts understand the technology in this space better. I've done a few videos on ZK and Optimistic roll-ups, and I've received a lot of positive feedback on them. I've also tried to paint the picture for grand vision of the World Computer (Ethereum + L2s) concept, and I hope that has inspired some people. I have many more videos on the way along these lines!

bio: A web3 enthusisast
contributionDescription:
Optimism was built to empower humanity through decentralized blockchain technology that enables unprecedented coordination of human intelligence across the globe, at scale. And there is a lot to celebrate: by our estimation, over the past two years, OP Mainnet has cumulatively saved users $2.69 billion in fees, 15.8 years of waiting for transaction confirmations, and currently secures $2.8 billion in onchain value.

But the reality is: nobody has truly scaled Ethereum. That includes us.

If Ethereum is to rival the goliaths of web2, and take software’s next bite of the world, it needs internet-level scale. No single chain today can offer that.

bio: A curated list of awesome resources related to the Optimism ecosystem
contributionDescription:
Awesome Optimism Repository is one of the “Ecosystem Project Ideas” in the Optimism Collective Ecosystem Contributions” repository. We took the lead in creating and contributing to the repository, where we added, updated, and organized content to create a curated and comprehensive list of resources related to Optimism Ecosystem. 

The repository includes a wide range of resources that will be helpful for developers and enthusiasts. You can find everything from analytics, research articles, tutorial videos, development tools and open-source projects in the Optimism ecosystem.

bio: GasHawk saves users and institutions up to 95% on transaction fees.
contributionDescription:
GasHawk provides a non custodial, automated, transaction manager focused on gas savings that can be used by end users, contract deployers, institutions and projects building on the OP Stack. We have already integrated with multiple apps in the ecosystem and provide much needed tooling and developer infrastructure which enables developers to cheaply and securely deploy and interact with dapps, improving the quality and security of applications, drive considerable value to the Optimism ecosystem, help retain projects and developers, and unlock new application designs.

We have also spent considerable amounts of time and resources providing research and implementation into Optimism Sequencer Address which shows we can save Optimism millions per year.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://gashawk.io/","description":"Website"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://dhannum8.mirror.xyz/jfTJHSfPyRbO2_alyTsrZnkW_kk56llj7KKKjZGiGck","description":"Mirror Article on GasHawks work for Optimisms Sequencer Address"}]
impactDescription:
GasHawk has helped to improve adoption and create stronger developer tooling and infrastructure. This infrastructure has helped developers, individuals and dapps on Optimism. We are currently a public good and do not charge users for use of our service or take any % of the amount we save.

GasHawk is a versatile service designed for a wide range of users, including developers deploying contracts, artists releasing NFT collections, platforms, protocols, relayers, collectors, investors, and everyday users.

GasHawk has successfully processed 16,281 transactions for 4,005 users.

Additionally we have shown that at minimum GasHawk can save Optimism millions of dollars per year with our intelligent submission strategies for its sequencer address.

bio: Community-curated crypto media dapp & open source P2P protocol
contributionDescription:
Kiwi helps crypto builders find the best content without social media noise. Our community consumes hundreds of sources a month to handpick and upvote top content for crypto founders & developers. From tweets, through essays, up to Dune dashboards and GitHub repos.

We a use P2P architecture - similar to Farcaster - so that most heavy data is stored offchain and only the most important elements, such as delegations & NFTs are stored onchain. The architecture promotes credible neutrality as it lets users run p2p nodes or clients with their own UI & moderation rules, such as kiwinews.lol run by our contributor, freeatnet or Kiwi News Search by matallo.

We are 100% Open Source. Our R&D on scaling ETH via the P2P protocol and OP key delegation  can be reused by others.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WujtU15yAyk","description":"4 minute pitch about what Kiwi News is and why we are building it"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://news.kiwistand.com","description":"Kiwi News Main Site"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://etherscan.io/address/0xebb15487787cbf8ae2ffe1a6cca5a50e63003786","description":"\"Kiwi Pass\" contract that determines who can upvote or submit new links"},{"type":"CONTRACT_ADDRESS","url":"https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x08b7ECFac2c5754ABafb789c84F8fa37c9f088B0","description":"Delegator2 contract to help delegating to an emphemeral frontend key for web2 UX"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/attestate/kiwistand","description":"Kiwi News Protocol implementation"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://attestate.com/kiwistand/main/protocol-guide.html","description":"Docs how Kiwi News Protocol works under the hood (set reconciliation)"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i6RmoO5fSO4","description":"timdaub's talk on set reconciliation algorithm at Protocol Berg 2023 (audio=bad)"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/attestate/awesome-kiwinews","description":"awesome-kiwinews ecosystem GitHub that lists all on-going projects"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/attestate/delegator2#readme","description":"Delegator2 Key authority event log for Kiwi News Protocol"}]
impactDescription:
UX: 
We separate signals from noise. We are a trusted news source for builders, hence, we‘re strengthening the ecosystem. We had 5300+ unique visitors. We have around 80 monthly curators and 1,200 monthly readers.

OP Stack:
Our p2p protocol helps scale ETH. We use NFTs to authorize who can upvote/submit. We implement identity, i.e., FC and ENS. We store 4700 EIP-712 upvotes on our “side p2p network," to minimize onchain storage. We’ve delegated 123 keys to improve UX. We help to scale OP.

DX:
4 people (including us) have been shipping on Kiwi since April: Kiwi Search, kiwinews.lol and us. Delegator2 is a web3 UX breakthrough. We’ve co-organized DeSo meetups in Denver, Paris & Berlin. We gave talks at Protocol Berg, and Broadcast Summit. We’re growing DeSo on OP.

bio: Blockchain analytics provider working to bring transparency to crypto data
contributionDescription:
Our team has worked on a large variety of projects across Optimism, as well as Superchain projects such as Base. Slice focuses on bringing transparency to crypto data, by providing it in an easy to understand manner to the general public. In turn we help users on Optimism and Base use data driven insights to make decisions.

1. Our OpenIndexer project: 

Every web3 project requires on-chain information. Inspired by BuildOnBase, we decided to create OpenIndexer.

2. Mirror Optimism NFT Tracker

We worked with Mirror to help track all of the subscriber + writing NFTs minted to collectors.

3. Friend.Tech Tooling Dashboards

Our team built out multiple dashboards to help Friend.Tech users trade/purchase new keys with sufficient data to avoid being scammed/rug pulled.

impactDescription:
Our team has provided countless data driven insights/custom queries to companies, DAO's, and individuals in the crypto space. These insights have helped the Optimism & Base communities by providing helpful data in an easy to understand manner. This driving adoption to new protocols built within the collective.

Our team is one of the leading providers of data and tooling on Friend.Tech where our dashboards are visited daily by users looking to understand FT in a more holistic manner, as well as avoid scam accounts.

Slice Analytics has never received funding, and our core team is entirely bootstrapped. Receiving retroactive funding for our work on Optimism and Base would be monumental in allowing us to continue to produce valuable free tools for the public.

bio: Running Lead @Ogdao
contributionDescription:
Director Removal is the right of governance to remove a director of the Optimism Foundation.

Director Removals are approved by both the Token House and Citizens’ House. Stewards of the Optimism Foundation should be accountable to the entire community.

This right is enforced and upheld by the legal documents that underpin the Optimism Foundation’s commitment to the Collective. As Directors are not represented onchain, this responsibility does not have onchain enforceability.

bio: Serial OP Stack forker
contributionDescription:
Over the last year, I have built multiple forks of the OP Stack in an effort to push the boundaries of what is possible on-chain; some of them have been featured in the OP Stack documentation. The scope of my forks includes the rollup driver (op-node) and execution engine (op-geth). Some of these projects are:
- Ticking-Optimism: A fork of op-node that adds a system transaction calling a predefined address every block.
- Concrete: A framework for building application-specific rollups on the OP Stack.
- Shadow Rollup: An indexer rollup that tracks the gas consumption of every smart contract in another rollup by re-deriving it from L1 with a custom execution engine.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/therealbytes/status/1623030030660927488","description":"Twitter thread presenting ticking-optimism and ticking-conway"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/therealbytes/status/1658552995926163457","description":"Twitter thread presenting Concrete"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://twitter.com/therealbytes/status/1668301322481704960","description":"Twitter thread presenting Mudtendo"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://ethglobal.com/showcase/shadow-rollup-k712d","description":"ETHGlobal project page about Shadow Rollup"}]
impactDescription:
OP Stack
- My projects showcase the modularity of the OP Stack and prove the technical feasibility of multiple types of modifications of it.
- The Cannon prover for Concrete is a particularly good example of an instance where a VM-based rollup proof (OP Stack) is superior to a program-based one (e.g., most zkEVMs).
- I lowered the barrier of entry for developers to to build custom rollups using the OP Stack by building some of the necessary tooling (e.g., Concrete) and setting a foundation for other forks to build on.

Developer Ecosystem
- I accumulated over 100k views on Twitter related to OP Stack forks.
- My work convinced other developers to build on the OP Stack.
- Two of my projects (ticking-optimism and ticking-conway) are featured in the OP Stack documentation.

bio: An L2 for Autonomous Agents and DePIN projects
contributionDescription:
Stamp ⊙ is an OP Stack chain focused on serving digital entities such as AI agents, IoT devices, and robots. 

Starting from the heuristic that the future of work will be digital. These entities need to coordinate among themselves and with humans. We are developing the tooling and ecosystem for builders to create new protocols and dapps on top of Stamp.

Stamp aims to be a member of the Superchain. Following Optimism's model, we will use the sequencer's revenue to fund OSS to support digital entities and human prosperity.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://stamp.network","description":"Landing Page"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.stamp.network","description":"Docs"},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/stampnetwork","description":"Stamp's Github"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://explorerl2-bender-testnet-lfrqkj1nm4.t.conduit.xyz","description":"Testnet block scanner"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.0u0.ai/","description":"0u0.ai - AI experiment for governance"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://github.com/stampnetwork/tracemy","description":"TraceMy - DePIN experiment"}]
impactDescription:
This initiative is still very much in alpha. Until now, the focus has been creating an ecosystem of partners to support the chain and researching tooling. This led to the start of two ongoing initiatives:
- RoboId: DID-based identifiers for digital entities. 
- Access Control: OCAPs (Object Capabilities) for advanced permissions with seamless integration with SIWE (Sign in With Ethereum).

Stamp is becoming the go-to solution for DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network) projects. Other blockchains are working on the DePIN vertical, such as Peaq on Polkadot, Helium on Solana, and IoTeX as its own L1. 

Accepted into Amsterdam Startup Booster to track bikes (https://senseable.mit.edu/bike-trafficking/) through a DePIN project we are working on called TraceMy.

bio: I am an active defi user, with a primary focus on the options space.
contributionDescription: I have been active in options market making and arbitrage on Optimism, leading to more efficient and better prices for defi users on mainnet. Such tasks involve the development of private software to amalgamate quotes from centralized exchanges and run statistical analysis on historical data in order to arrive at a pricing model. In addition, I have been active in OP governance since the launch of the OP Collective.
impactDescription: I believe having the most liquid and highly traded markets is key to a successful ecosystem. There is a natural monopoly that develops for markets that are able to bootstrap and attract the most liquidity and offer their users the best price execution. However, as protocols upgrade, development time is needed to keep up, with very low profit incentive.

bio: I explore the intersection of crypto and politics.
contributionDescription: The Blockchain Socialist is a platform going on 4 years for exploring the intersection of crypto and politics through blogs, podcasts, and videos that are freely available to anyone. The funding of public goods in crypto acknowledges that there is necessary work to be done to create a crypto space that does not only reward financial speculation and how this is done is a political question. The vast majority of my content is freely available to allow for a space for those working in the crypto space to be able to understand the political implications of their work and to be able to apply political theory to crypto. My conversations with figures like Vitalik Buterin, Amir Taaki, etc. have been educating thousands over the internet on the fundamentals of the technology and its politics.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://theblockchainsocialist.com/","description":"The Blockchain Socialist website with all content available"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://www.youtube.com/@theblockchainsocialist6121","description":"YouTube channel"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://theblockchainsocialist.buzzsprout.com/","description":"Podcast Feed"}]
impactDescription: I believe the impact my contributions have taken include educating thousands of people working in crypto on political theory as well as to people outside of the space who are less interested in speculating on the benefits of the technology. This was shown to me when I was invited to speak at Zuzalu in May about my work with Primavera De Filippi on Coord-Nations, receiving multiple Ethereum Foundation Impact Gifts from those working on the core infrastructure of Ethereum thanking me for my work, and being asked to write my book Blockchain Radicals which came out this year and was praised by Vitalik Buterin.

bio: IPFS is an open system to manage content-addressed data without a central server
contributionDescription:
- Development and maintenance of the IPFS protocols and specifications.
- Operation of two major IPFS gateways.
- Production of one major IPFS implementation (kubo).
- Advocacy, governance work, and clear specifications with an open and legitimate process to support the wider community.
- Documentation and code examples to help people use IPFS.
- Bringing IPFS to browsers, browser engines, and in cURL so as to support better dApps and bridge web2 over.
impactDescription:
IPFS is a system for moving data across decentralized networks, with >11M weekly users and 250K public p2p nodes. Highlights:

1. Off-chain storage. IPFS provides verifiable, off-chain storage, often used to reduce on-chain needs in Ethereum & Optimism. Examples: TrueBlocks (local IPFS-based index for EVM chains, built with grants from OP & EF), Snapshot (IPFS-based off-chain voting).

2. Go-to distribution network for fully decentralized third-party app frontends (for gaming, DeFi, & more). We run gateway services that serve 900M requests/wk, and added native IPFS support to browsers like Chromium & Brave.

3. NFT metadata gold standard. Over 115M NFTs are stored on IPFS, including leading platforms OpenSea (which supports Optimism NFTs), Rarible, and Zora.

bio: Eth-Volcano is driven by community adoption via Ethereum education.
contributionDescription:
We are an education resource hub for Ethereum in El Salvador. Our achievements include an in-person conference, a university partnership to teach solidity, and an active Twitter. 

In-person conference: 

Eth-Volcano launch event was in May 2023, and approximately 80 people attended from around the country, Central America, and North America!  

Speaking topics included but weren't limited to Ethereum origins, L2s role in the ecosystem, and the most anticipated talk: Legal Hour, the new El Salvador Digital Asset Regulation.

University Partnership:

We partnered with La Universidad de Matias of El Salvador and Eth-Kipu to teach "Ethereum Developer Pack". A Salvadoran smart-contract developer leads the instruction. 28 people attended. 

Twitter:
We engage in education spaces and content.

impactDescription:
Our primary focus has been to bring Ethereum education awareness in a country that is already familiar with the word "Bitcoin." Our efforts sought to demystify and introduce the impact that smart contracts currently have and could later have in the future. 

We have aimed to inspire Salvadorans that they, too, can be part of this future.  By working on being a trusted source of information, knowledge, and guidepost, we have laid the groundwork for El Salvador to learn to adopt smart contracts and continue their journey to learn Ethereum. 

As a result of our efforts:
28 new developers are undergoing Ethereum Developer Pack

2477 total attendees

295,400 impressions with 406 followers

bio: Simplifying the voting RetroPGF experience: easier to face 2 than 2000
contributionDescription:
Pairwise simplifies complex decision-making by presenting only two projects at a time for list creation. This method eases voting and introduces a system where citizens can project lists with budget allocations. Offering a solution to the RetroPGF 2 challenge of assigning percentages to 196 projects for example, Pairwise divides and reduces workload by categorizing projects and emphasizing individual expertise so that citizens can focus their vote on their areas of knowledge, ensuring both simplified and informed voting. The algorithm mirrors the Elo system used in games like League of Legends, where project comparison leads to more precise decisions.

We've crafted a completely new game experience for citizens, and we're eager for citizens to explore it.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-frontend","description":"Optimism game UI with Rainbow Kit wallet connect."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-backend","description":"Backend for Optimism game: collations & algorithm."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/GeneralMagicio/pw-retropgf3-categorize","description":"AI-driven API for project categorization in Optimism game."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://pairwise.retropgf.com/","description":"Witness innovative list creation & reshaping of community decisions."}]
impactDescription: Pairwise was developed to enhance the RetroPGF decision-making process. Optimism currently has the power to use it when RetroPGF final data is made available. With streamlined choices, members can engage with projects more intuitively and suited to their knowledge, ensuring better decisions. The dynamic unlocking feature keeps the process engaging, allowing greater influence over time. Strategic allocation ensures votes align with individual visions. Beyond just vote simplification, Pairwise amplifies badgeholders' voices, championing true digital democracy. Focused on strengthening Optimism’s ecosystem, Pairwise stands as a pivotal tool, enabling badgeholders to efficiently contribute their expertise, maximizing impact with minimal time and creating a realm where every insight is valued.

bio: Gelato is web3's cloud platform
contributionDescription:
At Gelato, we are dedicated to propelling the development and widespread adoption of Optimism. Our efforts have been instrumental in elevating the Optimism ecosystem, solidifying our position as web3's leading cloud platform. We wholeheartedly believe in the transformative potential of decentralized solutions and have relentlessly championed the growth of Optimism.
Through our middleware services, including Automate, Web3 Functions, and Account Abstraction, we've automated over 144,568 transactions on Optimism and enabled frictionless gasless transactions. This profound impact has driven substantial adoption and growth across a diverse range of projects. Notably, Optimism leads as the primary network for Automate task creations. Currently, 39 projects are using Gelato Services on Optimism.

impactDescription:
Since 2022, we have been at the forefront of providing a comprehensive suite of middleware services meticulously integrated into the heart of Optimism's ecosystem. 

These services (Automate, Relay, Web3 Functions) have not only elevated the functionality but have also enriched the user experience for a diverse array of applications. Some of which include Kwenta, Beefy, Synthetic, Abracadabra, Brahma, Connext, r3vl, portals.fi and many more.

In our pursuit of simplifying blockchain deployment, we also introduced Gelato RaaS empowering developers to effortlessly launch Rollups with just a single click. 

Further, we  allocated OP tokens received as part of a past grant to support and incentivize developers. Some past projects we've funded include Ricochet, Nexter and Blockpeer Finance.

bio: The unified Superchain explorer
contributionDescription:
The Superscan (https://superscan.network) is a unified block explorer for the Superchain, unifying data points at the ecosystem level, built by the same team that built Avascan (https://avascan.info), the world's first unified multi-chain block explorer.

The Superscan launched on July 20th.

Think of it like Debank, but for everything you normally use on a block explorer:
- Unified home page that shows blocks, txs and L1 <> L2 txs made in real-time [https://superscan.network]
- Single-chain explorer for every OP Chain: OP Mainnet | Base |Zora | PGN
- Unified contract verification compatible with Etherscan APIs
- REST (native) and Etherscan compatible API endpoints
- Aggregated charts and tools with single chain comparison
And more.

We also designed Superchain and Superscan logos.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://superscan.network","description":"Unified Superchain explorer home page"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://mainnet.superscan.network","description":"OP Mainnet single-chain explorer"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://base.superscan.network","description":"Base single-chain explorer"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://zora.superscan.network","description":"Zora single-chain explorer"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://pgn.superscan.network","description":"Public Goods Network (PGN) single-chain explorer"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://arc.net/e/A6A13C70-73E2-412B-B263-99F4134A13E2","description":"Superchain logo / logotype"},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://arc.net/e/B1EDF50A-93D0-4230-9CD5-490B57FD0D9D","description":"Superscan logo / logotype"}]
impactDescription:
As a unified block explorer for the whole Superchain ecosystem, the Superscan is the most usable block explorer for users and developers that operate and work on the Superchain.

Users don't need to hop from one block explorer to the other when bridging between OP Chains, and developers can quickly debug cross-chain application from the unified Contract Details page (example: https://superscan.network/address/0xABCDEFEd93200601e1dFe26D6644758801D732E8)

This is THE block explorer to showcase the present and the future of the Superchain.

impactDescription:
These NFTs expand the Sunny-verse with optimistic characters who:
1. Celebrate the launch of new op-stack chains
2. Give people an delightful way to mint their first Zora-chain and Base-chain NFT
3. Spread the OP brand and meme of Sunny, the unofficial (I believe!) optimism mascot
4. As onchain SVGs, this animated art can be code-inspected, copied and riffed on

Most importantly, the art and the description text present the work and the chains they're  deployed on as territory for wholesome enthusiasm, onchain creativity, and a positive message to builders and minters: You got this! You can do it! Go get it! Stay optimistic!

bio: Tripsha helps launch startup cities and other extended community gatherings.
contributionDescription: We built what we believe is the first asynchronous crypto payments system dedicated to event ticketing. We used Optimism as the L2 network of choice for processing registration payments for ZuConnect (Oct 29-Nov 11), the second ever instance of Zuzalu (Vitalik Buterin's startup city). This helped bring awareness of and new users to Optimism. Marine Andraud (a fellow Zuzaluan and Infra Partnership Manager at OP Labs) contributed a helpful onboarding guide on how to pay on Tripsha using Optimism. The way it works is that prospective attendees answer application questions and pre-authorize a token transfer of the amount they need to pay. Event organizers collectively review individual applications, which, if approved, submit the token transfer on chain.
impactDescription: Brought users, awareness, and an interesting use case of asynchronous crypto payments to Optimism in the community event space, targeting a high quality group of crypto early adopters and other applicants to Vitalik Buterin's startup city. It created an educational point for those who hadn't already experienced Optimism or using an L2 before.

bio: Taiwan-based, trusted independent media dedicated to Web3 education since 2017
contributionDescription:
Blocktrend has been a contributor to the Taiwanese community's understanding of the Optimism ecosystem since early 2022. Through our original content, podcasts, and communication, it has simplified complex blockchain concepts and promoted governance participation.

Taiwan's crypto participants view Blocktrend as a leading advocate for advancing Web3 public goods funding mechanism and actively promoting community governance participation. Our efforts have played a crucial role in bridging the gap between the Chinese-speaking audience and the world of Web3, making it an essential resource for those interested in blockchain technology and Optimism.

impactDescription:
My contributions have had a substantial impact on the Optimism Collective in Chinese community. I authored various articles and engaged in podcasting to amplify the importance of the digital public goods, encouraging users to actively participate in Optimism ecosystem. Additionally, I explored RetroPGF concepts, underlining its commitment to supporting public goods.

For example, my extensive coverage of RetroPGF included an article on 'Simulated Voting.' This aimed to provide readers with a firsthand understanding of the challenges faced by badgeholders when evaluating 195 projects within a tight timeframe. Additionally, I underscored the distinction between retroactive funding, which rewards based on outcomes, and traditional investments, which are based on expectations of future impact.

bio: UFO is an onchain radio network and club for music, arts and ideas.
contributionDescription:
In one year, UFO has grown from 0 subscribers to 9K on Base, 31K on Lens, 14K on Mirror, 16K on X, 6K on Zora by experimenting with onchain media, mostly in the OP ecosystem. Many of our 41 podcasts with founders, builders and artists have focused on the OP ecosystem.

We are assembling an onchain radio network with partners incl. Zora, Base, Mirror, Lens Protocol, Bonfire, Interface, Lore, Coinvise, XMTP and Paragraph. The build will be open source.

NOV 11, UFO Genesis Pass on Mirror with 7812 mints. Top 5 for collects on Mirror (OP)

JUN 27, first podcast to mint our catalog to an 1155 on Zora network with 5370 total mints

AUG 30, FM TOUR for onchain summer with Base and Bonfire with 8889 mints

OCT 23, UFO was among the first to mint a Paragraph newsletter on Zora network

impactDescription:
By being early and experimenting in onchain media and web3 social, we have the DMs to show we have inspired media and community strategies for Nouns Builder projects, publications, wallets, artist collectives, podcasts, zines, musicians, and creative platforms.

We have demonstrated the effectiveness for media publications to use multiple platforms such as Mirror, Zora, Bonfire and Lens, and across chains including Ethereum, Optimism, Zora and Base. 

We help to amplify the signal for revolutionary ideas, and because we regularly talk about the evolution of onchain media for artists and creatives, many of our 41 podcast episodes have focused on the Optimism ecosystem, particularly via Mirror, Zora and Base.

bio: Collective of people from Berlin: Protocol Berg, Goerli Testnet.
contributionDescription:
The Department of Decentralization is a collective of people from various crypto- and blockchain communities in and around Berlin. The group assembled to organize events like ETHBerlin, Protocol Berg, or GoerliCon and has been providing infrastructure such as the Goerli and now the Holešky testnet.

We aim to be an agnostic vehicle to drive adoption, educate newcomers, and raise awareness of the challenges and benefits of decentralization and open-source software.

Optimism benefits from public infrastructure such as the Goerli testnet, which has been the primary layer-1 for the optimistic Goerli testnet in the past year.  In addition, the Optimism Foundation has been represented at the past year's ETHBerlin and Protocol Berg.

impactDescription: The Goerli testnet is still the most frequented public Ethereum testnet by all metrics, seeing more than 240 million transactions and 28 million active accounts. The optimistic Goerli testnet has seen 30 million transactions with over 4 million active accounts. The events we organize host roughly 1000 hackers and attendees. Our social media community has 11k followers.

bio: Africa's foremost campus web3 bootcamp, helping devs transition to web3.
contributionDescription:
We have contributed to optimism by building a strong community of web3 developers and enthusiast alike, through our series of community events, conferences and technical bootcamp.
Over the years we've train people technical and non-technical, who are actively developing and contributing to optimism and the web3 ecosystem at large in various capacity.

impactDescription:
We helped train developers and equip them with the necessary technical skillset to building Dapps on the Ethereum and Optimism ecosystem.
We offer several free to use and open to attend community programme for aspiring web3 devs and enthusiasts alike, leading to significant growth of web3 adoption in the larger campus community.
We hope the retroPGF funding would motivate us a lot to push for an OP centric development bootcamp and OP exclusive workshops, leveraging our strong community and expertise.

bio: Driving Web3 Advancement in Africa through Talent Development & Tech Innovation.
contributionDescription:
We're dedicated to equipping African builders with skills and supporting their innovations to address challenges.
Trained 66 professionals in product design, management, and smart contract engineering.
These professionals showcased their expertise in 10 global hackathons, securing over $17,000 in prizes.
Since April, our community expanded to 1,312 Ethereum and L2-focused builders, actively collaborating and innovating.
Engaged 254 Ghanaian computer science students with the Ethereum Campus Tour, introducing them to blockchain's core concepts.
The Ayathon at Web3Lagos in August 2023, focusing on L2s, featured 18 projects with 104 participants.
Our model equips Africans with skills, fosters community growth, offers global opportunities, and supports innovations for continent-wide adoption.

impactDescription: We have played a pivotal role in beginning to bridge the knowledge gap around Ethereum and L2s, including Optimism and Base, on the African continent. By cultivating a community of passionate builders, we have equipped a new wave of innovators with the tools and understanding they need to harness the power of blockchain technology. These projects confront diverse challenges, from preserving African heritage to introducing digital identity solutions. By also facilitating educational outreaches and deepening collaborations, we've expanded our influence. Regular feedback loops and mentorship programs further solidify our impact. We're wholeheartedly convinced that enabling African builders to solve local dilemmas will exponentially boost blockchain acceptance continent-wide.

bio: Harness the power of blockchain to create an equitable future for all.
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective's commitment to transparency and collaboration stood out. As my involvement deepened I transitioned from passive to active participation, collaborating on real-world blockchain solutions. Through the collective, I learned that blockchain's true power lies in its communities.

With RetroPGF, I could add or create a better cohort with talents in onboarding and educating new or seasoned users to better understand and leverage on-chain application.
impactDescription:
Goals and Objectives:
1. Simplify Onboarding.
2. Increase User Adoption.
3. Community Engagement.
4. Educational Resources.

Challenges Faced:
Integrating Optimism's Layer 2 solution with Perpetual Protocol presented technical challenges that required extensive collaboration with developers. Educating users about Layer 2 technology and the advantages of using Optimism required a concerted effort through clear and accessible resources.

Scaling Impact: Our success will serve as a model for fostering user adoption and onboarding across other blockchain projects, ultimately contributing to the growth of the entire blockchain ecosystem.

bio: Baseswap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) on Base with several products.
contributionDescription:
Baseswap utilizes Optimism's tech through Base network and aims to have a user-friendly decentralized exchange, parallel to that of the CEX experience by generating more volume and transactions than anyone else on Base chain. Focusing on perpetual trading, liquidity solutions, and innovative features. These features are all powered by Base utilizing Optimisms' tech and has impressed many developers and users with the capabilities of it so far.

With fast, cheap, safe transactions; Optimism has proven their technology compared to several other layer 2s that create a seamless experience for our users.

We've focused on creating tools for developers and users such as token lockers/creating a secondary swap for higher risk tokens/perpetual trading and many more. Now with Optimism supporting Base with the shared governance and revenue-sharing feedback is proof of this.

bio: A media hub highlighting Web3 tech's role in positive social change.
contributionDescription: Web3ForGood is a media community run by two friends in the nonprofit and social impact sectors. We publish a weekly newsletter, "This Week in Web3ForGood," aiming to demystify Web3 tech for social impact professionals. The platform serves as a bridge between tech builders and those focused on social change, offering educational opportunities and content at the intersection of tech and impact. Notably, the newsletter introduced the concept of Optimism to a curious yet skeptical audience. This sparked interest in Quadratic Funding, Impact Certificates, the Merge, and Rollups, leading to a detailed series on Optimism. Growth has been organic, emphasizing the community's value in facilitating meaningful discourse.

impactDescription: With 82 editions, Web3ForGood expands Web3 and social impact knowledge beyond the usual tech-savvy circles, introducing Optimism to a broader audience. As a reliable resource, it educates and supports professionals in tech and social impact. The newsletter not only demystifies Optimism but keeps readers updated on Web3's potential for positive change.

bio: brifing
contributionDescription:
[RetroPGF 3](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/retropgf-3/) will allocate 30m OP tokens to ****reward contributions that have supported the development and adoption of Optimism. 

Every type of developer and contributor is eligible for RetroPGF. It doesn’t matter if you’re building a consumer app, a key piece of infra that Optimism pays for, or a free-to-use community tool that Optimists love. **If you’re providing impact, you are eligible!**

Your application will be used by badgeholders to decide on how much OP you should receive **based on the impact you already had on the Optimism Collective**. We recommend you take time to fill out your application and start early.

bio: Working @comet
Downstream is an MMO implemented as a fully onchain, Autonomous World.
contributionDescription:
Downstream is a game, with logic and state all controlled by smart contracts. The game design focusses on emergent gameplay where players are guided to write and deploy their own game extensions to the chain. 

Currently deployed to a fork of OP Stack that is settling on goerelli, all code is open source, including smart contracts, backend service and the browser game client.

The game as a whole represents a significant contribution as a working example of an Autonomous World but there are also many specific, open source,  onchain game primitives implemented including:

  - Session Key signing. 
  - Multiplayer Optimistic Updates. 
  - Automatic Indexing. 
  - Automatic plugin loading.   
  - Player deployment tools.

impactDescription:
Playmint is a leading developer in the growing Autonomous World builder community. We actively engage other builders in the tools and techniques we have developed.

We speak at hackathons, Ethereum conferences and Autonomous Worlds events about the technical and design challenges we have overcome.

More than a dozen onchain builders took part in a week-long technical test that demonstrated they could permissionlessy extend downstream.

bio: Web3 Marketing Platform
contributionDescription: Web3 Analytic has enabled several Optimism projects - Synthetix, Kwenta, Perp, Lyra and Aevo - to identify potential users based on their on-chain activity and reach out to them through connected social channels like Twitter, Lens, Farcaster, Debank, Discord and XMTP messaging. This helps them grow their user bases.
impactDescription:
Here are more details of how we've helped OP Collective Projects:

Kwenta and Synthetix - identify and connect with large on-chain perp traders. Created list of eligible users for Kwenta's on-chain referrals program based on trading history.
Aevo - identify and connect with large on-chain derivatives traders.
Perp - understand customer segmentation and develop hot tub vaults strategy. Messaging users.
Lyra - identify and connect with large option traders for upcoming V2 launch.

bio: A College dropout pursuing her dreams
contributionDescription:
Problem Space #1: Capture Resistance
Optimism Governance’s first responsibility is to ensure that no single party can unilaterally control, censor, halt, or otherwise extract rent from Optimism. A decentralized compute layer is hardly valuable if controlled by a centralized entity. Governance helps the Collective make decisions in the absence of any one person or organization that is “in charge.”

bio: The pioneer blockchain explorer to navigate shard blob transactions.
contributionDescription:
- Created and deployed a documentation site detailing usage, guides, troubleshooting, etc.
- Deployed public REST API.
- Web App Upgrades:
 - Enhanced block, blob txs, and blob views, along with a revamped homepage for richer insights.
 - Improved stats view with interactive time series charts and added new metrics: gas expenditure comparison, blob price, fee, gas usage, etc.
- Backend Upgrades:
 - Migrate the indexer to Rust and improve its performance, robustness, and reliability.
 - Support for Google Storage and Eth Swarm as blob data storage layers with auto-propagation mechanism.
- Repository Refinements:
 - Added integration tests and telemetry support for advanced observability.
 - Enhanced CI/CD process, achieved full dockerization, and integrated Sentry for error tracking.
contributionLinks: [{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://blobscan.com","description":"Blobscan explorer."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://docs.blobscan.com","description":"Blobscan documentation."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://api.blobscan.com","description":"Blobscan REST API."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/Blobscan/blobscan","description":"Blobscan monorepo with the code of the REST API, web and documentation sites."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/Blobscan/blobscan-indexer.rs","description":"The indexer for the Blobscan explorer implemented in Rust."},{"type":"GITHUB_REPO","url":"https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-helm-charts/tree/master/charts/blobscan","description":"Blobscan's Helm chart as part of EthPandaOps's Ethereum Helm charts repository."},{"type":"OTHER","url":"https://dencun-devnet-9.ethpandaops.io/","description":"Latest Dencun devnet release."}]
impactDescription:
We have contributed to the ongoing effort of the EF's DevOps team EthPandaOps on the EIP-4844 by being the go-to solution for visualizing, examining, and navigating blob shard txs, as well as ensuring blob data persistence and its consistent availability through our web app and REST API.

Blobscan has been integrated as a core tool into the EIP-4844 development stack. It has been notably integrated into ethPandaOps's Helm charts repository for easy Kubernetes deployment. The DevOps team runs their own dedicated instance of our explorer as well. We have extended support for every devnet, and as of now, have supported seven releases.

bio: Digital Laboratory building public goods for cities
contributionDescription:
Since 2020, zenbit.eth has undertaken an extensive collaborative research and development initiative with 27 talented individuals with a diverse skill set, from around the world. Together, they have developed over 25 public Open Source Projects, primarily at ETH Global hackathons.

These digital solutions encompass seven categories, leveraging advanced Ethereum technologies to address cities´ challenges like transparency, efficiency, and coordination. Our main contribution is the development of over 60 Solidity contracts deployed across multiple EVMs, with ≈28% of these contracts tested on the Optimism mainnet or Op Goerli networks. This has resulted in gas fee expenditure of  .116 ETH, bridging ≈10 ETH to the OP mainnet, and locking ≈4k USD in 2 OP chains until 2026.
